My college theater just had a special screening last night of this film . I have got to say that it is a really good film and one that I would like everyone to experience. I highly recommend it. The film is about the true story of a father and daughter who try to flee to Mexico in the early 60s . The daughter is pregnant and is suffering from a serious mental illness . It is a film that I think anyone who is struggling with personal or mental health will appreciate. This is not a film for the faint hearted as it will make you think a lot.

Before I forget , let me say the artwork in here is outstanding . From garbage cans to the huge mech , the detail is just incredible and even the texture work on all the items is done amazingly . This is definitely one you don't have to miss . I also want to thank my Santa for picking something that i was personally interested in . I'm not a big mech person , but i was glad he got something i would be interested in as well as that he gave me a little bit of insight on it as well . This is really a cool thing .

Coming from the "druggie" generation, I thought this movie was hilarious. It definitely brought Jekyll & Hyde up-to-date, so to speak. My husband and I laughed all the way through it. Would love to have the movie in my collection. I told my two teenagers about the movie and they would love to see it. They aren't into drugs but they know enough about them to understand the comedy in the movie. It's been so long since I've seen it I can't remember but a few things.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline. I go to the movies as an escape, to leave everything behind and enjoy a "story". I found this to be a good movie, not great, but good. It was worth my money and my tears :)Diane Lane was wonderful as always, Richard Gere isn't an over-actor. He held his own and has a certain presence that we always come to expect. He brings his own style to the movie.I think it was the kind of love story that doesn't always get told.

The Simpsons of course started off with Christmas special "Simpson's Roasting On An Open Fire" which had basic drawings and not laugh out loud jokes, but this episode has probably the first laugh out loud joke in it and from here the show just gets better and better. This episode centers around Bart who in this episode swaps on a test from Martin and gets into a school for the highly gifted, this leading to Bart mending his friendship with his Dad and losing all of his mates. The Episode is very humorous and shows what was to become the greatest show ever to come out.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie. I am not saying this lightly. I love movies and am fairly picky about them (my home DVD collection is over 9,000 movies - some are great, others are OK, a few I do not like at all). And, to all those with criticisms: this is a comedy. I simply love this movie. It is light, funny, and very restful. I am aware of all (or most) of the deficiencies but I love it.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly ( 1936-1959 ) is a tour de force for biographers and film historians as well as Holly fans who want to get to grips with the man and his songs. The film explores Holly's life and career up to his tragic death on February 2, 1959 when the crash of the Piper Aerostar on icy Lake Eerie claimed the lives of his wife and three of his close friends and fellow musicians. It is a fact that Holly's songs have never been as popular since his death.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic boundaries. For instance, you have a black millionaire, you have a Jew, you have a woman, you have a Latino and you have an Irishman. In this case, a black man wants to make some money, a Jewish man wants to make money, a black woman wants to marry a Jewish guy, a Latina wants to marry a Mexican guy and the Irish guy wants to marry a Jewish guy. The Irish guy gets in the way.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel , I have to say that I found that the acting was not very good. Not to mention that it seemed that the cast of this series consisted of a bunch of wannabes. I thought that if the acting was this bad, the plots wouldn't be worth watching. Boy was I wrong. I will not even try to describe the plots of these 3 episodes. Let me just say that all of them deal with the "ticking time bomb situation" in one way or the other.

The film isn't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch. I am the first one to agree that Victor Fox isn't really that attractive and his music and style are pretty cheesy. I also agree that the film has some odd distractions and some scenes don't work well. So what? If it makes you smile and you enjoy it who cares? Does every film have to make sense? Does every film have to be perfect? No. A person could get razed admitting that they love this film. Again, so what?

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade . She smokes and drinks . She does n't have a lot to do with men . And she is a bit awkward when she is with her boyfriend . Jenny Lewis is trying to get a job as a bartender . So , Jenny is doing all the work that she wants . But she is very awkward when she is around the boyfriend . She smokes and does n't have to think about doing her job . And she is very awkward . Jenny Lewis does n't seem to get a lot of attention from men .

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO , regardless of the age of the OAV . The plot and the characters don't seem very well defined , as they are very generic . This is one of the few OAV's from the '80's that I would say you have to see to believe . I will admit though , this OAV was a big hit with young children in those days , and it's really not hard to see why . I remember watching it when I was little and I thought it was a pretty good show .

WTF ! ! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending ? ? The Notebook was good ... but I was hoping that I would not have to go through this ...

WTF ! ! The Notebook was good ... I was hoping that I would not have to go through this . But I guess that's what happens when one gets attached to a character. But I didn't read the book ... so I don't know how it was really. But I would like to see a book/movie come out of this ! ? WTF ! ! The Notebook was good ...

I 've been watching Attack Of The Show religiously for about 6 months ( maybe longer but not much ) and now I have decided to make a topic where I can discuss the show and everything Attack Of The Show. So if you're interested in the show check out these topics and see if you're interested. Enjoy the show guys. :)

I actually like the show and enjoy it, but the problem is that there's very little to the show, and almost every episode. I would love if there was a little more content in each episode, especially when it comes to the news.

This film , winning Im Kwon-Taek the Best Director at Cannes in 2002 ( tied with P.T . Anderson for "Magnolia") , was shot almost entirely by hand , using no special effects and minimal CGI ( one computerized tracking shot )... it is a film about people, and an honest one at that - for all intents & purposes the only people who care about the characters are the director , actors , and his friends. This is a truly human experience. A film about a family that is forced to spend a weekend together during a tense period in their relationship.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people . The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of growing up , learning to accept change , accepting responsibility for ones actions and then learning to love oneself. There are plenty of people out there who are young and in their twenties , and have the life , the money , the friends , the boyfriends and girlfriends of their dreams , and yet are still unhappy . It's all very sad and I understand that , and I would like to have the life they have , and yet I feel a certain longing for something more.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I 've ever seen . Not only it 's a story , its a story that leaves you thinking and talking long after the episode ends . If you are looking for an addictive thrill ride , then you are looking for the right place . The acting , the story and the production value of the show is simply unparalleled . It 's like a great book that will take you on a journey and leave you wanting for a second round . If you 're a fan of TV shows , you would love watching this show .

As I have said before , I am NOT a fan of Tweety . He 's just so aggravating I cannot stand him . In the first two cartoons , he does have a part , however , I do like Tweety 's personality . He is annoying and is always getting into trouble , even if he 's trying to help , Tweety gets in trouble , so we just have to sit and watch him and his 'friends' get into a pickle . Well , last week , Tweety had his first solo appearance in a cartoon , I really did not care for it much .

Just about every commentator has mentioned the way that some of the interview footage is superposed over the concert footage in places. This is true, and is the biggest flaw of this film. However, it isn't so often, or so bad, that one shouldn't see this video. If you are a Black Sabbath fan, you have to see this. Aside from having seen Black Sabbath in the Sevnties and early Eighties, I saw them in 2005 or 2006 when they also headlined OZZfest just like in this video.

These days, you rarely come by a kid's show that does not involve 1) a preteen/teen pop star who is as amusing as watching paint dry 2) involve a plot about finding the perfect date with a different guy/girl every time 3) revolves around erratic yelling and unintelligible humor. About 95% of shows on Disney, Nickelodeon, and Cartoon Network fit the listed criteria. To put in simpler terms, they all lack good acting, originality, and good story telling. It as if producers and writers think kids aren't smart enough to understand character development and plot detail.

it's a great movie for the whole family. i don't think many people have seen it cause i ask people and they say that they've never heard of it before. Sophie Heyman is my aunt's sister in law. my favorite scene is the whole movie i can't even pick a favorite scene. my favorite character is Hubert because he is a funny yet smart dog. if someone hasn't seen it they are missing out on a great adventure. i've only seen it cause my aunt is related to Sophie and she got a copy from her.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White , Cinderella , or Bambi , but it IS a very good cartoon for kids and young adults to enjoy. I am not familiar with the characters and it was easy to follow along with. There was only one problem, I don't know why but it was very difficult for me to read the English subtitles. The story line is very simple. It is about two children who try to stay out all night, get lost and then meet their friend. They then get lost again but are able to find their friend again.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative , but I loved this movie . I was so excited about it and I thought it was beautiful and moving . It was great to see this film again and see the characters that I know and love in such detail . I thought it was so well-acted and performed , it made me believe in this film and I can’t wait to see what this film will do on the big screen next year . It was such a well-written story and this film is so well acted .

This is one of my favourite Disney films. It has everything you could hope for in a Disney animation: cute animals, great songs, a nasty villain and lots of adventure. The story begins in Paris, where aristocat Duchess and her three kittens live with their Mistress in a mansion. Life is perfect for them until the Mistress' fiendish butler Edgar discovers that she plans to leave her entire fortune to the cats. He realises that if he even stands a chance of claiming the fortune, the cats will be out of the way.

A well written screenplay. A moving story showing the middle class English at it's best. Some great acting by Tom Wilkinson and Emily Watson. Tom Wilkinson is one of Britain's best actors. He knows how to be subtle and honest. Emily Watson is an actress I was not familiar with, but to her credit she does a great job of playing the ****** wife. The director, Julian Fellowes did not succumb to the typical Hollywood gimmicks to give the film some meaty storyline. It has not over dramatized it's portrayal of the English middle class.

At first I did n't think I would like this movie , but as it progressed it became better and more interesting . It's about a family , three brothers , their father , his girlfriend , and of course the girl's mother . As the story goes on their father becomes sick and is taken to a hospital . While there he passes out and the doctor starts to think he may not pull through . But it is a happy ending in the end ! This was one of the first movies I got from the library. I was intrigued by this movie , since it was a black and white film .

Really, This movie should be released to DVD. I just got a bootleg copy of what I think was a studio film and I was utterly pleased!!! It was on my list of films to own simply because of the cast. Three of my PEOPLE, Michael York, Olivia Hussey. Both having been in Romeo & Juliet, and also John Gielghud. sorry about the bad spelling, were in there so on that alone I thought that for the small amount I was spending it would be fine. Boy was I right.

The Aristorcats is a hilarious film that not many people have seen . Clearly not that many because it only had its premiere last night at Tribeca. What makes this film so funny is not so much in its story and script. The Aristorcats film is so funny because of all the characters that we get to see onscreen, even the ones we don’t know about yet. I am speaking of the supporting cast. Even though we get to see them for a short time, they make us want to stay in the theater just to see them on screen again.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly ( 1936-59 ) . He does have a certain physical similarity to Buddy, with big hands and feet. I had never heard of this movie until the other night. When I saw it on tv, it was at a time when I was home with my family and I was sitting with mom and dad and my brother and sisters watching TV. I watched the first few minutes of it and all I saw was Busey. I just thought that Busey would be perfect to play Buddy Holly.

Not sure why the other comment on this film was so negative, but I loved this movie. I am a student of Asian art with a particular love of Korean art, culture and history. I thought this movie borough a very controversial and interesting character to life. Jang Seung-up is one of the (maybe the most) famous Korean artist and continues to be revered as a master. Given the tumult of the time in which he painted and his own conflicted nature, it is amazing that he produced so much work, in so many styles and with such skill.

This movie got better with time. I can't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this at the age of 15. Yes, that's right. Movie ratings were not yet a reality, so any teenager could walk into any movie. Imagine what it was like for a kid my age to see both Midnight Cowboy and Putney Swope in the same year. Imagine the times. Bobby Kennedy and Martin Luther King has just been killed but the following summer had a man walking on the moon and Woodstock. Putney Swope was the Woodstock nation's chance to stick it to the man.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon . I loved the film so when I saw that a new musical version was in the making, I couldn’t wait for it to come out to see my favorite movie brought to life once again. The movie starred Peter O’Toole, Omar Sharif, and Anthony Quayle. Now I’ll be honest, I really wasn’t that impressed with the musical, but I loved the music and the songs. The music was composed by Stephen Warbeck and is sung by a young Robert Wyatt who was then in the Byrds.

It amazes me that production companies will sue because of reproductions they will not supply. I've been looking for this movie on DVD for a while and VHS for years. One can get all sorts of movies on line...old movies, new movies... but it all targets a particular group. This movie is very nostalgic for many. I'm not sure why I can't get a copy. Maybe if enough people will write in, the copyright holder will get a clue. It's about time for this to happen. Yes, it's date, but so is The Wizard of OZ.

This is one of those films where it is easy to see how some people wouldn't like it. My wife has never seen it, and when I just rewatched it last night, I waited until after she went to bed. She might have been amused by a couple small snippets, but I know she would have had enough within ten minutes.Head has nothing like a conventional story. The film is firmly mired in the psychedelic era. It could be seen as filmic surrealism in a nutshell, or as something of a postmodern acid trip through film genres.

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a football game or they don't want to leave their car "to get stripped" deserves whatever happens to them.The guy, Wade who "went to a barbershop and asked for the He-Man haircut" wasn't my type, but there's this really cute scene of him having his eyebrows and facial hair waxed. That's a little too high-maintenance for me. Also fun, but not my type is the fat guy in the big sunglasses who looks "like Elton John only gayer," but that whole plot goes nowhere!

the first time I saw this movie , I just thought `` what the hell ? '' a 10-year-old kid is going to do something as cool as this ? , the action starts off with the camera flying through a car window , and it looks like a scene from a movie , after that , we see the boy on the bike in the street , and he jumps a bike rack and crashes into a light pole , but it was just as if you were watching a movie , this scene is awesome ! the whole movie is full of the same scene after scene of this , and it's just so cool !

A beautifully photographed and paced short film. It evocatively captures the feeling of this family and much of the country during the period just prior to and after Pearl Harbor.I appreciated the visual look of the film -- naturalistic and simultaneously poetic. Great work by a great D.P., David Boyd.Though a family film, the story never becomes maudlin or saccharin. We understand and believe the motivation that propels the young boy on his odyssey. I understand the love of the younger brother for his older brother and do not question why he sets out to do what he does.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n ' roll . The young singer/songwriter , who would have been born on February 2 1942 , had a short life , cut short at the age of 22 when his plane crashed into a snow covered mountain near Elko Nevada in 1959 . His first solo single was the haunting "Rave On". It was a Top 10 hit which was followed by a string of Top 20 hits such as the No 1 "I Need Your Love" and "Have Love Will Travel" .

The cover of the VHS says it all : `` Without doubt , the most powerful movie of its kind to date ! '' It's hard to believe that what we're about to witness here is the first of only two releases, but it seems that the makers of this film had more than enough confidence in what they were offering to give it a first and only VHS edition . Although it may seem strange to call a film like this one of the greatest horror movies ever made, we can't deny that if it wasn't for the genre , we would not be watching the film now .

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian film buffs, and I have to admit it is a film that is not only fun but will keep you engrossed throughout the whole duration. The film is directed by Vijay Kumar and co-produced by Jayantilal Gada. It is the story of a young Indian girl, Maya, who goes to America to pursue higher studies. She works as a maid for an upper middle-class American family and lives with them till she finds her own quarters.

My Architect is a great film about Nathaniel Kahn 's search for himself via the legacy of his famous Architectural father George. Nathaniel is in a constant search for his place in the world. In the course of the film, we watch his relationship with his father. We also get to watch Nathaniel's struggle to become a more authentic and more independent person. Nathaniel Kahn is a contemporary Architect who lives in New York City. As his Architectural practice grows, his relationship with his father George, a renowned architect, gets increasingly complex.

I just saw this film and I recommend it . It has a very good plot , it holds your interest and the film is very intense . I would say you will need a lot of patience to follow it all and to see it in all of it's length , but it is worth the time it takes to see this film. The acting is very good and the plot is well put together. There are a lot of surprises in the film which are very good and exciting . I give the movie a 10/10 and I highly recommend it .

"Nuovomondo" was a great experience. Many filmmakers tell their stories to a big extent via dialogue. Emanuele Crialese directs his film very visually driven. For everything he wants to tell, he finds powerful images that are able to stand for themselves. Thus, he understands film as a medium that primarily tells its stories over the pictures on screen. Particularly European cinema is often very dialogue-driven (and many of the young US-American directors are strongly influenced by that). Crialese's opposite attitude was really the point, that made this film special for me.

This was the greatest movie I have ever seen in my life, the action was great, and i was so scared, there was a lot of gore WHICH MADE It GREAT, i would see it 1,000 more times, and Paris Hilton, D*MN she fine in that movie. But anyway, i would recommend it to anybody, even kids(like me) Adults like it to. You would probably have nightmares at night though, but beside that, IT IS AWESOMe, I CANT STOP BRAGGING ABOUT IT.

Considering it's basically low-budget cast, this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock pioneer Buddy Holly. Gary Busey stars as Holly, who was one of the first to use an electric guitar for pretty much all his music. Backed up by his Crickets, Holly had a string of hits and became a bona fide star before his death in a plane crash along with Richie Valens and The Big Bopper. The film follows his rise to stardom, marriage to his sweetheart and eventual death. I like this film and believe that you will too.

I never thought I 'd say this about a biopic , but there is a near over-abundance of characterization (which is a good thing if you want a character-driven drama , but bad if all you want is an accurate depiction of events) , and too much talking. I had a hard time getting into the film. The characters all sound the same, and I wasn't buying any of it (at first anyway). But when the actual story started, I really enjoyed it . And the acting was excellent.

I thought this movie was pretty good!OK, so maybe it had a few scenes that could make people think of other horror movies, but i have seen a lot more pathetic movies that got much higher ratings than this! Many movies nowadays are remade to a more modern version and there's nothing wrong with that, it keeps the story alive. i don't think this movie was pathetic at all and i'm not just saying that because i'm a major Chad Michael Murray fan, but because i enjoyed it.

The best thing from the American Pie "bakery." I found the humor and the plot to be far more engaging audience than any of the American Pie movies to date. .Also concerning the appropriateness of the content I found this to be acceptable to a much larger audience than any of the previous American Pie movies. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie experience. When the movie first came out I read a number of negative reviews and ended up not going to see it while it was still in the theater...I now regret that decision.

After seeing The Aristocats : Special Edition in a two pack with The Fox in the Hound , I decided that this was the perfect time to pick up these two old favorites. It was the perfect time, because not only are they re-mastered, but they also come out just in time for Halloween. So what better time to share with you all the latest updates, news, trailers and special editions of The Aristocats, The Fox in the Hound and The Aristocats: Special Edition that will be released for the first time on Blu-Ray and DVD on November 20th, 2015!

This is one of my favorite films, ever. The story is just so fantastic and the characters are so good. Unlike the other Disney films of the age, this film never bores the audience. 101 Dalmations, Peter Pan, Robin Hood, they were all good, but lack what we have here. This is funny, creative, and always on target. This movie just has an extra something that you can't learn in books. However, this is not the best animated film ever made. That title belongs to the BRILLIANT Toy Story.

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good. And of course by that I mean Wilkinson. The other two principals were "decent". But the characters themselves...what on earth was so bad about the character Wilkinson played (James Manning)? I didn't see him behaving like the martinet Emily Watson accused him of being. Bill Bule, on the other hand, was an insufferable jerk who I was praying would meet an extremely brutal and prolonged demise. Who was I kidding? Tom Wilkinson isn't Paul Bettany after all.

I just had the opportunity to see 'Nuovomondo ' ( hitherto known in the U.S. as 'The Golden Door ' ) at a theatre in Washington, D.C., and while I'm not a film-maker or even really interested in movies I found the film to be extremely interesting and moving in it's own way. The story is a fictional account of events in World War II. It centres on the life of a young Polish Jew who is forced into exile and into the Warsaw Ghetto when his entire family is murdered by the Nazis.

There's no point in comparing this with the original series. Though different in look and content, both are true to the original idea. That is, an SF/horror anthology series. Due to indifferent scheduling in Australia, I've only managed to catch a small number of episodes spread over the first few seasons. The very first episode really did give me the creeps (nightmares at my age ...!) but a number of others did fall flat; generally when the stories moved into horror realms and away from SF. I only hope the DVDs reach us eventually.

Not a stunner , but a good movie to see once or twice . Bill Macy shows he can do drama well . And if I had been in that class, I might have liked it more. I enjoyed it . It has its flaws , but I didn't feel cheated . It is a well made film , directed and acted by very talented people . But there are times when I wish I was there to experience it in the movie theater . That is not to say it's not good for TV .

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was. I was looking forward to it after reading the plot (even though I find Nirvana overrated). It sounded like it would be tons of fun but it was more than that. Jansen puts in little touches like the books (Kubrick book among others), movie posters, etc. I like when I see a director takes his time and put his heart into a film. And you can really feel that in this.

Yes, at times "Unconditional Love" overwhelms as it bounces -- no, as it ricochets -- from one story element to another in the most unconventional use of thematic elements and characters. In fact, it wasn't until I watched the film for the second time that I began to understand what I think P.J. Hogan might have been attempting to do with this quirky, unconventional flick. Perhaps the entire film itself is a metaphor for the unconditional love for which Grace (Kathy Bates) yearns and describes in the later part of the film.

Hey look , you do n't watch this movie to change your life ! But if you are female especially , you may get some ideas to change your life . The movie is called "Beautiful Girl " and is the story of a rich man's daughter and her love with a poor girl . I am not going to give away details , but I recommend you watch the movie , and see how the story unfolds . If you are a guy who wants a girlfriend , you may watch this movie as inspiration for your love story , with me .

No , I have not seen the original series and I wo n't compare the two if I had . I watched the originals when they were first airing in syndication in the early 70's , but never again did I see a version of the series in any way , shape or form ( except for an Italian version in the late 60's , and again in the mid- 70's ) . So , the only version I know of are the series from the 60's - 80's . I can't say I've been able to identify the original series in a way that anyone else would find useful .

I know this movie isn't for everyone, and I won't push my opinions on you, but what I have to say is the truth about how many people feel about this movie...It was the best I have ever seen!!! It was soooooooooooooooooo funny, and even though it wasn't the scariest movie I had ever seen, it kept me on the edge of my seat, because I didn't know what was gonna happen next. If you like funny scary movies, you have got to see this one!

By convincing the Prime Minister to back the totally unsuitable Ali G as a candidate for Staines in the local elections, nasty chancellor David Carlton (Charles Dance) hopes to discredit his party's current leader, thus enabling him to seize power. To his surprise, however, the plan backfires, Ali is embraced by the nation, and Carlton is forced to find other ways to try and guarantee his political future.Puerile, crude, misogynistic, and always outrageous: Ali G Indahouse, the big-screen debut outing for Sascha Baron Cohen's middle-class Berkshire gangsta, is all of these things and much moremeaning it's my kind of film!

Chucky's back...and it's about time! This time, with the help of Jennifer Tilly and a little spell from Voodoo For Dummies. Well, at least with this installment, the camp is back. This was the more gruesome of this series, so far. It has some good twists and some good action scenes. This one was by far, the most fun of the series, and successfully, if unintentionally, bridges the gap between pure horror to horror/comedy. I am looking forward to Seed of Chucky. It'll be a hoot!

Warning -- this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story is told by was so traumatized by it he died of a heart attack on the same day as the film was shown for a second time to the public

This was a film that was very shocking to watch, I never thought that things could be so disgusting. But, I had to find out how things got so far and I'm glad that I watched this film because I know a lot better about it. I hope you all enjoy it.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be . Terrible acting ! Implausible scenerios ! Ridiculous death scenes ! Unneccessary violence! A complete waste of time. I can see why some people like this flick , but I have no sympathy for those who love it. This flick is awful. I mean the script and acting is horrible but what really grinds my gears is all of the gratuitous scenes of gun and gore that are shown in it. It's not even worth watching if you think you like this genre. Its so bad it's actually funny.

This has got to be one of the most magnificent things I 've ever seen on film . I do hope this comes out as a DVD or something of this nature . It reminds me of a few other films , most of which are not on DVD at the moment , and for which I have an unfulfilled wish for a DVD . This is one of those things that I could watch a hundred times over if I had access to a good quality DVD version . The photography is incredible , the sets are so beautiful , the action is exciting , and the storyline is so good .

Jeff Garlin 's film is filled with heart and laughter . As in Curb Your Enthusiasm , his screen persona is that of a loser who is just barely getting by . In the movie version of his real-life life story , as in Larry David's sitcom , he keeps getting thrown into situations that are the epitome of a slapstick comedy . And yet, the movie isn't a spoof of his life story -- it's about his life -- and what it's like to go through the life of a person who's always been an outsider .

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort , and Charlie Chaplin was no different. He starred in a series of propaganda films , which became some of the best films of his entire career. But, while they all had their political themes and messages , one film in particular is remembered by fans for something else. 10 Meet Mr. Smith

While most people know Charlie Chaplin as the Chaplin of the classics , he actually had a lot of success before he made all of those great movies .

It 's up there with Where 's Poppa , The Groove Tube , Putney Swope . It memorializes the NY Rangers ' first NHL Stanley Cup in 1942 , and is located on the site of where the famous Garden stood. It's a big deal to be in this place , so I'm gonna share a little history with y'all to help you decide if you should check it out. The following is taken from 'The History of the New York Rangers' and I've added a little blurb at the end, so if you want to go to the source, that's the place to do it.

This movie is an awesome remake of the original by the same title. The movie was cool,despite the fact, I hate new ones! All of the cast was awesome . It has great cast and an awesome plot!! The main plot is a man is poisoned and he has to solve his own murder , neat eh? !Dennis Quaid is the man who is "D.O.A"(in other words Dead On Arrival).He finds help with his friends, but everyone is now a suspect! !Dennis's character has several hours to find out who poisoned him.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but with great respect. I think the message is clear: if you are thinking of having an abortion, you need to think about the fact that there are other women out there who have also thought about ending their pregnancy but have decided not to. I think that this film does a good job of making these other women a part of the film and they do a very good job of making you think about the decision to abort or carry to term.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character. The humour is very much a 'like it or love it' brand of totally politically incorrect, irreverent and self effacing type.Personally I totally love this film, and so has everyone i have met who has seen it. You can watch it several times and pick new gags up each time. The humour is both aural and visual, and the timing is impeccable. The humour is probably very English, and specifically London, so its possible that non-English viewers may not get some of the humour.

I've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer, and I'm so glad now that I have. It's truly a wonderful film. The actors are superb, the writing is fresh and real, the whole thing was just spot-on. I love James McAvoy in this, and I can't wait to see him in "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" movie this December. Romola Garai is wonderful too. Be sure to check her out in "I Capture the Castle" or "Nicholas Nickleby," two of my favorite films.

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on this planet. Being a staggering five years in the making, one would be hard-pressed to expect any less. I did get the impression that some scenes from the first episode where repeated in the latter ones, which is naturally only a minor gripe.David Attenborough is great as a narrator and comments are informative, leaving enough room for one's imagination, and well spaced out, so that viewers get plenty of time to reflect upon the breathtaking imagery.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall it’s a good piece of work. I really like it when a director does not think they’re above making this sort of movie because I’m old enough to appreciate that it was made for the sole reason to entertain us. And that’s how i feel this movie is made. The characters and story aren’t exactly good but they are very well written to make us laugh and to make us feel for these characters.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918 . In fact , at the time of its release , it was a full-length animated film , clocking in at more than 30 minutes . Today , as it stands, it is about 5 minutes. This is a film that has the power to stir up emotions and make the audience laugh . . . . This is the first of two stories about a boy who finds himself in a series of events that lead him into a world that he never dreamed of.

This movie was great . It had everything a true action fan could want . Plenty of people getting shot and blown to pieces . Good fight scenes . Awesome car stunts . And a good storyline . This movie had it all ! And the special effects were awesome . The only negative thing that i can say about this movie is that it was really slow at first ,but after that it was great . I give this 5 stars . You will be glad that you saw this movie ,it will keep you entertained the whole way through ! So see it .

Undoubtedly one of the best episodes ever , Balance of Terror is 45 minutes of well executed suspense , with some of the best dialogue in Trek history. As the Enterprise prepares for its maiden voyage , the crew is preparing to make a dangerous and secret mission into Klingon space . The mission will lead them into battle with a group of rogue Klingon renegades known as The Klingons , who are bent on establishing a new and dangerous empire . Captain Kirk and first mate Spock lead the way with the crew, including the Enterprise 's first officer Dr .

This is a good film for die-hard Chucky fans . Okay I 'm sure it 's not as good as I think , I 'm a big fan myself . The first one was pretty amazing . This one is ok , but nothing really spectacular . It has some good moments , mainly due to the performances , but it 's nowhere near as good like the original . There are a few funny moments , but no real scares . I think if you 're a die hard chucky fan , this isn 't for you . You 're really going to be disappointed .

Telling the story wouldn't be the point at all, would it? Barnens ö, spelled almost like "booné aww" is the title for that brilliant novel of the late seventies that shocked a lot of people, including myself.Children's Island is the title, and what an island. In the book, Raine, the main character has The Guiness World Record Book as his own Bible. And he's keen on breaking new records himself. In particular the youngest person under water for three minutes.The story is, as most Swedish films and books of the time, deep, consciously provocative and awe inspiring.

I usually give horror films around 6/10 , but this one caught my eye . House of Wax was by no means original , but the storyline was very well written . It was simple and to the point . The only issue i had is that i didnt like the twist on the end . I wasnt expecting that . I really liked how the story was told . The only bad thing about it is the poor quality of some of the makeup , but that really doesnt effect me too much because im not too into the whole gore and horror side of things .

I first saw The Victim ( aka Out Of Contention ) well over 25 years ago when I was very much in my early twenties. It was the summer of 1985 and the only decent movie playing at my local multiplex was Teen Witch. I know that’s not saying much but that was about as much variety as we were getting around where I lived then. So I saw Out Of Contention, which was playing on VHS, at one of my sister’s house a few weeks later and was pleasantly surprised.

Gary Busey 's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography . Since had a musical background , he was able to do a better job of portraying someone who's not a musician but rather a singer/songwriter . The problem with a biography of someone like , however , is that you end up spending much more time in his life as a celebrity in the world of rock and roll than as a person . This is where the biography of begins to fall apart as the author makes a few too many attempts at explaining things to the audience .

`` Live Together , Die Alone '' is divided into three main story lines , and each one of them have their own story to tell , and they are all linked to each other with the same theme. The first is about love , the second is about friendship , the final is about revenge , and they form the heart of the game in a very clever way. The first part , the part about love , is pretty short and takes place a few months after the main events , but the other parts are actually the longest ones , and they also have a good amount of content at their disposal .

An interesting look at the immigrant experience , told as a fable with some very weird imagery.I got drawn to this fable in the beginning. I love fables - the old fashioned type that's easy to read but has a lot of information. And this is just such a good one.I have a couple of niggles. Firstly, why would you leave the country you come from? I know they have all the problems they're facing, but surely the best thing to do is to come over here and fix the problems they've got.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time. Then I bought the video and watched it countless times. Every time I watch it, I can get something else out of it. It's a real testament to wanting to hold onto a life that was good, but now the world is changing. But you don't have to be older to hold onto the past, even the young characters, like Charlotte don't want things to change. The overall tone and mood is excellent. The cast is outstanding with all-stars like Kathy Bates, Beau Bridges and Arthur Kennedy.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre , but I think this one is done quite well and will keep you interested until the end. I think that it is not a game for everyone , but some of the concepts are great and I think that most of the people who try it, will like it . This is a game for hardcore players only and is quite a hard game to play if you dont know how to solve these puzzles. The puzzles were very well thought out and were not that hard. The graphics are also very well done.

These critics need to find a new job!!! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY, which has made history. It illustrates beautifully how even in the mist of war and tragedy love can conquer all. The breathtaking Chephallonia of Greece has captured my heart and soul as if I too were there. The Blue eyed Cage & the delightful Cruz were amazing! Together they perfectly portrayed how a Mediterranean couple can only become closer in the time of war. This movie will touch your heart like it did mine you must go see it!!! !

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen : much better and deeper than Luhrman's version. (And that's saying something!) I think it's the most romantic and touching movie I have ever seen, it's a beautiful movie about love and forgiveness. I cried like never before, it's perfect. It's really good that it's a Canadian movie because there's no need to talk about how to do things, the people are very friendly. I think the only reason why Luhrmann didn't got nominated was that it was produced by Harvey Weinstein.

Warning--this film has some amazingly graphic images and should never be seen by kids.The artist who this story is all about was indeed a fine Korean painter who rose up from the lowest depths to become their greatest painter. Unfortunately, in so many ways, this guy was also a jerk in so many ways. Some of this was the artistic temperament and what may have seemed annoying was just his demanding nature when it came to art. But, other times he was simply a drunk jerk--especially when he was on his way to becoming a great artist.

I think it definitely is . The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language can pick up the plot of a story as soon as they start reading. However I do feel like the language can be a little too simple for some English speakers. It does a great job of conveying emotions and making you want to find out how it turns out. The only downside to the book is that it can be quite short so it isn’t the best book for long bus journeys. It’s a good story, well written.

For all those people who believe the dialog is worth something, and who appreciate a farce that is clever enough for you to take it seriously, this movie will surprise you. It is not a 'whodunit' for people who can't aren't able to follow the verbal exchange of our hero, Professor Dexter Cornell (Dennis Quaid).Cornell teaches in Southern California, near the tar pits. He has not published a novel in four years, his wife is divorcing him, he drinks a bit much, and is blessed or cursed with caustic wit, which he freely dispenses to his students.

It 's Showtime ! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro 's careers . It 's a series in which Murphy 's character, the slick-talking fast-food king, is trying to regain his position as king of the fast-food restaurants after he has lost it. But the main thing here is the performances by two of the best actors we have in the movie business. Murphy is the kingpin in a fast-food empire run by a former college baseball star (DeNiro ). But he has become so arrogant he no longer gives a second thought to who is running the show.

This is a wonderful movie , and I still love it ! It just so magical and it is fun to look at all the details . There is something for everyone in it , even if you are not into Disney films . The story is fun and interesting . And of course you will want to take a look at it when it is on TV again on the Disney channel . It is also worth watching on the DVD version . You will see a lot more of the film , especially in the last third . So you will love the whole thing , especially if you are a Disney fan .

Films belonging to the "film noir" genre usually contain similar elements: a "deus ex machina" plot twist that drives the main character headlong into bedlam, a pretty but psychotic girl, a handsome but psychotic thug, lots of money, lots of brutality, and usually a denouement in the desert. Think "High Sierra" or "White Heat. "There is plenty of hard-boiled bad film noir out there. But when film noir is good, you can't take your eyes off the train wreck of human lives.It is this latter tradition that "Blind Spot" belongs to.

So it's not an award winner, so what? Have you ever wanted to see a film that was just silly? "The Villain" and this one could top the list.My husband says that "Jekyll and Hyde Together Again" is one of those movies that if "you've been there and done that" you'll think this spoof on the 80's cocaine culture is a riot. I think the whole film is just fun. Nothing is sacred; hospitals, plastic surgery, Howard Hughes.... There are ongoing gags that you have to watch for to appreciate.

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few. The wise can see the wisdom contained in what most call folly.This music may well regain popularity as world consciousness rises. It is about a land "far away from it all" where "living things have room to grow." Its people are "living and growing together" mentally and spiritually faster than in biological age.The lyrics help us recognize the relativity of this "world that is spinning around" and to "look inside yourself; that is where the Truth always lies."

Remember that this came out before Gulf War I, which gave us Werner Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness".Le Dernier Combat is not "Sci Fi". It's more like Judgment. I've watched it at least a dozen times. It really is a fitting companion to Herzog's "Lessons of Darkness": "And in that time, men will seek death, but they will not find it, for death will flee from them. "That someday, alas, may be today, in Iraq.

What a shame this movie was never released. (It is now playing on cable.) I tuned in based on my high regard for the stars and was rewarded by seeing a movie far better than the ones I've been paying to see in theatres recently. I like to be surprised. So often movies are marketed as "offbeat," but are in fact more of the same old recycled drivel. This movie is genuinely different, with the bonus of a heartwarming message. Jonathan Pryce sings like an angel.

Great show ! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps . Contestants range in ages from 18 - 50 . Most of them are just regular folks trying to get by in a very difficult financial climate and many of them are from other states. As you can see from the link, the rules are very specific . In the past contestants have had to live together for several months . There is one more element to the show and that is the requirement that when a couple decides to go on the show, that they must first be married for a few months.

People comparing this movie to big blockbusters like Lord of the Rings or the Matrix will inevitably be disappointed with the way this movie turned out. Although it lacks in the big special effects department and there are no battles with hundreds of extras, there is still a masterful amalgamation of two old folk tales here. The acting talent, although not A-list, is still great and the interaction between the characters is perhaps more sincere than in a larger movie with an A-list cast. My particular favourite from this movie is Bridget Fonda, whose performance as the Snow Queen herself was quite moving, assisted enormously by a stupendous wardrobe and makeup.

"Caribe" is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects. However, it delivers a perfectly enjoyable story, along with a magnificent cinematography. The narrative structure is set around two narrative axes, one of them embedding the other, each one having elements that relate and co-exist in excellent harmony. The story never loses the right pacing, and it shows a very good blending of the human figure with its natural environment (which is a character in itself). The acting is great, and for that we owe credit to the emerging director, Esteban Ramírez.

It reaches the minds and feelings of everyone driving them deep in the black desert. A brutal but beautiful world that is explored through memories and edgy layers of sound and score. The landscape develops its own persona, paralleling the inner geography of all three characters as their stories unfold. The stark void of lost love, the fear of the unknown, and then transcendence of emptiness through the very openness of this desolation. Three misguided souls fighting to find something absolute and positive in all that negative space. The drama is compelling. James Franco and his co-stars deliver deft performances.

William Faulkner was one of the American writers to win the Nobel Prize in literature . Faulkner mostly wrote about American Civil War and Southern Life, and most famous works of his are “As I Lay Dying“, The Sound and The Fury“, Light in August“, and Absalom, Absalom“. He is also best known for the book Absalom, Absalom!“. In this post, we will learn all about the books by William Faulkner in detail. Faulkner also wrote other novels, which have not won the Nobel Prize.
