In my village there was still hope. Everyone was getting ready, and we knew something was going to happen. I waited for it for a month.

this is a teen movie and while u watch it expect some nonsensical stuff added here and there but overall the movie is effective very effective it makes you question and leaves you thinking the story is kinda far fetched but is believable and makes you feel good in sequences, its not like its the usual done and tried path. the characters are pretty well defined and are convincing. Justin long stands out among all the others and watch out for his speech in the end he will convince anyone with that speech he is simply brilliant in that speech.

Belonging to the subgenre of post-apocalyptic future films, it is a stylistic and very very intimate installment. The most noticed element of the film is its silence; no one speaks. I don't think Besson, despite what is evident in most of his later work, meant it as any kind of cool gimmick. I think what makes it so clever and so effective is the fact that with no other way of communicating, everyone has to read each other based on intuition and conveying of emotion, no matter how slight.

A mix of 70's drug humor along with parody of medicine and classic story line. As I've often said about this flick - if you don't get it - you're way lame..... Classic lines such as (parapharsed) "I've got this erection and it won't go away no matter how many times I do it. You're a nurse, what can you give me for it?" Nurse replies "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." Great sound track.The classic "Hyde's got nothing to hide".

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh : as the Monkees reduce their entire career to one shot of their car driving off into the sunset as they're being chased by a police car, all you hear for about 20 seconds is "Oh man, I don't wanna get in trouble, but oh man, I'd love to go to California" (and of course they do). I just watched the film for the very first time. I was never a Monkees fan.

Hey all you jive hustlers, you stone foxes, you mean dudes. Watch out cause Slaughter is back in town! If you are looking for a bad-ass, funky film to watch some night, this is just right. 'Slaughter' is back and trying to take it easy n' relax after his adventures down in Mexico. But if you are a narrow-minded gangster like 'Duncan', you are bound to seek revenge. Why, I don't know. Was 'Hoffo' in the first one his brother or what? Any who.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol . It has singing , the British Guy , A guy who was a rock star before Idol and now he is back , the guy from Idol 2 who was one of the worst contestants , a girl who is a soap star but has been out of the soap world for a long time , an older guy from Broadway that is a singing coach , a guy who was the musical director of the musical Oklahoma and is now working as a singing director and a guy who is on the panel that judges the contestants .

Captain Corelli 's Mandolin is one of Nicolas Cage 's better films . He turns a fine performance as the story's narrator and hero into an over the top, and sometimes even silly, performance as well. And that's not an easy thing to do. But the movie's got a great cast , and Cage is surrounded by a colorful bunch of colorful people . That alone makes it worth seeing. But it 's a real shame that the movie is so muddled that even its actors don't know what happened in it .

I never heard of architect , Louis Kahn , until this documentary . In this almost two hour documentary which is in part biographic and partly analytical , , the life and times of one of the world's most talented architects is presented . The film tells us of his life in his native Lithuania and how this influenced his work as an architect .The documentary presents his early training , the buildings he designed , his ideas and his influence on architecture to this day . The film tells us a great deal about the man , his work and the influence he had on the 20th century .

My husband and I watched this last night ... It was wonderful .... For once he was wrong in guessing my reaction ... I sat and watched and was not bored ... I was captivated ... In fact , I don't know of any other show where you sit and watch two people who you love with so much intensity .... I loved them both ... I was in love before the show was even over ... They both deserve huge congratulations for being amazing on screen .... I am now convinced that this was an amazing couple .... I loved their on and off relationship .... And, of course, how they got together ....

I think it definitely is. The writing is of such a quality that beginner students of the English language should model their conversations after its dialogue. For example, the exchange between Paul Kersey(Bronson) and Ms. Kathryn Davis(Deborah Raffin) (more about this character later) is extremely clear and to the point: Ms. Davis says, "I hope you like chicken. It's the only thing I know how to make," to which Kersey deftly responds, "Chicken's good. I like chicken."

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London(England). Enjoyed it immensely. Although the Crow & the Chinese Policeman don't appear, and Dan Milligan becomes Dan Madigan (played by Sean Hughes (I)). The interaction between Dan and the Author (Writer/Director) voiced/played by Lord Richard Attenborough, works very well.The rumour is that Lord Attenborough and Elliott Gould (as Dr. Goldstein) appeared in the film for just a pint of beer.Spike was shown the film, on video before he died and by all accounts enjoyed it immensely.

I am a guy , so i was very hesitant to watch the movie because i know that Richard Geary was a boy. After watching it, i have to say i really like this movie. I am a guy, so i know nothing about the movie and i dont know anything about this director. The only thing i can tell is that this is probably one of the best movie i ever seen, not just for it's quality but it is a movie that you can just relax in and enjoy the movie without thinking you are wasting your time.

A Formula For Murder isn't a well known Giallo, but that isn't to say it's not a very good one! The film is directed by Alberto De Martino, the man behind cult classics such as The Antichrist and Blazing Magnums. The film was released late on in the Giallo cycle, but more than stands up to many of the films released around the 'golden' period in the early seventies. Despite a lack of logic in some areas, the film works mainly due to the competent way it mixes Argento style death scenes with some genuinely surprising plot twists, and a host of well defined characters.

Between sweeping, extraordinary scenes within a plethora of Indian locations and a plot which is Bollywood inspired yet grounded in reality, this highly moving film is a must-see for those who love a good romance/adventure. And by this, I mean "good", not a Hollywood or Bollywood easy and contrived happy ending. East meets West in a different take on the buddy film. The performances are inspired and brilliant, the cinematography epic and the plot entertaining, engaging and poignant without a trace of schmaltz or cheap tugging at heartstrings. HARI OM is a sweet film that won't rot your teeth.

I watch tons of movies and had no idea this would be as good as it was . I was skeptical when I heard about this and when I saw that it was the director of the Matrix, I thought it would be a flop movie . I was wrong , this movie is so cool and its just like an old time action movie . I would recomend this to fans of the Matrix and all time action movies . It was like watching a live action video game, I was glued to the action and couldn't sleep the next day .

I was pleasantly surprised by the depth of story and character development. Fulci was a master at creating horrific atmosphere using inventive camera work, vivid cinematography, and yes - wonderfully explicit gore.This film is no exception, however, compared to his later films (The Beyond, Zombie 2, City of the Living Dead, House by the Cemetery, etc.) the characters here are extremely well developed and the emphasis shies away from the supernatural and is more on the suspense created by a classic who-dunnit amongst the lush hills of Italy.

Enhanced by the expressive cinematography of Agnes Godard (Beau Travail), Golden Door is a visually striking tone poem that follows the journey of a peasant family from their primitive home in Sicily to Ellis Island in New York at the turn of the century. It is a surreal, enigmatic, often strange, but ultimately deeply rewarding experience. Interweaving dreamlike and symbolic imagery with gritty realism, the latest film by Emanuele Crialese (Respiro) is like an impressionistic painting - a cinematic artist's rendering of what the immigration process may have been like for our parents and grandparents.

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman : TAS and its ilk , I enjoyed it in some strange and surprising way , and I enjoyed it for one very specific reason. There are plenty of things to hate about this episode , it's got a terrible title , it's a mess in terms of production value , it's poorly animated in several places . But there's one thing you can't argue with : it makes fun of itself , and it makes fun of itself really well . I'd recommend watching it even if you've seen the original movie .

I don't see that much wrong with this movie. Granted, the principal singers might not be Luciano Pavarotti and Maria Callas, but they can certainly carry a tune. Burt Bacharach and Hal David are talented songwriters and I happen to love their songs, especially "The World Is A Circle", "The Things That I Will Not Miss", and "Question Me An Answer". Some people claim that Hermes Pan's choreography is ghastly and that the snowy mountain sets look as if they were made of plastic; I disagree on both counts.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one! I watched it yesterday and i was presently surprised. The story is very good, but all the ignorant people would say "This sucks people cant fly!" to them i say IT'S FICTION and that it is. This is not to be taken as a film about reality you could say this is a "fairytale". And a very pleasant to watch Asian fairytale. The image's can actually blow your mind. Because there so artistically filmed , Ang Lee has a very (unapreciated u might say) big talent.

I 'm not a massive Disney fan , but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them. He's quite excited about going on a trip to one of their parks, but we don't want to get taken for a ride. There are lots of scams going on there and it seems that people have got scammed out of lots of money. I've always just said 'don't worry, I'm here to help' if we get taken, and we haven't been. Is there a way of telling if we're going to be scammed?

I've never seen the original "House Of Wax" so I really didn't know what to expect when I went to a sneak preview of the new film. After a somewhat wobbly start introducing our young characters, "House Of Wax" shifts gears and becomes an extremely effective horror outing.The plot really doesn't matter too much here - I think most people know upon seeing this that these stranded kids are going to meet up with a nasty killer and find some awful things in the titular house of wax. It's all about the special effects here, and they are top notch.

Chaplin enters the trenches of WWI in this spirited comedy that never belittles the horrors of war . The rain , mud , cold , and trenches are all in this picture . Chaplin doesn’t have a great role . He does well . In fact , he does a very good acting job . I’ve always admired Chaplin’s talent . He was a silent film genius and I admire him in that sense . He had tremendous style . However , it’s the fact that Chaplin doesn’t try to be realistic . He does a good acting job and he is very funny .

Gary Busey's best performance in a nicely-flowing biography. Since had a musical background, he was able to do his own songs and it really works. It's always good to see that fine actor, Don Stroud (one of the crickets) and Charlie Martin Smith as well.An 8 out of 10. Best performance = Gary Busey. Thankfully, Mr. Busey was Oscar-nominated for this, losing to Jon Voight in COMING HOME. A fairly low-budget flick that doesn't disappoint, with GREAT SONGS by Mr. Holly. I hope this made plenty of dough.

This film as it is now is far shorter than it was when released in 1918. In fact, it is now more available with two other medium sized silent Chaplin features (A DOG'S LIFE, and THE PILGRIM) that Chaplin re-released in the 1950s. In it's day SHOULDER ARMS was a big hit because of it's humor in uniform approach. It still is very funny (Chaplin in disguise as a tree, spying on the Germans, is so ridiculous it's hysterical), but it suffers from being set in it's own age.

The thing with Ali G is that he takes the mick out of himself and his character . The humour is more than just funny and very clever at times. However it is also the way that he talks and speaks. You see, when you speak to him, you have a sense of what's going on and the way he speaks in such a fast flow of slang and street talk makes you laugh . It also makes you think. I think that Ali G deserves an Oscar. He is clever, funny, intelligent, charismatic and he could be a Hollywood film star.

I had the chance to watch Blind Spot in Barcelona and I enjoyed it tremendously . I thought it to be an entertaining and well put together movie . There is a lot of suspense in it , and a lot of drama in it too . But overall , the movie is really entertaining , with good performances in the movie . Here are 5 things I loved about this film

1- It’s really well made . The film is very well put together , from the direction , writing , story , and music . It’s all good , and it makes the whole movie a success .

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in ! I love watching him ! ! i love watching him on stage when he is doing all those parts that he is amazing in !!! He is amazing in ! ! I love his voice in ! ! i love his look and his style, his sense of timing, I think he is amazing !!! i love his hair !!! i love how he treats all the cast and crew and his love for all his fans. I really enjoyed that performance.

Without going into any details of a good ... if a somewhat provocative ... TV movie , there seems to be a new generation of TV crime series that seems to be more than just re-hashing old cop shows or doing a spoof of old ones. There is a freshness to shows like The Shield and Nip Tuck that just doesn't seem to exist in, say, NCIS . What makes a new cop show? Is it a new concept? Is it the way it is presented? One of the most exciting things about new TV crime series seems to be the fresh look at the crime genre.

It's Showtime! Showtime is simply a bump in Eddie Murphy and Robert DeNiro's careers. It's an entertaining movie and a guilty pleasure but not quite up to the actors' standards, especially not Robert's. Showtime is directed by Tom Dey and features some small roles from guys like William Shatner and Mos Def.Showtime is about two very different cops, Mitch Preston (DeNiro) and Trey Sellars (Murphy). One takes work seriously in a low profile, quiet manner while the other is more easy-going and wants to have more fun than felons in his back seat.

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year. You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime, and Court TV can be relied on for a few every weekend. So I started watching The Morrison Murders thinking I knew very well what to expect: a more or less competent retelling of a real-life family murder. What I got was a subtle, beautifully acted drama that engrossed me from start to finish.Both the brothers were totally convincing, and Jonathan Scarfe was perfect in the challenging role of Luke. The look and feel of Georgia was in almost every frame.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell his side of the story about how he became one of the men who was captured and imprisoned for war crimes. He doesn't remember much of anything that happened, but he does recall that his best friend (played by Tom Hardy) died in the prison and that he killed his best friend, then killed another soldier who tried to rape him. I love this story because it gives us some insight as to how someone with no real memories would behave.

This movie was great. It had everything a true action fan could want. Plenty of people getting shot and/or maimed, minimal romance involving sex, a hero that can be identified with, violence at many intervals instead of pointless plot storing up just one scene at the end, and villains that are just asking for it. Bronson appears to be at his lowest level of tolerancy in this film and it shows. Ed Lauter makes a great cop and was seamlessly worked into Bronson's plot without stealing his spotlight. The movie doesn't involve a plot so boring or over-consuming that you watch this film once and never again.

This is what movies should aspire to. Funny without being totally stupid, a little sexy without having every female in the cast show her boobs, biting without resorting to 'f-bombs' every line. I've been seeing Justin Long pop up in a lot of films over the past few years, I figured with the right role he could break out. (Mac commercials not withstanding.) This film just might put him on a fast track to the A list. The rest of the cast also did their jobs perfectly, this is an excellent little film with a nice message.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and an eye for striking visuals. There's quite a lot of nudity and gore throughout the film but it never feels exploitive. The film manages to pull off a lot of clever things without ever becoming too heavy-handed. It also has one of the creepiest final moments ever. If you like Fulci you'll love this one. "I think of him as the Marlon Brando of zombie movies. He's long past his expiration date, but so is the genre.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it . I found the film very disturbing , not only because of the content of the plot but also the way it was shot and edited. I remember seeing this when it was released on TV and being really frightened to watch it again. I saw it again a long time later & found it so disturbing that i had to fast forward past the end of it ! I found that the film made me very angry , even though it is a fairly tame film , it is the way it has been edited in .

Jenny Lewis plays an awkward girl called Jade. She smokes and drinks. She doesn't have a lot of friends and she has a nagging mother(Beverly D'Angelo). Jade finds herself growing closer to her mom's boyfriend Billy(Rob Estes), maybe she is attracted to him. Of course, I don't need to tell you what happens after that. This is probably my favorite TV movie. This movie shows that sometimes everyone is to blame. This movie also has the best acting that I have seen in TV movies.

Well, I guess I was in the mood for a movie that really grabbed me from the beginning. This movie wasn't it. It plodded along at a pretty slow, deliberate pace for the first 40 minutes, but there wasn't really anything in it that I was terribly interested in--there's an intriguing and mysterious feud between Jean Reno's character and an old man, but more of the first 40 minutes is dominated by the wanderings of the main character, whom I didn't know much about and couldn't really relate to at the time.

If you like who-dun-its , you will like this film , considered the best Italian detective story ( giallo ) of all time . director giovanni colotti and writer carlo napolitano give you , along with a talented ensemble cast , a dark , witty , and fast-moving work of art that is a real must see . you'll see it in english with subtitles , and , if you have a sense of humour , it'll be great , if not , you can always watch the original , dubbed in english and with subtitles as a second option . you will like it .

OK , so this film may not have won any Oscars , but it is not a bad film . the film is directed by alexander pegg , and is the second in a trilogy he has made . it is more similar to the first one in the sense that it is more about relationships and the problems they cause . the first film was brilliant . i remember watching it at the cinema and going " what the hell . " then i saw it again and thought " that's a really good movie , the way it's filmed , the way it's written . "

Whoever plays the part of J. Douglas Williamson in the strip poker scene does a wonderful job . He apparently has a perfect poker face, and he plays the game very convincingly . The first time I saw the show was at my aunt's place in New Orleans. I remember that my aunt's neighbor was a fan of the TV show, and this neighbor had brought a VCR tape of the program. I remember watching the episode in a room where the lights were off, with my aunt lying in bed and the neighbor sitting on the other side of the room.

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary ( a lot ) - but he is funny ! - but he is still evil - but he still kills ( a little ) - and I still love him . Chucky is the only thing that I like in this entire film . Well I love him anyway . I see all this as a whole . I can see the good and the evil . The horror and the funny . I can understand where all the people are coming from . I can understand all their emotions . It can be pretty hard to understand all that when it is all around you .

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and , by the process , their own lives, are rare. They are even more rare when the documentary is made by the child himself or herself. The following documentary by an eleven-year-old boy about the life of his father will be a unique experience for everyone who sees it. The story is simple and yet the emotions involved are very moving. The young narrator is an excellent writer, and he has used this film as a school essay for the past two years in his school for children with learning difficulties and children with Autism spectrum disorders.

In this early Fulci work the director shows his most mainstream side as well as a talent for compelling storytelling and more than reasonable elucidation for the genre. Personally I think he has been unfairly maligned throughout his career as an aesthete of gore. It's a pretty capable procedural and surprised me with its subtextually rich narrative that shows his distrust for small minded small-town mentality and the inefficiency of the police, as well as the twisted ideals of the Catholic church, the last of which seemed to have cut this film at its knees when it was first released and could have possibly given the director another direction so early on.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary. I knew it was about an ex-Viet Nam POW in Laos who escaped, but I didn't know much else. In reality, I wasn't expecting too much. Oh what a surprise! The story of this man's life is very interesting in itself, but what sets this film apart from other biography-type docs is that Dieter himself tells most of the story himself. Dieter is very comfortable in front of the camera. His personality really shines. He tells his story about his life growing up in Germany during WWII and the hardships.

This movie, based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt, is one of the best films I've seen on race relations in South Africa; a very good history lesson of the turmoil of 80's South Africa. I put it in on the scale of American History X as far as it's depiction of how a young man can get seduced by the Aryan doctrine and how the "certain" segments of the Christian church taught a false doctrine regarding race to justify an injustice.It's strong message of forgiveness and redemption, is one of rarity in films today.

This musical has a deep meaning which is appreciated by only a few . The wise can see the wisdom in it, but it is not easy to be a wise man, so most people have missed it . There is a reason for this, but we will get into that in just a moment. This musical has a very powerful story line. A young man, David, who is from one of the highest of the upper class, finds out one night that he has lost his memory . He finds that the girl of his dreams is now involved with a man who is not as smart as him .

TV churns out dozens of true-crime movies every year . You can see 3 or 4 every Saturday on Lifetime. Some are pretty good, but they don't compare to true-crime books or TV shows that have been out for years, like The Jinx. Not that all crime books are equal or that all true-crime movies are good. But a true-crime book is a whole lot better than what you'll find on a TV channel. A lot of people have read The Jinx and have never seen or heard of it. So how did it happen?

When I first saw this movie,I also expected "our boys" to be cute,and more like an extended version of the TV show. I didn't "get it" back then. But,years later,at a party YEARS later,at a 70s' type PAR-TAY,where certain substances had been smoked,inhaled,and with plenty of tequila,"HEAD" was on late at night.We watched it,and finally realized what "HEAD" was all about. It spoofed their own show,as shown in one song that called themselves,"a manufactured image".

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME. The 1973 musical remake of the James Hilton novel about mythical SHANGRI-LA! is a real special gem. Music by BURT BACHARACH and lyrics by HAL David. A strange mixture of straight drama, adventure and musical sequences. It has the distinction of being the ONLY anti war musical fantasy ever filmed. This film was a critical and financial disappointment in the United States, but made a lot of money overseas. Only in America did it fail.

Like a few people I know, I came in late on 'Stingers'; not until 2000. Three years later there is no way I'd miss an episode. The show really is that good and has, for a better word, maintained its integrity, unlike 'Blue Heelers', for example. The crime is the thing; personal lives are there but only wheeled out when affecting an investigation! When Gary Sweet was brought in, some fans seemed worried, but he's really fitted in well, which didn't surprise me.

Let me clarify that. This is not a "good movie", but I am so glad it is out there, I am so glad I saw it, and for the role that it plays in my DVD collection, it is sublime. It is the ultimate PG-13 romp, it is college as we imagine it will be when we're freshmen in high school, it requires so much suspension of disbelief that it may as well be taking place on Mars. It is so wholesome that even when it tries to be dirty it wouldn't make your grandmother uncomfortable.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow. It accomplished this through the energetic performances of the leads, the steadiness of the camera-work (avoiding 'rock-video' clichés that were actually invented for the Beatles in their first two films), tight editing, and a non-judgmental presentation of the star as human being rather than symbol or god (or demon). Yes, there are minor holes in the plot, and incidental details that are a little unnecessary, and there will always be debate between families of those personally involved as to specifics.

As the mom of a 3 year old and a 2 year old, I adore AristoCats. It is a movie that contains no double-entendres, no almost-swear words like heck or darn, no parents who are functional idiots, and no crotch-smashing or flatulence jokes that are so prevalent in even the "best" kids movies these days. The story line is sweet and interesting. The music is great. The love story is quite romantic. The kittens are adorable, and the various other characters are unique and attention-capturing. The action is simple and not overwhelming or confusing.

Being a middle aged mom myself , I very much appreciated seeing a romance between grown-up people that weaves in their life experiences, and not just a typical young-adult romance, and I also liked the idea of showing the story from each of their perspectives, rather than one character’s point-of-view for the whole book. And, the story is very much about how we deal with situations in our lives, so I think it is appropriate for YA and middle grade. The main characters are very likable. They both have flaws and are imperfect, but they both have strengths, and I like that.

As a film buff , I obviously had read all the excruciating reviews and funny , sarcastic comments about this movie on the movie website IMDb . But it never really dawned on me that IMDb and other film review websites are generally not read by film buffs or general movie goers. The general movie goer is more likely to look into the “movie” reviews on a website like Amazon or Blockbuster because they want to see what a reviewer thinks of a movie before spending money on it. And most of the time when you read reviews , you find people ranting about a movie that they hated.

The movie is excellent . Acting , cinematography , direction and music are spellbinding . It seems to me that this movie can be watched by everyone and everyone who watched this movie would surely like to recommend the movie to his friends. I have watched this movie twice because of the way it made me see things and also to see what others would think of it . The most interesting thing about this movie is that no matter who you watch it , no matter how old you are , no matter how stupid you think , this movie will hit you right in your heart and you would just love it no matter what .

i did not read the book . nor do i care to . the movie was a beautiful romance , i just hope the book is better . 0

| Reply - Posted on May 31, 2009 at 7:10 PM | Report abuse

sandra

This is a book that you have to read to see what I was talking about. It’s about a beautiful family and the trials and travails of the parents. The movie was soooo bad that you have to see the book to understand the story. I loved the movie, but was disappointed to see so many changes from the book.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson 's work , and for about as long as I 've been in this industry, he has had a hand in one or two projects in development for me - the only time that I've had my own movie greenlit was when it was under the aegis of his company " EuropaCorp ". For years, he has been one of the most consistent creative forces within the genre, and I believe he is still one of the most creative directors to have ever worked within this genre. He knows exactly what to do and what to leave alone.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. India’s rich cultural past comes alive on screen as he explores its many dimensions. He is a connoisseur of the Indian arts of poetry and music, which is evident in all his movies. Bharatbala has won several National Awards and international accolades for his works and has also been nominated for Best Director at Academy Awards. We are extremely proud to announce the return of the great Rajiv Menon to the team. Rajiv Menon is an established Indian film critic and author.

Head should have been a proud moment not just for its stars ( The Monkees and Victor Mature ) ,but for the director too , who had made his mark with such cult horror movies as The Terror ,House on Haunted Hill, The Raven ,and the original version of Night of the Living Dead ,but who was now being touted by the Hollywood elite as one of the greats and the man who would bring science fiction back to mainstream films. ( And he’s probably not that bad an actor ! ) This film was originally released in America on June 19 ,1968 ,as Star-Spangled Psychotic.

Let's be fair: there are no RULES for scriptwriting, so I won't say the movie SHOULD be something other than it is. I'll just state my opinion. OK, I really liked the script, the way things are told and characters are introduced. However, I think when a play is adapted to the silver screen, it could maybe try and fit this other media. Since this movie was directed by João Falcão, the same man who directed the play, it's not too much of a surprise that the film turned out a bit too theatrical.

The A-team is still repeating every day on Dutch television ( RTL7 , around 1800hrs ) and I still watch it every day. If you know my history, you’d understand why. If you’re interested to know, here is an article I wrote about the A-team on RTL7 last month. And here is an article that talks about the popularity of the A-team in the Netherlands. It includes a video, of which I’m the voice. Anyway, before I get into this post, I’ll tell you what’s on my mind for today.

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC . I 've been looking for it ever since . It was my favorite drama of last years and I was looking for it again last year. After watching it again , I really wish it gets picked up now . Borderline was one of the few shows that was great from start to finish . The characters were interesting and well developed . It also had the most intriguing storyline . The first season was so much better than the second and that is really saying something . The second season was good but the third season was the best one .

I usually give horror films around 6/10, but this one caught my eye. House of Wax was by far the best horror film I have seen... Even better than the Amityville Horror.Paris Hilton was quite good in this and I must say, has a good future ahead. Her death scene was probably the coolest. I'll just say how she dies...She gets a giant pole right between her eyes and they close-ups on and everything. Gory, eh? Brian Van Holt was very good as both the killers, Bo and Vincent (Vincent had the long hair).

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread. Louis de Berniere's bestselling novel is one of my favourites and anyone who has read it will realise that there is no way in hell that any screen adaptation can be 100% faithful. All the way through I found myself convincing myself that the movie was unsuccessful, and had stripped the book's plot back so far as to render it redundant. The ending, however, is much better than that in the novel, and I could not stop thinking about the movie afterwards.

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie . But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. It's like watching a movie that you just can't stop watching. If you get to the point where you have to stop watching it because you have to start something else then you better stop watching anything. I recommend this movie to anyone . Diora Baird was born on June 27, 1988 in the UK. She began acting on TV at the age of five. She has had bit parts in several TV shows, including Doctor Who and Merlin.

Is this a good movie ? It 's hard to say -- but in 1953 , for many people , the movie industry 's worst film was just as bad as the worst film : It was " The Ten Commandments . " The only good thing to come out of the production of the film was its director, Cecil B. DeMille . But the script , the production design , the photography , and even the performances , especially from Charlton Heston , were so badly handled that most people remember it mainly for the way the film was cut .

Loved today 's show ! ! ! It was a variety and not solely cooking ( which would have been boring ! ) I love it all. It's like a big family gathering to celebrate all the food we've enjoyed throughout the year !!! You have to feel good about how it's all turned out when you watch this ! This was the best episode. It was fun and entertaining. I wish there were more cooking shows. I don't watch a lot of cooking shows because there's usually nothing new or creative on the shows.

This movie shows that the free enterprise system and the quest for the almighty buck transcends all racial and ethnic barriers. Ultimately the market place determines the message that is sent to the public. This movie dramatizes that point. A conservative white-collar advertising company is taken over by a group of street-wise African Americans chaired by a no-nonsense black man who wants to make a buck and believes he can sell products by telling the the truth. But the movie shows that no matter how hard he tries to do something different, the market place and the political system demands that he conform, rendering him no different than his predecessors.

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history , someone had to be the first. It has to be at least funny, so you’re sure that everyone will watch, so we can all laugh at how stupid everyone was. So I’m going to make a list of some of my favorite comedies that happen during military times, with some explanations as to why I chose them. If you notice any omissions, or want to add a comedy to this list, feel free.

This early film from future goremeister Lucio Fulci is a very good addition to the giallo sub-genre. Set in rural Italy, there is a serial killer of children at large. Add to the mix an array of characters familiar to fans of giallo cinema  a madwoman, a newspaper reporter, ineffectual police, a sexy siren, a priest, a mute girl, a mentally-retarded loner etc. This is one of the best Italian thrillers of the early 70's.Unusually for a giallo, the victims in this case are young boys, which makes a change from the more typical women in peril angle.

Ali G earned his fame on the small screen - though the big screen has not lost him any kudos either. Ali G Indahouse is a hilarious laugh-a-second fun fest - just like on the small screen. He has lost none of his character or stupidity at all, and behind all that - none of the film is brainless fluff either. A human side to Ali is revealed during the film, the idea of Ali G running for PM is a brilliant, fresh and funny one - and the incessant stupidity of Staines' gangster man is mixed well with the stern, harsh world that is politics.

"A Slight Case of Murder" is an excellent TV movie, which is defiantly worth the price of a rental. William H. Macy is great as a movie critic who accidentally kills his mistress, and then has to try to conceal the crime. Although that may sound dark, the film is actually quite light hearted and funny, with many memorable lines ("Acting is harder than I thought- you ever see BODY HEAT? I think I owe Bill Hurt an apology" and my personal favourite "For next week answer these two questions about film noir, What do these people do during the day?

I gave it a seven only because the acting is good . And of course by that I mean Wilkinson, because that's the only part he has. But I gave the show a nine because it had such potential. The script was really good. But I give it mostly a nine because I love the characters in it and it's hard to get through. This is the only one I've seen where you don't like the characters because of how they act so it was a lot harder on me than it is on other people I've seen in this category.

Hey look, you don't watch this movie to change your life! But if you are female especially and have always had a little thing for Richard Gere; this movie is right up your street. Diane Lane and Richard Gere have on screen chemistry going way back. 'Nights in Rodanthe' is not a Oscar winner movie and it will probably be forgotten sooner rather than later but if you want an atmospheric, beautifully shot love story between MIDDLE AGED good looking people (they don't make your stomach turn and even when Gere is 'on top' he does not look too jowly) then this is the movie for you.

They Made Me a Criminal is a remake of an earlier Warner Brothers film, The Life of Jimmy Dolan which starred Douglas Fairbanks, Jr. as the prizefighter on the lam.Even with the restrictions now upon production by the Hays Office, this remake actually turns out to be better than the original. Douglas Fairbanks, Jr., is horribly miscast as a pugilist. John Garfield with his background and style steps into a part he was born to play.They Made Me a Criminal was directed by Busby Berkeley who Jack Warner believed in keeping busy in between musicals. Berkeley in fact would soon be leaving Warner Brothers for MGM.

It 's just that . Chucky 1 was good . Chucky 2 was better . Chucky 3 sucked . Now we get a reboot . Well, I didn't find it too great, but I guess I'll give it a try to see if the reboot will live up to expectations. The first one I saw was the first trailer, and I didn't find it as good as I did the original. I think the second one, which I didn't see, made up for it though. So I'm sure Chucky 3 can't suck too badly.

I thought this was movie was great, Richard Greico and Yasmine Bleeth have great chemistry in this movie. Yasmine Bleeth's character plays a women who has fallen head over heals in love with Richard Greico's character. They end up getting married and everything seems perfect except Yasmine Bleeth wants a baby more than anything, however she has a hard time trying to conceive. Richard Greico will do anything to make her happy, and will go to extreme measures to make her happy. I thought the acting was great in this movie, and it keeps you guessing.

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it. It is just not available and it has not been on TV for many many years. I enjoyed it and the songs because it had something different to say and made you think how every person looks at something from different prespectives. Also we often don't appreciate something we have till it is no longer there.My 12 year old daughter just discoverd the music and is entranced with some of the songs. Someday I hope to get a copy of the film so she can have an opportunity to view it.

I think that this short TV series, was absolutely wonderful, and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of everything that was on the screen at the given time. This was by far David Attenborough at his best. I personally thought this was one of the best documentaries in the past decade. This is definitely worth peoples money!I also found the bit about the abyss and deep water the most fascinating and interesting part. It was incredible to find out that the 'Blue planet' team discovered more than 10 new species of underwater life!

I really enjoyed this film, it definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. It was very well directed. I think it was important that they showed the other couple's life as well as Terry and Bobbys and show them as people with emotions. As this film needed to show Bobby as a cold and vindictive person.I agree with another review it was sick love, not true love. He didn't need to go to great lengths as murder to give his wife a baby. He should have been honest with her and told her that he was sterile and decide to adopt a baby together.

I caught this show a few times when I was young and it was playing tilt, My parents loved it and now in syndication I feel what they feel. This show did what the original limits and twilight zone (new and old) couldn't do. This show used some old ideas and some truly original ideas.I still cannot believe Jonathan Glassner and brad wright did this. Those guys were producers on stargate sg-1. The show kept the audience entrenched in the story and set a truly scary atmosphere. This is what was not there in the new twilight zone.

Mark Blankfield played Jekyll and Hyde.Michael McGuire was the dad.Tim Thomerson was the plastic surgeon.Did you even see this movie? I doubt it!Blankfield was fairly popular at this time for playing the pill-popping doctor on Fridays. Thomerson has been funny in anything he does, from movies to series to stand-up comedy. If I ever find this movie on DVD I will definitely buy it. I recorded this movie off of HBO back in '82 and have pretty much worn out the tape. One of the funniest takes on the Jekyll & Hyde theme ever.Of course.

I 've got to say it . Gary Busey saved this film . If it were not for his fine character work , this would not be a movie that i would care to see . He is so natural , so genuine and so right for this part , that it is impossible to imagine anyone but him filling this role . If only he hadn't been so good , i would have hated this film . But it isn't the acting that i dislike here . No , it is the material itself which , as i've said , is just bad .

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters in the late 1950s under the title "The Chaplin Review".This was an odd film in some ways because later in life, Chaplin was anti-war and his movies stressed peace and brotherhood. This film, in contrast, is a propaganda comedy meant to bolster the US efforts in WWI. It's truly odd to see Charlie as the "super soldier" who single-handedly captures 13 Germans, casually and coolly shoots several Germans in mere seconds as a marksman and then goes behind enemy lines to try to capture the Kaiser himself!

I 've been looking forward to seeing this film ever since I first caught the trailer , and I 'm glad to say that it 's not the disaster you might be expecting from the first few moments. It took me a while to realize why I liked this movie so much , but once I did , it was impossible to take my eyes off it . After all , this is one of the most powerful vampire films I 've ever seen . You might be thinking that I 've seen a lot of these films , but this is truly a first for me .

I always liked listening to Buddy Holly and felt a real loss when he was killed at a young age in an airplane crash. He wasn't in the old rock 'n roll class of , let's say, Chuck Berry or Jerry Lee Lewis, but he wasn't far behind. Who knows how big his legacy would have been had he sang for decades. Almost every single he put out was a hit.So, I was very pleasantly surprised how good a job Gary Busey did at playing him and at imitating his singing voice.

Final Solution is a powerful christian film that shows the hate between the black and whites that was present in the days of apartheid. It shows how this hate was contrived and was groomed from generation to generation. Jan Ellis was taught that a black man was a plague. He was raised to be that way. Then he meets a man who is on the opposite side of his beliefs, Pastor Lekota. will he change his ways?. The film is a powerful movie that shows the perceptions the different races had for one another, it shows these perceptions with quite a lot of accuracy.

This is a good film, no doubt, but with some odd aspects. Without spoiling anything it takes place in 3 places only- a Sicilian farm, the boat,and Ellis Island New York. All shots are close up so we never see a broad sweep of anything. I wonder if this was to save money? No street scenes anywhere, and we don't even see the boat except in close ups. And the music...what on earth was going on with playing Nina Simone songs, decades before they were out?

Blind Spot 's images are great . The action draws you in completely , even though the movie is a little on the light side . Worth a look , especially if you like your entertainment light . What's the story ? The plot is quite simple . Three young women travel in a car when the car is pulled over for speeding . While the woman in the backseat is doing something on her computer one of the girls starts to feel sick . The driver of the car gets the car into an emergency lane , when they are stopped and the car is turned off .

**1/2 Elisha Cuthbert, Chad Michael Murray, Brian Van Holt, Paris Hilton and Jon Abrahams. Directed by Jaume Collet-Serra.Yet another classic horror film remade with dunder-headed teenage acting despite grizzly and creative deaths. Based on the 1953 Vincent Price film House of Wax where a maniac kills unsuspecting teenage hooligans and turns them into priceless wax figures. Still with the fantastic set design to make the whole house into wax the movie is a typical classic horror remake like Tobe Hooper's 1974 classic Texas Chainsaw Massacre later remade, despite creativity and so-so acting the movie was still just a gore picture.

That's right. Ohwon (the painter and the main character) is an exceptional person. What strikes me most is the message this film might address to all of you people there. And the message is sad. It says that, it's very difficult to do anything that's amazing or maybe even genius without having to obey the governments, establishment and other VIPs of this world. And even if you try, you might not be able to bear it. It is about the battle of a single person with a system. With many systems.A great film of this wonderful Korean director.

I hope, from his seat on Heaven's comedic throne, Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this film, as Terence Ryan and Ken Tuohy have taken a book that the author himself said writing it "nearly turned me mad" into a joy to watch.The film tells the story of the Irish town of Puckoon and the problems befallen upon it when the partition between Northern Ireland and the Republic is drawn up, cutting its way through the centre of the village and, more worringly, through the middle of the churchyard.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates `` Separate Lies , '' a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson , Linda Cardellini and Bill Pullman . The British film's title is the name of an old newspaper headline that Tom Wilkinson's character uses as a basis for a speech he makes to an audience of antiwar activists who are on their way out of a meeting. He begins:

I don ' t think I can take much more than this. It doesn't feel right any more, this war. It ' s just a way to kill people.

Just as in "Columbo" we see the fatality occur right at the beginning. What follows is an escalating web of lies, sex, blackmail, and murder. The investigating officer, Adam Arkin, is even somewhat of a fumbler, not unlike "Columbo". It is William H. Macy, as the movie critic suspect who carries the film. Constantly twisting and turning, the plot sends Macy deeper and deeper into the quicksand of his "perfect crime". William H. Macy fans will enjoy "A Slight Case Of Murder", as will those who like crime capers with all kinds of delicious possibilities.

I was watching an NFL game and started surfing during a break and found this on one of the HBO type channels. I missed the beginning but when I started watching Deadly Voyage the clicker was put down and not even thought of until the credits rolled. You will find yourself rooting against the villans and on the edge of your La-Z-Boy throughout this one. If you get the chance take the time to watch it. Every once in a while I think about having the cable company take off my Movie channels but when you stumble across great ones like this you know why it is worth paying extra for them.

Loved today's show!!! It was a variety and not solely cooking (which would have been great too). Very stimulating and captivating, always keeping the viewer peeking around the corner to see what was coming up next. She is as down to earth and as personable as you get, like one of us which made the show all the more enjoyable. Special guests, who are friends as well made for a nice surprise too. Loved the 'first' theme and that the audience was invited to play along too.

"Head" is a film that has held up well since its original release date in 1968. The movie is a complete contradiction of the Monkees image. It presents the Monkees in a way their fans never perceived them; men with real thoughts. Totally controlled by their producers, the Monkees were given the opportunity to tell their side of the story. The film pokes fun at their image, the entertainment industry, and corporate America. The soundtrack contains some of their best music. It's a movie well worth seeing over and over again.

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's films . Most of his 80s gore films had their place , but by the mid-80s he was becoming a more and more unapologetic gore-monger . I 'm still not a massive fan . I found The Beyond , a relatively tame entry to his gore-filled films, to be a decent horror-comedy , but I have to say that his last couple of films The Beyond and City of the Living Dead were complete and utter rip-offs ( and I 'm being kind in describing the latter as a rip-off).

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you'll be hard-pressed. HEAD is a masterpiece of non-linear non-structure, surrealism and experimentaion. In less than 90 minutes, it manages to be not only a time-capsule of an era, but also a full-length experimental feature that defies time,space and convention in a way that only underground films of the sixties could.HEAD is a reflection of those films. No matter how one feels about the Monkees, this is a film every filmmaker should see because it cracks wide open the endless possibilities of film as an art medium.

Barbora Bobulova 's portrayal of Valeria in this story was entirely captivating and heart wrenching at the same time . The main character in this story, Valeria, is one of my favorite characters created in the whole series of Stalker. Valeria, a very beautiful and innocent girl. She has an incredible talent to attract everyone around her, especially with men. She loves to read and listen to music, so she always finds herself in her bedroom. Her room is completely filled with books, candles, and music. She has everything she needs there. She is very caring and sympathetic.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80 's , and this one is even better . there is much more emphasis on the story , but the action is still great . there are lots of fight scenes , especially a great final battle which i would rate 10 times higher than the original . it has a good storyline which is very original , and is very well written . the acting is good and the movie has very good cinematography . the graphics are also very good , and the animation is better than 
the original , which makes this film alot better than the original .

Chucky is back but this time he is not scary (a lot) - but he is funny!When Chucky is brought back to life (in the doll, of course) by his old trailer trash girlfriend, Tiffany, he promptly kills her and transforms her into a doll, too. Tiffany and Chucky are now on the case of 2 high school graduates - eekkk! !Don't miss this film - it is a whole lot of fun. It is scary, funny, weird, wacky and stupid all in one!My rating : 9/10.

Do you liked "Dead Man don't wear Plaid"? What about "Top Secret" and "A Chorus Line"? Well Müllers Büro is a fantastic Melange of all three of them, as unlikely it may seem. Very Funny "tongue in Cheek" Movie Noir hommage with stunning Songs and great Dancing. You have to have a little odd humor for this movie, but it is very well worth seeing it. I've voted it a nine, If the end would be a bit more logic it would have gotten a ten. Thats how Good that Movie is.

Based on a William Faulkner short story , Two Soldiers is a top notch short film , a movie that's so simple yet so compelling that it'll have you hanging on for every moment it plays. I'm sure it's been done before, but it still works because the script, the performances, and the filmmaking is so strong. If you haven't seen it yet, do yourself a favor and go to your local video store or your favorite streaming video service and rent/own this movie. It's just that good. Two Soldiers starts out with a really cool premise.

I absolutely adore this movie ! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store, but I loved it. And I've never read the book and don't really need to. I've heard so much of it though...I think that's part of why I'm so obsessed with the movie. It sounds like a great read, though. I loved this film, but it's probably not a book I'd get into in the same way I got into The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo.

While I agree that this movie lacks any real substance and should not be taken seriously, its primarily directed to fans of the series who are looking for a quick fix. Bronson (Paul Kersey)once again takes to the streets (given a license to kill by the chief police no less) and moves into his friends apartment (who you guessed it) was killed by a street gang that has taken control of the neighborhood (which looks like Beruit). It's funny that people who associate with Bronson have a habit of getting killed.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast ! It's a fun, funny, and charming movie. I highly recommend it... especially for the kids. It would be an excellent choice for the theater if your family would enjoy it, but if not, you can always rent it to have for yourself. I was happy to see it available for free in the library system in the past week or so. Enjoy the sneak peeks:

About Me

I am an avid book reader, love to learn about many things.

If you like who-dun-its, you will like this film, considered the best Italian detective story (giallo), Fulci has done.It's not Mickey Spillane for sure. There are scenes designed to disturb anyone.Many would be offended by a local beauty trying to seduce a 12-year-old boy. She was joking, but she was naked nonetheless, and he would have jumped at the chance to jump her bones. She also tries to tempt the local priest.Young boys are turning up missing, and there are several interesting suspects. You have to watch carefully to discover the killer. Can you?

This was a riveting film, one that really drew me in. I'm a big fan of William H. Macy, and he puts in a wonderful performance. His great likeability, coupled with the way his character breaks the fourth wall, really gave me a sense of complicity in his actions. I found myself waiting tensely for the whole house of cards to come collapsing down around him (and by extension myself, as his confidante and silent witness). It took several minutes for me to relax once the film had ended, I was so wrapped up in it.

Buddy Holly was a pioneer and victim of the early days of rock 'n' roll. The young singer/songwriter from Lubbock, Texas left his mark on the template of modern music. Inspired by Elvis Presley, Holly would spend a lot of time fighting the system in order to get his rock-a-billy sound recorded. Before his untimely death, he was mixing lush strings with be-bop rhythms. Holly would take his place with Presley, Chuck Berry, Jerry Lee Lewis and Ricky Nelson as the voices of teenage angst.This easy to watch bio is not without flaws.

Oh my gosh ! ! I love this movie sooooooooooooooooooooo much ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! I watched it like 5 times the day I got it! I LOVE IT ! I just love the story , the music ( especially the end), the acting , the cinematography and everything! I loved it! It was really exciting and fun! I loved it all ! ( I have a little spoiler in there.

For those out there that like to think of themselves as reasonably intelligent human beings, who love film, have good attention to detail and enjoy indie movies with funny, smartly written dialogue then this is a film for you.For those with a poor attention span, high expectations and no brains.. well.. um.. you may get bored and find things dragging at times.This is a charming, modest and well paced movie with the actors bestowing a real sense of depth and warmth to their roles. I chuckled to myself pretty much the whole way through..This film is a little gem.

I saw this today with little background on what to expect of the storyline . I go to the movies to have a fun time with a couple of people, to laugh and to enjoy, that is what i look for when going to the movies. I sat down and was very confused, my friend and i didn't know anything about this movie . I went to this movie for the laughs and that was all that I was expecting , but I was very wrong. The laughs were few and far between, which was very annoying. I went in knowing absolutely nothing about the movie.

The movie starts with a board meeting at a major advertising agency . Putney Swope is on the board for one of the most important advertising accounts in the business . In fact, the agency is so confident they’ve won the business that they’ve decided to celebrate by making an ad that shows a dog playing catch with a Frisbee with the tag-line: The best way to find love is through dogs. We soon see that it’s time for the board meeting to begin. As they walk into the meeting, it’s Putney who makes the first move.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie , this wo n't be one for you . If you are a big fan of action adventure films, you will no t need to see any other films after you watch this one . If you ha ve n't seen the movie yet , please go see it. This movie will be out in the theatres on August 3, 2006 . This movie was okay . There were only one or two decent scenes . The movie was too boring , too slow , the plot was bad , the characters were not likeable .

When `` Madame '' decides to let her cats inherit her it spells trouble . The snobbish Butler Edgar who has been watching and waiting for just such an occurrence is not amused by the situation and he has no intention of being mauled by the cats of Madame Tussaud. In order to protect the Butler he has to hide out and plan a way to get rid of the cats, even though it seems to be the most difficult problem of his life! But just when he thinks that his troubles are over, the cats go on a rampage and he finds himself stuck in an unfamiliar room with a beautiful woman!

Indeed, Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond. Though I'm just wondering how she ended up as a 'rehab patient'(?) where Hurley is also in there trying to reduce his weight (as seen from the previous episodes).Anyway, this last episode is really suspended. The ending is not so understandable. I think the writer did expect the audience that there is a season 3 coming.I just hope the next season will give light to more unclear/hanging events that were happened.Just can't wait further for season 3.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of `` L'Anticristo '' ( 1974 ) , this one begins with a woman being killed in a bizarre fashion that is only half understood. It soon becomes clear why the killers were after her though - after all the clues are uncovered, it is a case of life and death between the man who murdered her and the woman he loves. It's a little tricky to know whether to be more upset by the crime itself, or that the murder was actually a murder in the first place!

You know, people who make comedies so often forget it's really ok to be outrageous. Well, not this time. Unconditional Love has it all. Barry Manilow and a dwarf in a movie with Cathy Bates as the romantic lead...and it works. Not only does it work, it works very very well. In fact, I think it's perfect. I laughed so hard I think I hurt myself yet the main characters were all so human, so honest, and so very real. But isn't that where great comedies come from?

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries (Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island) that keeps many of the novel's characteristics. I think that greek sceneries add something special and magical to a movie. One thing i didn't like at all though, is that the main characters, like 'Mandras' and Pelagia's father weren't greek actors but foreigners. I mean the actors tried to express the greek way of living, but to me they didn't succeed and it was quite clear. Even their pronunciation when they were trying to use greek words was terrible and that was bad for the film's plot.

This is a stunning movie . Raw and sublimely moving . It felt like a very gripping , intelligent stage show . The story takes place in the 1950's and focuses on the troubled , troubled childhood of a boy named Tony. It is the perfect film if you're in need of a real-life, emotional movie . The film shows how children are treated and it shows us a glimpse into what their parents must have gone through. It's very well written, directed and acted and it shows us what a child of that time period was up to.

Frank Langella steals my heart in everything he has ever been in! I love watching him!! i was 10 yrs old (1979) when i seen him for the first time.i eagerly await each and everything he'll be acting in. hopefully one day i can see him in person. he's very hypnotic and mysterious and that voice is commanding and strong! he is very attractive, even now at 65 he is absolutely stunning!!!! In my opinion he is the greatest actor iv'e ever seen!

As many of today's movies are guilty of, the plot isn't exactly stellar, the movie doesn't move anyone, and certainly this won't warrant any award (outside of Blockbusters' perhaps)...but then again, who really cares.Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro team up to produce a very funny, at times hilarious, movie that I really enjoyed. Russo and Shatner played their small parts well as well. Man, I hope in the future my wife ages as well as Miss Renee has.Moving along, this "buddy" cop-flick produces high laughs in a reasonable amount of time.

Great show! About time a reality TV show comes along that closes generation gaps. Contestants range in ages, some seem old enough to have watched the movie when it first came out. And others, looked so young that perhaps parents or teachers handed down the movie hoping it would touch their lives the way it once touch them. Grease has truly become an American icon. Grease is a fun and entertaining movie in which the young and old can relate to. "You're The One That We Want" is sure to gain even more Grease followers.

`` D.O.A '' is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish . Dennis Quaid is at his best in his first dramatic role in a long while . It's no surprise that it's a part that has called for him to stretch himself , and he is more than equal to the task . I don't know what to think of his character though . I think he played it too close to the heart . He never really got under the skin of this character , and at times it seemed a bit too saccharine for me .

Film auteur Stephan Woloszczuk explores the depths of love , passion , and brotherhood and the devastating results of loss , longing , and infidelity , in a hauntingly personal tale set in the 1950s in the United States . Woloszczuk’s debut feature “Love Me If You Dare” stars Tim Roth and Joanna Lumley . The film centers on a young soldier ( Roth ) who returns to his native United States to visit his terminally ill mother. Lumley plays the young widow to whom he returns, and in one of their scenes, they are in bed and she tells him about her husband who died .

We loved this movie because it was so entertaining and off beat-- Not your usual Hollywood drivel.My husband had a Blockbuster coupon and passed on a string of new releases of violent Hollywood stuff. He was about to walk out when he saw this and decided to take a chance. There was only one copy -- and with some glitches in the DVD that we finally had to flip to wide screen version and then back to the full screen version to make it stop stalling. But it was worth it. Cathy Bates is so good and she was so perfect for the role.

A nice and pleasant movie full of meditteranean sceneries ( Cephallonia is a very beautiful greek island ) that keeps our attention during the movie. An enjoyable movie for everyone that likes movies of Greek origin. I recommend it for those who love meditteranean locations and landscapes, for those who like movies that keep our attention for a very short time. I recommend it for everyone, specially for those who like movies that keep our attention during all the movie. A very interesting movie that keeps our attention during the whole movie and that is very interesting for the audience.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up , many people began to get excited about seeing it ... really excited, because the trailer looked amazing! They had a great cast and looked like they had it all figured out. But then there was the film's release, and it seemed like the film had more or less ... not died. It was released and it did poorly at the box office. So, the question is ... did this film deserve to do as it did? In other words: was this film really as great as people thought it was before its release?

I really loved this movie and have spent several years trying to get it . It is just not available to buy. Can anyone help with a good DVD rip or purchase please? The Blu-Ray version is actually the best I've seen of the movie. I've seen this movie twice in theaters and the Blu-Ray version is better. It's not perfect, but it's still better than most of the crap on the disc. If you want to see this, get the Blu-Ray, or wait a year or two and get it on a budget priced DVD.

Was very fortunate to see the movie Hari Om at The Bermuda International Film Festival. It was the opening night and was such a delightful movie. It was shot beautifully around India and I want to go there now. The main actor..Vijay was absolutely incredible. He was the highlight of the movie. Apparently he was also in the movie..Monsoon Wedding. He was the total star of the show. Benoit's character cracked me up...was very funny. And the girl (forget the name) was great too. They were all great!

Too bad somebody did not have the smarts to release this movie to theaters. I had never heard of it when it appeared on cable. After the first shock of realizing this is not like any other movie you have seen since Bringing Up Baby you have to let it sweep you along and run with it. Not until it's over do you realize it covers issues that are not only subtle but significant. Alienation, denial, wish-fulfillment, for a start. Cathy Bates owns this movie, she's never been better.

The Monkees, surprisingly, are a big favorite of mine. Yes, they might have been the original manufactured rock band; a gimmick that certainly has reached overkill in the 21st century. However, their music holds up as some of the best the 1960's had to offer. Last Train To Clarksville, Daydream Believer, I'm A Believer, (I'm Not) Your Stepping Stone, Valleri and Pleasant Valley Sunday are great songs, written by good songwriters such as Boyce/Hart, Neil Diamond, Goffen/King and John Stewart.

Unconditional Love is one of the best movies I 've seen in a while . It 's an emotional roller-coaster and I love it! I don 't understand how it has received such bad reviews from critics. If you want a great movie to get into, watch it with a girlfriend or wife. Then, you will understand why some people are giving it a bad review. I watched it with a couple of my gfs and we couldn 't keep our eyes off the screen. This is a movie that makes you think. And it makes me want to get out of the rat race.

What an excellent movie, made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it so serendipitously, channel surfing on a nice frozen day in North Texas. Kathy Bates is at her usual best leading a cast of very normal and human costar characters thru one of the most wonderful feel good movies we've ever seen. Why this movie wasn't given the attention it deserved on it's release in 2002 is difficult to understand. Why it was head and shoulders above so many of the boring pieces of trash released with greater fanfare and attention is evident in the viewing.

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining. It provides updates of tech news, video games pretty much everything geek. They are also the official broadcasters of E3 and Comiccon. If you are a geek, gamers or anything really, you will enjoy this show. They have definitely upped their game since the guy below me's review (2006). It's the only place that I get my tech info. Kevin Pereira and Olivia Munn work beautifully with each other and the show always has segments referring to things in the game, movie, comic... Universe.

probably the best horror movie in 5 years .. there 's been lame remakes , attempts to make you scared , remakes like 'halloween 6' .. and 'red' , but there hasn 't been a scary movie in the last 5 years .. and this one takes place at a time when people didn't watch the news .. so they wouldn't be aware of all the horrible things that were happening .. the 'hannibal' remake was bad .. but this takes the cake . it 's really scary , the story is great , the scares are out of sight , the makeup , special effects are incredible .

The big names in film tried to do their part for the war effort, and Charlie Chaplin was no exception. This patriotic and propagandist picture is part of his contribution, although the war was nearly over by the time of its release. The tramp goes to war, humorously accomplishes acts of heroism and kicks the Kaiser in the bum. It's a very funny film, although I don't think it nearly one of his best. It's with 'A Dog's Life' as his better output for First National before he made his early masterpiece 'The Kid.'

We saw La Spettatrice at the Syracuse International Film & Video Festival & liked it.This film delved into the fear that many people still hold for the dark side of Italian life. This was the first short film we saw during the Syracuse Italian Film Festival this past weekend and it was the only one I remember seeing during that time frame. I was very pleased with the quality of all the films that I saw this weekend but this one stood out the most. It is not a feature length movie, rather it is simply a series of short segments. We also liked it for another reason.

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen , However , I am only in the second season and I have a feeling that they would have put him out of a job if he failed to solve these crimes . There was no way that this was gonna end in a tie . So , I was kind of disappointed , but this season is not that bad , I just don't get why people can't just move on to another season , this one has been over for like 6 months . So , I can't wait to see what's gonna happen .

I first saw "Signs of Life" on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation. It's a wonderfully written, ensemble production with terrific performances by Michael Lewis as Joey and Vincent D'Onofrio as his brother, Daryl. Arthur Kennedy, in one of his last roles, is also excellent as an aging shipbuilder whose family business is about to close. The rest of the cast which includes Beau Bridges, Kathy Bates and Mary-Louise Parker give remarkable clarity and substance to their characters.The direction is subtle and effective. I've watched this movie several times over the years and would very much recommend it.

I thought I might be disappointed viewing this film again after so many years. On the contrary, I was more impressed now than in my callow youth with its honesty and brave humour. In 1969, the transition among African-American groups from a predominant policy of conciliation and integration to one of confrontation and self-determination was still quite new, and more than a little controversial. It took courage and finesse to portray both the Establishment and the Anti-establishment as the caricatures they often closely approximated in real life. Special mention should be made of Arnold Johnson's performance: he successfully avoided having his character lapse into either sociopathy or buffoonery.

Lucio Fulci made a lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured a large amount of gore is something that’s worth looking into. Among his more famous films is ‘The Beyond‘ and ‘Zombie‘ (both directed by Lucio Fulci) but this one is one that most likely slipped under the radar. I haven’t actually seen the film yet (it has been in the Netflix queue for quite some time), but based off what I’ve seen, I’m definitely going to.

I wish there were more films about middle aged people. The intellectual journey and the twists and turns of life's moral highway make interesting viewing. There seems to be a different standard of judgement on women who have extra marital affairs than on men. Amy Watson's hurtful and humiliating behaviour towards her husband seems to pass without comment. Reverse the roles and one could expect a torrent of condemnation towards the man. If she found her husband boring and judgmental she could could have told him so, left and waited for a no doubt large financial settlement upon divorce.

This movie felt so real. I actually felt all of the emotions portrayed here during my life at various times - that of both Rory and Michael. I have Duchene's Muscular Dystrophy like Rory so what you see here is exactly what I've actually felt myself. Some won't believe there ARE disabled people like Rory, full of anger and rebellion. I know they exist because I'm one of them.The story is great. For a drama, character-driven movie, the story moves fast. I was never bored, maybe partly because I was seeing stuff that is close to my heart.

Indeed , Cynthia Watros is in this movie as Elizabeth talking to Desmond . Though I 'm just wondering how much she would be speaking to the viewers as her character is a bit of an enigma . I've been trying to figure out how Elizabeth is going to die in the season finale because she doesn't appear on the show after that, and I'm guessing she will just be dead of course, but it looks like she will be dying in that episode, so that will probably be my only chance to figure out if it's really her , unless they do the flash forward in season 3.

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David . "The Apple Tree" is written for the Broadway play "A Little Night Music" which starred Mary Martin , Barbara Cook and Richard Chamberlain. It is a very sweet story about finding the true meaning of love. I love this music. It makes me think about what it means to love someone. I don't think the song is meant to be taken that seriously. It is kind of humorous, and I think that's why it worked so well.

Another enjoyable Warner flick . I really liked John Garfield in this , though I 'm wondering why Cagney was given such an unimportant role . He is very likable , though , and gives a fine performance . A great story that has a lot of depth , and is well acted. It's a good thriller with a very interesting premise . I think it's a good story , and I'm very glad that I saw the movie . The movie is very good in every aspect , though it seems like the director made a lot of changes to the original book .

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . If you remember the 1974 film then you will remember Kersey was a " Conchie " during the Korean war and that he was physically sick after he committed his first execution . Ten years later Kersey seems to have learned unarmed combat and how to handle anti tank weapons in his spare time . But I`ll overlook that gaffe because DW3 is the best of the sequels , lowlife scum bags get shot dead , burned alive , their teeth smashed , and thrown to their deaths by middle aged housewives armed with sweeping brushes .

Years ago I read the book ' A Máquina ' ( The machine ) . As I re-read this little book a few months ago, I realized I could write a book in English on the same subject.

' The machine ' was written in Brazil in the 1980s, so this book must be translated to be read in English. There are many other languages, as the original book is in Portuguese.
