It's a good read if you want a good laugh. In short, the book describes in detail how a machine was created to control all human functions, including sleep, memory, digestion, etc.

I 've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie . I agree with much of what is said in these reviews , except one thing - "Lost Horizons" is a science fiction film . "The Poseidon Adventure" is a science fiction film . I don't think there is a great deal of difference between them , except that "Lost Horizons" is more about the future of humanity ( and by extension, more about mankind ) and "The Poseidon Adventure" about the past of mankind, the time when life on Earth changed.

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave . I 'm happy with that , especially as it was a genre that was never really taken seriously before Scream. Now, many independent horror directors and screenwriters are really getting a chance in Hollywood ,and that's a great thing for us horror lovers . Here are our top five favorites for your viewing pleasure. 5. A Nightmare on Elm Street - A Nightmare on Elm Street was a perfect example of how NOT to make a sequel. The director had already proven he could make a scary film with Dreamcatcher .

In an early scene, Luca (David Pasquesi) and James (Jeff Garlin) are walking down a neighborhood street in Chicago, admiring the bucolic architecture, when a woman, angrily arguing in French on a cell phone, passes by them, prompting James to remark, "There's nothing hotter than an angry French woman." A few blocks later, they pass an old Filipino woman, also angry, also arguing on a cell phone, and Luca remarks, for referential effect, "There's nothing hotter than an angry, elderly Filipino woman.

Surprisingly effective British drama about two very different people who find common ground , and in particular the `` flowering of love . ``

Cast: Maggie Gyllenhaal , Sam Waterston , John Hurt , Christopher Eccleston , Richard Dreyfuss , Laura Linney

Director: Stephen Frears

Rating: **1/2

What it's about: Two very different people whose paths cross. What it's really about: The triumphs and travails of a happy couple in the real world. It's really a love story, which is a good thing since Maggie Gyllenhall and Sam Waterston don't exactly have high expectations for their marriage.

I do n't care what some of the reviews said , this movie was funny . The thing with this was that the cast did a pretty good job of playing the parts . Some of the parts that i like , i did not n't care for . Like i said, it was funny . I do n't think that this movie will be as well remembered as the first . I do think it will make more of a splash with kids and adults as the first did . It has a couple of good parts to it , but it is not really worth it .

Diora Baird is absolutely hot as hell in this movie. But really all the characters are amazingly fun to watch. (MINOR SPOILERS) As per usual, the main character, B, is the sane one of the bunch. B has this crazy idea to make up his own college when he's rejected from all colleges he applies to. He's known for making fake IDs. so an acceptance letter is no problem.Because B's dad is a hard @$$ and suspicious of this university he's never heard of, B gets his friend Sherman to design a website for the university.

Being American , I have not been exposed to this character before , which is good because some of you might not know who i was talking about . I have read that he is considered by some , to be the original American , if not the originator of the concept of the American dream . This character has many faces , but in my case , I am talking about the character of the American boy . I am not talking about real American boys because I have not grown up in a country that is considered the home of America , to say that my parents are American , it’s impossible .

The best thing from the American Pie `` bakery . '' I found the humor and the plot to be rather clever, and the characters had enough depth to be sympathetic. I enjoyed the story and enjoyed the humor. I would not want to know the ending, so I am not giving it away. I had some difficulty understanding the first paragraph, but after I re-read it a few times (and a few times more before I could finish the book), I thought it was fine. The book was a little bit on the violent side, but I didn't think it was overly violent.

I agree that this is ONE of the very best episodes of the entire series -- my only detraction would be that there should be more of a story here, rather than such a rushed, rushed, hurried, hurried episode (even though that was the intent and purpose) with only 2 or 3 plot points at the most. In fact, I'm pretty sure that if the series had followed the same course as the episode, it may have been as successful as that one. It was such a fun episode, and I'm so glad that I was able to see it in it's entirety.

This show really is the Broadway American Idol. It has singing, the British Guy, A guy who's sometimes nice, and a super-nice woman.Of course it is different because there is a sing-off, and there's dancing and some acting (we just don't see some of the acting). I gave this show a 7 because there are a couple tweaks that I know a lot of people (including me)would make if they were working for the show. The first thing that really needs to be changed is the judges deciding who goes home.

SPOILERS BELOW`A Dog's Life' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing. In Charlie Chaplin's other movie from 1918, `Shoulder Arms', the silent film genius focuses on an entirely different brand of humor. His war comedy specializes in surreal, exaggerated set pieces in which Chaplin demonstrates unprecedented creativity and mastery of composition. When the soldier's bunker gets flooded, the water level reaches just the right height so that Chaplin can execute his gags most successfully. In a later scene, the soldier dresses up as a tree, a disguise that belies Chaplin's much increased ingenuity and goofiness.

A great movie . The movie was even better then the commercials put on . And believe it or not that's alot more then the movie itself was . I would have give this movie an A+ but that's just my opinion. I don't know how many people would watch that much to know if it was a bad movie. I would say everyone who liked it would watch the movie in its entirety. And for people who didn't like the movie but watched it it would be for the music . I know a lot of people like the music .

I first saw `` Signs of Life '' on PBS as an American Playhouse presentation . It 's a wonderfully crafted play, very well acted and directed. I also think it may be the most important theatrical experience I've had in a long time. If you're curious why, here are the reasons why you should watch this film, followed by my notes:

Reasons to watch Signs of Life, and why I'd recommend it:

1. Because it is the best film I've seen in a long time. If you'd like to learn more about the theater arts, this is a film to watch.

When I was 10 ( currently 14 ) , I vowed to never see a movie that I knew would be rated R until I was well into my 20's. As an adult, I've found that I can't make a vow to myself like that and I've seen quite a few movies that would have been rated R under my 10 year-old's definition of what a movie should be. Today I'm going to list off a handful of the movies that I've seen under my age 10-13-14 year old standards and let me know your thoughts.

The `` old dark house '' sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the film. It is a fact that there are some horror films so great that it can be almost difficult to pick the best from the best. In fact, it has often been the subject of debate on horror-movie buffs sites, with the general consensus always leaning towards the original, or at least to one of the best horror movies from a certain year, such as The Blair Witch Project. This year there are a number of great examples from the sub-genre, making for an even more exciting and varied list.

This film set the standard for all rock biopics to follow . It accomplished this through the energetic performances of its lead actor, Robert Goulet, and director, Richard Lester, and the way in which it told the story of Bob Dylan's rise to the top of the charts of American pop music in a way never before attempted in a rock biopic . The title of the film, "Don't Look Back", is taken from the song "With God on Our Side", by Bob Dylan, written and sung by Dylan, and on the film's soundtrack album, by Goulet .

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie ( I have lived here my whole life and worked there for years, so it was a pretty big deal to me when they first came in 1972 and made that movie here on Ocracoke. A few years back, they did another movie, called “Pirates Of the Atlantic” and they filmed some of the movie here on Ocracoke, so I have a special interest in it now. It is always fun to see them come in. I usually see one or more of them when they are filming.

This is probably my favourite TV show ever. I love all the characters, especially Alex, who is the PERFECT woman! Always makes me laugh and feel good when I watch this show. There is just something about it that is amazing, hard to describe.It seems some or all of the episodes synchronise with music albums as well. Here are a few examples. (The episodes start again when they end - but DON'T play end credits until the very end, but always play the opening credits. With most the episodes the album plays once and the episodes play twice, but some go on further.

I just thought I would add another observation, here. While there are a couple of visual sub-references, in this episode, to the possibility of unexpressed feelings between Jim Kirk and Yeoman Janice Rand; there is a special, physically tender, moment, toward the end. When the Enterprise is reversing at emergency warp speed in an attempt to outrun a possibly fatal Romulan plasma ball, Janice, perhaps fearing that their life is about to come to a dramatic end, seeks comfort by placing her head on Jim's sympathetic shoulder as they observe the aproaching instrument of their impending doom on the main viewer.

If you are looking for a phony Hollywood action movie, this won't be one for you. If the Truth is what you seek, rent or buy this. From a true story, the movie attempts to capture the heart of what was/is happening in South Africa (and many other places).For historical knowledge, this rates up there with stories such as "The Pianist," "Schindler's List" or "Nuremberg." Millions of people today have no clue what apartheid is or that it even exists. This movie may help them learn, and may even help them dig deeper.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar! The film took a while to pick up from the start, at least for me seeing as I expected this was a run-along America Pie flick. But it was slightly different-- a fun-loving slacker who finishes high school and makes his OWN college, running it accordingly. As you can expect, there's a lot of parties and hot girls in bikinis but this film tried harder than your average teen flick. Bartleby Gaines (Justin Long) encourages his students / peers to learn through freedom of expression and ultimately 'shove it to the system.'

I think that anybody whose dumb enough to risk being a wax dummy just so they can go to a museum or a theatre and enjoy a show, they deserve it. They should be able to see this show if they want, but it's their choice and they should pay the ticket. If they want to see something else, then they should pay the ticket too. They should be a little more mature about life and do their research, or they're just stupid and should be ashamed of it. I'm a musician, but I'm not stupid.

A very suspenseful giallo from the director of "L'Anticristo"(1974),this one begins with a brilliantly-handled sequence involving a priest,a little girl,and a broken doll.However the main story is about maniac(David Warbeck)marrying a traumatized cripple to kill her for her money.The plot,whilst not original,is really suspenseful,the acting is good and there are several skillful and gory murders.The score by Francesco de Massi is quite effective,some of which can also be heard in Lucio Fulci's "The New York Ripper"(1982).Highly recommended for fans of Italian cinema!

I love this movie, though I don't like how they picture Egyptians, being an Egyptian citizen myself! that's why it earns an eight out of 10.The relationship between Augustin and the leopard is awkward, and of course because of loneliness and living in that cave for quite so long, he develops a kind of insanity and passion to that leopard.A very touching scene when the leopard dies, watch Augustin's reaction.. All in all I find it enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to reading the short story by Balzac.

What an excellent movie , made even more so by the fact that my wife and I stumbled onto it in our local independent cinema. I don't usually go for foreign films but decided to give the local cinema's showing of this a try. I'm so glad I did as it was very well made and very good story telling. A nice change from the usual Hollywood blockbusters. It's a very well-crafted story. I like the look of it very much. The story line is interesting, the characters are well-defined. I like the way that they used the setting to build the story.

Yes , at times `` Unconditional Love '' overwhelms as it bounces -- no , as it ricochets -- from object and subject . The love of the parents for their children is `` unconditional '' while the love of children for their parents is not . But , is the love of the children for their parents any less unconditional ? To say otherwise is to condemn parents to their own self - condemnation . I have never met a parent who loves their child any less , and yet , many parents feel guilty because their children hate them or vice versa.

This is one of those movies where I just want to move my feet and dance around the house. It's a very positive and happy type of music. The movie has some sad parts but mostly the music is what makes me happy. Gary Busey did a great job as Buddy Holly. Buddy Holly kept on going even tho his pastor, his parents and the Nashville record producer told him no. Buddy Holly didn't give up on what he liked. I didn't know much about Buddy Holly until I watched this movie.

Damien O'Donnell has a good track record and in this film he handles a very delicate topic with sensitivity but manages not to let the film turn into schmalz.This is a fantastic film, its funny with sad bits and it makes you look at things differently. Tell everyone you know to go see it now- FANTASTIC!The acting is excellent, and Dublin plays a starring role. This film will change the way you view people with disabilities and also give you a very entertaining night out in the cinema. I can't wait til it comes out on DVD.

NOBODY ( 1999 ) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir . It 's about three salarymen who get in an accident and are thrown into jail . They 're on trial because they don 't pay their bills on time . However , this doesn 't mean they got to go to jail . The only way they can save themselves is by killing the lawyer and his secretary that they 've hired to defend them . They hire a hit man to do the job . They pay him a lot of money . They also give him the car he 'll drive and a gun to use to kill their lawyer and the secretary .

I admit to being in awe of the Sea and have spent a number of years in the Navy , but it has been quite a bit since I have seen the ocean. I am a bit worried that if we have an emergency and need to jump at sea I would be of no use to the Sea or Navy as I have no experience in jumping at sea. I am open to the idea, I just do not want it to be on a Sunday morning. Just thought I would put that out there. Just be ready to go.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie . She was only 19 when I saw it in 1954 and I didn’t know much about her other than she was famous as an actress for her beauty. Lana was an Academy Award winning actress before she became a star. She began making movies when she was just 19 and I watched her dance and sing in this movie. I have seen a lot of old movies and when I saw this one, I was so taken by the dancing. It was the best dancing in the movie.

This film had about everything one could wish when viewing it originally , at the end of the 1960 's . I had not been aware of it until a couple of years ago and had never seen the likes of any of these actors or actresses before then either . This film had all the ingredients of one of the best crime films that I had ever seen , it had all the right ingredients , it had style , it had an incredible soundtrack and it had a story , and I had never seen before in any other film that I had ever seen .

I'm not a massive Disney fan, but my 7 year old son is starting to get into them, so we've built up quite a collection, and this is one of my favourites. We first saw this a couple of weeks ago and we must have see it half a dozen times since! OK, as others have pointed out, not the most complex or inventive of plots, but there's more to a film than that.Great characters, Phil Harris stealing the show as Thomas O'Malley, but Edgar the butler not far behind.

I do n't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor . You need to understand there is a very fine line between being funny and being offensive. There's also something wrong with the people who can't laugh at themselves. I thought it was good that you posted it here. I do not know where your from but I will say that some people in America and even in my country of the UK do not take the time to read a joke before posting it. Some people are too ignorant to know when they are wrong.

This film was one of three that were later combined by Chapin into a compilation that was released to theaters. This was originally released in the United States on September 25, 1964, by Universal International Pictures and Universal Studios. The film was one of a trio of films (the others being What's New, Pussycat?) released to capitalize on the film Pussycat, which was released a month earlier on August 24, 1964. There was no soundtrack album for the feature, as it was not meant to have one. The film soundtrack was released to record stores on October 8, 1964.

The very few reviews I could find online of Barnens ö really do not do it justice. I read them all before ordering the DVD, but for some reason I ordered it anyway. I regretted it almost immediately, but the order had already gone through so I couldn't cancel it. I'm very glad now that I couldn't. It's an extraordinary movie.I won't give a synopsis of the plot, because other reviewers have already done that. But I will say that I don't understand comments that it's bleak, shocking, weird, clinical, depressing or pornographic.

David Attenborough brings his fascination of wild life , this time the creatures under the sea , in this extraordinary documentary. He talks with scientists from all over the world who work in the sea, to understand what makes the sea animals move. He also interviews scientists who study the sea animals that he describes as being his life-long fascination, such as deep sea divers, fish, squid, jellyfish, and coral. It is not surprising that the documentary is divided into 5 chapters and has subtitles in many languages, including French, Spanish, Russian, German and Chinese.

Try to look for another movie that is such a trip without having a story or plot and you 'll see one. 1 of 9 - +1 +1 Share this review Google+ 0





There were two people in this movie. They were a young man and woman. I'm not entirely sure who they were. I know what the young man was. I think I knew the girl. But it wasn't much I could put into words, and I didn't even think I had any thoughts to write. I just sat and looked. And then I started to laugh.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time . Excellent original music , clever , heady ... it was very clever . The picture has an original style . The plot is simple but clever . The characters in the film are so real . A lot of the things that happen are so simple but are written in such a witty and funny way . A great comedy film that you will laugh at more than once . The characters in the film are so clever and funny . Everything that happens is written in such a witty and smart way . One of the wittiest comedies ever made .

I can not say this movie was a hilarious, but I must have had a grin on my face the entire time. I like this darker kind of comedy; "very bad things", "8 heads in a duffel bag" or "coldblooded"The way the main character tries to get away with murder is a lot of fun to watch. To me it was not much of a surprise what the ending would be, but the way that ending came about was. Another thing that sticks out, is the way they have managed to involve the audience.

I love the TV contest . Hate to see it end . There are so many talented contestants . It was a very tough call . I really enjoyed watching all of them . So sad it ended so soon , but I am very excited to see what their future holds . I think they can be successful with all their potential . I really liked this season because I got to see so many different styles of design. All the contestants were talented. Unfortunately, there are only two artists left, so it is probably over now.

( Synopsis ) Graduating high school senior Bartleby `` B '' Gaines ( Justin Long ) finds himself without a college scholarship. His academic record is poor, and he does not get along with his parents, who are divorced. Bartleby spends the summer at home, working a low paying, menial job in his father's shoe store. To help make ends meet, he begins to sell drugs to a high school football star to raise money for his dream of attending college. At the same time, he falls in love with the pretty daughter of his boss.

Chucky (the murderous doll from "Child's Play" and 2 crappy sequels) is dead. But his ex-girlfriend Tiffany (Jennifer Tilly) gets his remains and (using "Voodoo for Dummies") revives him. Then, through circumstances too convoluted to get into, SHE is killed and has her soul put into another doll! Together they fall in love and kidnap a nice couple (Nick Stabile, Katherine Heigl) to take them to Chuck's coffin to get an amulet to make Chucky and Tiffany real people again...A lot better than it sounds.

One of the most magnificent movies ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known as Bronson ) is amazing in a way that makes you feel that you know these people who are on the screen and that they are not actors but the real people who are living on these streets . One of the most powerful movies on drug abuse in America . One of the few films to deal with the issue of drug addiction in a realistic manner . The music of the soundtrack is wonderful . The story line is powerful enough to make you think that it happened in your own family .

I absolutely adore this movie! I had never heard of it when I saw it at the video store. I saw Kathy Bates was in it, so I figured it had to have some worth, you know? I watched it the first time just shaking my head . . . huh? Then it was the last scene and I found myself aching from smiling so hard. I clicked "play movie" and watched the whole thing again. It is without doubt the quirkiest movie I've ever seen. But the more I watch it, the more I love it.

This is an example of what film school lecturers would call a good debut movie. It follows all the rules. Short scenes, to the point, cheap to shoot, guerilla-film-making, no sets (just disused buildings) and possibly an empty hospital wing. Also, even the black&white film-stock was a stroke of genius, probably selected more for its low expense rather than film effect, but it worked.Reno was amazing as the Brute. Everyone's acting was brilliant. The plot was simple and effective and no flabby bits left to distract you.

No real plot, no character development, no Scorcese-level direction, but seriously, were you really expecting any of this? The only thing that matters is that this flick is absolutely hilarious, nearly on the same level as Borat. Sure, the ending drags a bit, but if Borat's cameo didn't crack you up, you must be the worst batty boy in the history of batty boys. Sacha Baron Cohen is possibly the greatest comedian ALIVE, and here he gets more laughs than Jude Law on a nude beach.

What a great film ! I never knew much about Buddy Holly , but was familiar with his lively and upbeat songs such as , ‘ Oh ‘ Baby , ‘ Not Fade Away ‘ and ‘ Not Dark Yet ‘. I think that his songs are very infectious , as I remember playing them in my car in my twenties and thirties as I would sing them and then laugh as I would look at the clock as I knew that the minute I turned the ignition , the car would start and then I would sing more.

In the first transformation scene , what is the music ? I 've heard it was `` The Greeks Do The Thinking '' or something like that. I 've never heard it . I have heard a lot of quotes of it but I never really heard the whole song because I was so busy looking at the action and what was going on . I 've heard a song called `` They Do The Thinking '' , that was playing in a bar . It was probably the same thing. In the second and third transformation , can anyone identify the music ?

It's just that. Chucky 1 was good. Chucky 2 was better. Chucky 3 sucked. Now, the 4th in the series which is, in my opinion, the best out of the series. Jennifer Tilly was just great in this movie. For dolls, they were better than a few actors that come to mind (Freddie Prince Jr, for one) and funnier than many comedies I've seen in the past.The plot wasn't great, but I really didn't care about it. Just to see Chucky and Tiffany bicker and fight each other.

* May Contain Spoilers * The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was a kid, and I got to see it several times during that period, so I’m pretty familiar with the film. But the first time I ever really saw it, and actually experienced it, was when it came out on DVD in the early 2000s. It was during the summer of my senior year of high school. We were sitting in the back row of a movie theater that showed all the movies for $5.00 a pop.

"Blind Spot" one of my festival favorites. I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers searching for a mysterious man who has loved and betrayed each of them in different ways. The cast is great. James Franco is particularly amazing as the broken-hearted boy from Los Angeles. His journal entries, which we hear in voice-over-narration, work well with the visuals and are quite intense. The film has a powerful style. It pushes elements like the road movie and revenge-drama in new directions. It also plays with time and perspective in ways that capture the frightening ambiance of lost love.

I was about 14 years old as I saw the musical version of Lost Horizon. I loved the film so much as well as the songs that I went several times to the cinema to see it again and again. My mother bought the LP and I learnt the songs off by heart, just as I did with "The sound of Music" (which people hardly know in Austria). I think the problem with some of these self-appointed critics who's comments get published is that they don't have a romantic soul and didn't see the film through the eyes of a young teenager.

*Could contain spoilers, read only after seeing last episode season 2* Think about it. The guys on the north pole? Center of the earth? Looking for abnormal magnetic behavior? They also said something about: "did we miss it again?" So there was another abnormality? Of course that was when the plain crashed! I think this whole Island is a setup. Set up by her daddy. She found out about it and is looking for her Desmond. How else can she know what to look for.So basically it's an Island in a magnetic shield.

Saw the film at the closing gala of the Ealing Film Festival in West London ( England ) . Enjoyed it but the movie is too slow moving and not at all exciting at least for me . As a person who likes action it was difficult to stay interested . I found it boring . I was expecting more and I found more . The main problem is the screenplay . The dialogue is very weak and the screenplay has a lot of repetitions . In the end there is no surprise . This movie was not so good . In my opinion this movie was much better a few years ago when I saw it .

When I first saw this movie , I also expected `` our boys '' to be cute , and more or less a comedy . however , it turns out to be more of a horror movie as well as a fantasy . the boys ( jason patric ) , two 11-year-olds from a rural area of north carolina , fall in love with the girl they think is a ghost . the girl is actually a very strange , evil witch . after a few nights spent in the house with her , they decide to stay for good .

Spike Milligan's books and plays have defeated film makers over the years, and 2002's 'Puckoon' is sadly no exception. The novel, set in 1924, concerns the partitioning of Ireland, in particular its effects on a solitary community ( the 'Puckoon' of the title ). Due to a colossal blunder, half the village is now in Northern Ireland, the other half is in the Republic. Locals go to the toilets at the bottom of their gardens to find a barbed wire fence blocking their path. Drinkers crowd like sardines into a corner of the pub to enjoy a cheaper pint.

The movie is excellent. Acting, cinematography, direction and music are spellbinding. It seems to me that the reason so many give the movie a low score is because of the devotion they have to the original, 1937 version starring Ronald Coleman. That movie - for good reason! - engendered an unbelievable level of commitment. From talking with people who saw the original when it first came out, I believe the impact was something akin to the first "Starwars" movie in modern times. I have seen it. It was and is wonderful.

The "old dark house" sub-genre that dominated the early talkies rarely fails to disappoint when we re-view the oldies to-day. Here is one that provides so very many suspicious characters you have to wonder how they will be able to tie up all the loose ends in the 6 reel running time.The Crooked Circle is a gang of counterfeiters and thieves who have decided to take revenge on Col. Walters (Berton Churchill) who has sent one of their ranks to prison. They decide he must die that very night. Meanwhile the Colonel's own group, The Sphinx Club, is determined to protect him at all costs.

I first saw The Victim (aka Out Of Contention) well over 25 years ago when I was very young. Being a passionate fan of Bewitched since I was a child, I loved to watch anything that starred Elizabeth Montgomery. This movie was (and still is) a real treat - whether you are a fan of Miss Montgomery's work or not. Elizabeth always shines in her roles, such as her portrayal as the rape victim in A Case Of Rape and as the suspected murderess in The Legend Of Lizzie Borden.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I 've just managed to watch this film for the second time in a month! As I did last time I will say that it's a well shot and edited film though I didn't like the main character very much. He's a very arrogant and irritating character and I think the film would've been a lot more interesting with someone else as main character. The basic story of the movie is pretty interesting but I think it got really boring after a while for me because the film has some very stupid moments.

Most critics seem to have dismissed this film , like so many other Charles Bronson vehicles , as just another in a string of tough-guy action films that has been in steady supply for the past three decades or so. But the picture is much deeper than that. It’s actually the most important film in Bronson's career by a considerable margin. More than that, if you take away the fact that the character of Bronson plays his part in what amounts to a religious war, he plays his part with complete sincerity and conviction.

This movie possesses something most other movies of its genre do not: intelligence and good messages. Accepted, is the story of a kid named Bartleby (Justin Long) who gets rejected by every college he applies to. His parents are incredibly strict, frustrated and disappointed. So, Bartleby and a few other students who face similar problems start a fake college, to pawn themselves off to their parents as college kids. Not everything goes to plan, and the movie is about them winging it. But behind this plot which sounds ridiculous, there are good messages, morals and a new outlook on the American educational system.

I viewed the original Outer Limits in real time , when first broadcast and have since viewed the entire original series on DVD. It was also shown in syndication in reruns. I would highly recommend a view of it to anyone interested. As far as the first series of Outer Limits, yes the original series is worth a watch, but you might as well watch reruns as much as I do. The stories are a bit dated. The Outer Limits will always have my favorite episodes and stories of all the original series. It is still a favorite for many.

The Snowqueen is one of the best love stories I have ever seen: much better and deeper than Luhrman's Romeo&Juliet or Spielberg's Titanic. Gerda's love impresses me every time, her search, her battle is exceptional. Gerda becomes a strong, loving woman throughout the movie. Kay is the poisoner of dark forces: the temptation. This story encourages me to fight like Gerda for the ONLY ONE, for the love of my life, for Mister Right. Patience is one of the keywords of this movie. I cry every time when I realize all the suffering of Gerda and Kay.

The Paul Kersey of DEATH WISH 3 is very far removed from the Paul Kersey of the original film . . . in fact the only thing the two Kerseys have in common is the surname. This article is a sequel to this article , but does not contain any new information, merely an analysis and interpretation of the original Paul Kersey and the Death Wish character as it appears in the novel and film. This is a sequel of sorts because it was only after seeing the original Paul Kersey as he appears in the book that I decided to start studying and writing my original Paul Kersey profile.

As I have said before, I am NOT a fan of Tweety. He's just so aggravating I wish Sylvester would just eat him and get it over with.In this cartoon Sly is homeless once again and is back to feeding out of garbage cans. He spots a cruise ship leaving port nearby and decides to hop aboard when he spys Tweety is one of the passengers. The ship provides an adequate stage for the following hijinks and Sly desperately tries to catch the annoying bird and avoid seasickness. If only for once he's succeed by chewing and swallowing, thus finishing of the irritating Canary forever.

This is another film where the cinematography is the best thing to recommend it . That would be fine if this was a B movie but this is supposed to be one of the best thrillers ever made . In the first 20 minutes the action is so intense and the acting and cinematography so realistic that one has a feeling that one is actually in a scene of the film . The story is very well structured and if you are not aware of some things in the beginning, you will be a little confused but then you will understand .

This new installment to the Child 's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as the scene where the doctor talks to a doll while giving it an injection. I am a huge horror fan and there is not a single scene in this movie that is scary. The only one I could remember is when Chucky and Tiffany are making love when Chucky tries to strangle her. But other than that the whole movie was very funny. I just wish it had been a movie all in one day. I was a bit disappointed in how long this movie was but it was a good laugh.

*May Contain Spoilers*The first time I saw this movie was when it was re-released on video when I was around 8 years old. Now I am 17 and still watch it whenever I get a chance to. "The Aristocats" was a cute heart warming film that I immediately fell in love with. I loved the songs on it especially the one the kittens sing by the piano. In fact I even sang it in a talent show with my sister and friend since I loved it that much. All three kittens are so cute and their mother is one of the prettiest cartoon cats I ever saw.

Garlin outdoes himself as writer-director-actor in his indie production about a big guy (Garlin) wandering around Chicago with an eye for every woman he sees. The laughs keep coming almost every minute. It's a somewhat dramatic and serious story about a man looking for love, but done with great comedic writing and acting. The supporting roles are also very well done and very funny and really make the movie rich.Rose Abdoo is hysterical in her receptionist role taking you right into the mood of the rest of the film. Sara Silverman is awesome with some of the great bits she does with Jeff.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (which more or less takes place in the desert). It also models some of the bizarre humor (and especially eccentric trail of characters) of writer Joseph Minion's comedy, 'After Hours.' In a sort of desert roadtrip fantasy, a metaphor of temptation and redemption, Gus (played well by Jordan Christopher Michael), a clever 10 year-old boy cashes in his piggy bank, steals a Mustang, and runs away from his grossly neglecting parents.

The movie is based on a Jules Verne book I actually have read once, about ten years ago. I remember I liked the book a lot, and this movie does a good job in telling the story. The most important thing in this movie isn't the story, however, but the highly original visual look it has.The visuals are absolutely beautiful, and they are apparently achieved by a clever combination of animated drawings combined with live actors, stop-motion animation and sets that are painted so that they look much like from an animated movie.

NOBODY (1999) is a fantastic piece of Japanese noir. It's about three salarymen who get in way over their heads when their innocent, drunken cheapshots p*** off three OTHER guys one night in a bar. When these three mysterious strangers, who are up to much more deviant no-goodness than even the film allows us to know, beat the living daylights out of one of our "heroes", the trio decides to return the favour in kind - only they accidentally KILL one of the other guys!

This is a well directed Columbo episode, with also some good character but the story just doesn't really know to interest enough and doesn't appear as well layered and constructed as was often the case with a Columbo movie. This also goes for the killer's plot to kill his uncle. It's quite simple and doesn't seem as well thought out. Perhaps this movie didn't really took itself serious enough, since the atmosphere of the movie is mostly light. At least when compared to different Columbo movies.For instance the movie features quite a large amount of comical relief, mostly coming from the Columbo character himself.

Let 's be fair : there are no RULES for scriptwriting , so I wo n't say the movie SHOULDN'T have been done that way . But I can 't help but wonder how it would 've been with a different scriptwriter ! And with a different production company ! And with a different director ! And a different cast ... . And a different studio ! ... . And a different movie ! ... . But you get my point. So what 's it like to be a writer ? And how 's it different from a painter , an artist , a designer or a musician ?

This movie is truly a classic 80s movie ! A must have in any '80s ' movie collection ! Guns, guns, guns, and more guns ! The acting is brilliant, and it brings a whole new meaning to the phrase 'the 80s' and what the 80s truly meant. I give this movie 10 out of ten stars, and it is a very rare movie that I watch on a daily basis, as it just keeps you entertained and wanting more. If you are looking for an 80s masterpiece, or looking for some great 80s comedy, you can do a lot better then this movie.

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the cast

I saw this play in London when it opened in 1991 - and it's one which has never left me, particularly the final scene. I was too young to understand the play back then, but I do now, and what struck me even more was a film I'd seen just the year before, starring Tom Wilkinson (who, it seems, was an old student of mine at Bristol - I can't remember why).

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I 'm Dancing' which was actually the original title. The reason I got the tickets was because I have always had a soft spot for Ireland and was really looking forward to the film. This was because I had never seen an Irish film before, not because I've never been to Ireland. I went to Ireland in the summer last year with the rest of my family. I was only there for one day though and didn't go on any holidays.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an "against the system" type of movie and attitude. It is an excellent portrayal of the "system" in question and how ridiculous it truly is. The funny parts in the movie are in fact funny because they speak the truth about the world around us. Anyone who finds this movie to be unrealistic is simply denying the self evident truths about life. And that is to learn what you enjoy. That is what college should be about..I come to find that a comment must have at least 10 lines.

Great movie . Post-apocalyptic films kick ass . This one is no exception . Kept up the pace and interest until the very end . Great characters , solid plot and an ending that will have you scratching your head and smiling . This was the first post-apocalypse film that I'd ever seen and I must say, I love it . I am not a fan of films about zombies at all but I just couldn't put this one down . It is fast-paced , funny , and full of heart and I loved it ! I would recommend this one to anyone that has a taste for post-apoc films !

Ah the Outer Limits. I love that show. It was surpremely creepy, or down-right mysterious. I loved all the genres of the show, from horror, to thriller to mystery, whatever the genre, it was good. I guess I must have started watching way after it got canceled, when Sci-fi showed it as re-runs, or played marathons of it. It was a really good show, I don't know all about the seasons and everything but I do remember that every time I saw the screen freak out and the voice on the TV say: "There is nothing wrong with your television.

From the creators of Bruce Almighty and Liar Liar ! The film took a while to pick up from the beginning. The first couple minutes or so were good, but after that it never really took off. The concept is interesting but the characters (mainly Jack Black) were a little too broad and over the top to the point of being unbelievable. I know this was a big hit for Jack Black, but there's just too many times I wanted to ask the writers, "Where's the movie in here? There are no real obstacles or challenges for him to overcome.

Pity the Monkees . People always accused them of being manufactured ( which they were ) or being nothing more than a musical side show ( which was not the truth ) so it is not that surprising to me they got their asses kicked in the ratings war for the ages. But it is just so damn funny how people try and hold them up as if the 70's TV phenomenon was their sole accomplishment. They were a TV phenomenon, and the TV show was only the first wave of a wave that started in the 70's .

I first started watching The Outer Limits back in 95 when I was 10, and it just blew my mind every week with each episode, every episode had a twist and each week I couldn't wait for the next. How the writers managed to do every episode so well and make it different from each over a course of 7 seasons is beyond me. This show manages to teach us about life, robotics, Alien and human encounters, and an insight into more of the paranormal, and how it affects the people.

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character, unable to speak, living in a world incompatible with modern life. He trusts to his homemade weaponry - helmet, sleeves, and spear - made out of hubcaps, seat cushions, and discarded office furniture. Just as Don Quixote rode Rocicante, "The Man" rides his contraption (literally) transcending the lost lives caught up the harsh and demeaning modern world - soaring above the earth, away from the plight of modern man. Both characters ride in search of adventure in an effort to right the wrongs of the world.

Duchess is a pretty white cat who lives with her three kittens in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris. One night the Duchess goes out to do her business and she gets caught by the gardener who fucks her doggy style. This gardener also comes into the house and they do some really hot fucking. Finally, the gardener cums over the duchess and she gives him a nice blowjob to swallow the cum. She is the most popular girl in town. A group of horny young ladies have made their way down to a secluded place in their hometown to practice for their exams.

Lost has been one of the most mesmerizing and thrilling experience I've ever seen. Not only it's the mother of coincidence, but also every time that you think you can set up the whole puzzle in your head, the story takes a completely new direction.Take this casualty for example, The US marine, whom gives Sayid the way to become a Torturer, Is Clancy Brown, playing a character named Joe Inman. In the last episode, he is playing Kelvin Inman, the Desmond partner in the Hatch. Destiny, uh?

Ross Hunter 's musical remake of the 1937 fantasy , based on James Hilton 's enduring bestseller , was written for television and directed and produced by Jonathan Miller . The show premiered on the ITV network on the evening of Friday 3 March 1974 . It was seen as a critical success , though the reviews were mixed and there was little commercial success when it aired. An American version aired on ABC in January 1976 , but it did not feature the original cast or music. A radio version , based on the original novel , aired in the U.S. in 1979.

At first I didn't think I would like this movie, but as it progressed it became better and better. I love music and I was impressed with how well Cage could fake the movements of playing a mandolin. My son was with me and he also like the movie a lot for its music and the story and the way the story unfolded--- slowly showing how Corelli won the girls heart. The acting and the story were both well done and well directed. At first Corelli's bravado was irritating, but soon he grew on you.

I've seen the 1973 movie Lost Horizons and read many of the reviews for this movie. I agree the move had many opportunities for improvement but unlike all those who are looking for the perfect movie with the perfect songs and the best acting, I was looking for something a bit different and this movie gave it to me. I watched this movie not as a critic but as a person looking for a little hope, a little cheer, a bit of a release from my everyday life, and this is what I got.

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918, a doughboy who can not seem to get the marching down straight. He spends time "over there" in World War One trenches. Several gags stand out: Limburger cheese as a makeshift grenade for one. The cramped quarters of the barracks in the trenches and when Chaplin and his mates are washed out of their bunks by flooding are highlights. Chaplin ends up capturing several German soldiers single-handed, and he spanks the German commander for refusing a cigarette. When asked how he did it, Chaplin replies that he surrounded them.

It took me a while to find this movie since they do n't have it yet on DVD ( and it's not available on the streaming services ), but I finally found it. I remember seeing it at the theater when I was kid and it was the first PG rated movie I've seen ( at least up to that date ) so I remember being impressed. The premise is that a boy named Billy Batson ( the kid that turns into a superhero ) travels through time where he finds that the villains of his youth are still about and want to steal his powers.

Captain Corelli's Mandolin is no Oscar contender but it was pretty good. I have to admit Ms Cruz can really act. She puts on a very good performance. In fact she our does her boyfriend Tom in drama. John Hurt was great as usual. Nicholas Cage seemed to be enjoying himself. I bet he felt he was going back to his roots as an Italian. However, I did learn something. One more chapter in Horrors of Nazi Germany the many Italian soliders killed during the period of there surrender to the allies and Germany's eventual surrender.

`` A Slight Case of Murder '' is an excellent TV movie , which is defiantly worth the price of admission. There are so many things I liked about this movie , it would be hard to list them. 1. The concept of this movie is good , as it revolves around three people who meet by chance at a small college. There is a mystery surrounding the people , but it is so well presented , that you never even think it is going to have anything to do with the murder which happens in the end.

First of all , around the time I wrote this comment , I had already read what kittiwake-1 had written about this problem. So if you think that my comment is useless , you are wrong. As kittiwake said, it is not a bug , but a limitation . And the fact that it is reported as "bug" just reflects the way that most people (me included ) think that it should be fixed . It is not fixed . It is still in development . It will never be fixed , unless there are enough users that find it acceptable enough that it gets the attention of the developers.

Sacha Baron Cohen is a genius. And this movie is good! Although the film doesn't nearly reach the quality of the tv-show, it's still very funny and has some seriously wicked moments! I've liked Ali G since the first time I saw the material from the show. I think he's one of the best comedy characters of all time.. up there with say, Peter Dragon ("Action") and The Blues Brothers. Biggest surprise with this film was that they've actually got some serious actors to do it (Dance and Gambon).

This is by far one of the best movies I have seen in a very long time . Top 20 , if not top 10 movies in my opinion. It is very emotional and at times even a little disturbing. This movie is about how a mother tries to do everything to protect her daughters from harm , but her daughter is murdered by a madman . She is heartbroken and tries to find answers , but not even her daughter's friends know what really went on in the girls life. This is a very good movie to watch with friends or family.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie . I caught it last night on TMC . I will say this to start. The acting is really good and the writing is pretty good too. It's well acted but I didn't understand it very much. The story is pretty much about a man working at a factory who goes off on vacation. I was confused because it seems he goes on vacation every year. Then at the end it says he died in the war. So I was a bit confused about it.

Based on a William Faulkner short story, Two Soldiers is a top notch short film, a movie that has enough story, emotion and great cinematography for a feature film and definitely leaves you wanting more in the end. The story involves two dirt poor Mississippi brothers, one only a kid, the other old enough to volunteer for the war effort shortly after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The younger brother, played brilliantly by newcomer Jonathan Furr, doesn't want to let his older brother go, and he sets out on a quest to enlist in the Army himself.

OK so Paris Hilton sucks in it ( typical Malibu Barbie ) but the rest of the actors are just fine in my book. I'd rather have an Oscar winning film based on a bad book, then a bad book with Oscar winning actors acting out it. Not that Paris Hilton is an Oscar winning actress but she was part of a series of movies that were well written and made a good movie. I guess I'm still waiting for it to air on DVD to watch. I also hope for more movies and TV series based on books.

This movie is beautiful in all ways. It is visually stunning, and this is a good thing since the dialogue would only take up a page or two of paper. The acting is superb; it is subtle, passionate and intense. Ben Daniels does a fabulous job of turning himself into an animal, and mixing that wild nature with a man's overbearing passion and honor. There is not one flaw, not one mistake or wrong moment to be found anywhere. It is completely perfect, but only if you understand what you're going to experience.

If you have n't seen this film , do it . Its a genremix as i 've never seen another film so similar . It ' s a cult classic . It ' s a must for anyone who 's never seen a sci fi movie . Its a story about two friends , both scientists , who are sent by NASA on a mission to the moon . They go there , and one of the scientists dies . There 's a funeral , and the guy that 's in charge says that the deceased will be able to go into a new space ship , and that 's the ship that will be launched to Mars .

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville 's Century Theatre . A well crafted , solid drama with strong characters . The film tells the story of four friends who share a close friendship in the early part of the 1970's. It begins in 1968 and shows how the three main characters in the film get involved in a series of unfortunate circumstances that lead to the tragic events of the end of the 1960's and then of the 1970's. This is an excellent movie and a great film to watch with friends and family at the cinema .

`` Hari om '' is an Indian greeting and the compelling title character of the film bearing this same name. Harishchandra (Bharath) is the king of Hastinapore. At the time this film was made, in 1936, India had not yet achieved Independence. The film begins with King Harishchandra being crowned by his subjects. The scene then shifts back to Harishchandra at his father's deathbed where his mother urges him to put aside his selfish ways. Hari is then taken to his mother's chamber where he sees his stepmother in bed.

I was n't expecting a great deal from this film , so I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it . it's got a pretty standard story , and is pretty simple to follow . but it has some good things about it , especially for an early 90's film . the first thing I liked is the soundtrack . although it is a pretty generic one for a film of this kind , it still is pretty good . it's quite a catchy one , as it has some great rock tracks that really fit the movie .

1969 was the year . New York City was the place . Putney Swoope was the second Robert Downey film in the works . It was an adaptation of the French comic strip about the adventures of an ex-Nazi agent. The film was being made as a comedy and a satire of Cold War spy thrillers. This was going to be a serious and serious comedy. The director was Peter Bogdanovich , whose previous credits included A Guide for the Married Man . The screenwriter was John Berry , who would later become famous for The Last Picture Show and Chinatown .

Ever since they first came to the Outer Banks and filmed the movie (I have lived here my whole life), I have waited for this movie to come out. And I mean waited and waited and waited over a year and a half for this movie and to me, it was worth it.The movie is different from the book but in my eyes, it's still a beautiful piece of work as is the book. In both I cried, there were moments that tore me up. I laughed and I smiled just as much.

Lucio Fulci's "Don't Torture a Duckling" paints an exceptionally unflattering portrait of small-town Sicily plagued by series of brutal murders of young boys.This surprisingly well-directed film(especially in comparison to later Fulci's gorefests)is distinguished by overall atmosphere of perversity,nastiness and two truly grotesque scenes of brutal violence.The soon-to-be-dead children are depicted as casually cruel and budding peeping toms;Bruno's near-seduction by the naked Patrizia(Barbara Bouchet)really has to be seen to be believed.Highly recommended-especially in pair with my another cult favourite "House with the Windows That Laugh"(1976).

Pierre Jolivet plays a Don Quixote character , unable to speak , living in a world incompatible with modern life. This is the story of a Don Quixote in the 21st century , who is unable to find a place to live , or a family, or a lover. . He has no family. No job. He spends his days walking around the streets of the town of Apt , dreaming of Sancho Panzas , who he believes to be the real Don Quixote. It is the story of an unspoken world , where he lives among us , a world that exists outside our own .

WTF!! Do any of his books/movies end in a happy ending?? The Notebook was good...but sheesh, enough with the depressing endings already. I'm told that he writes about realistic situations that people deal with in real life. Understandable...but sometimes it's nice to see people who have sacrificed their whole lives to only get to a mediocre unhappy time in their lives - to finally find the true meaning of happiness and are able to live it out for the rest of their days. Don't we already know what really happens in real life?

This is my favourite Columbo. Martin Landau (excellent!) plays twins, one of whom may have committed a murder. This Columbo is unusual because the usual murder scene at the beginning doesn't give you any clue to which one did it! Peter Falk is on form as usual in this episode written by Steven Bochco (who also wrote 'Murder by the Book', my second favourite episode). The supporting cast are great especially Julie Newmar (very under-rated) and Jeanette Nolan as the house keeper that Columbo just keeps on upsetting.

This is NOT the masterpiece that is Snow White, Cinderella, or Bambi, but it IS a very sweet, enjoyable, romantic, well-done Disney animated feature.There are, of course, lessons included herein for the kiddies, and some very appropriate kiddie-cheek, but there is plenty herein for the adults, as well.While this is somewhat of a regurgitation of the Classic Disney RomCom Adventure, it still holds some elements, which solely belong to the AristoCats. O'Malley is the "tramp" and Dutchess is the "lady," but Dutchess has several kittens and they are all trying to get home.Phil Harris is our tomcat O'Malley.

What a surprise this film was . I 've seen a good few of Fulci 's horror and zombie flicks and found this one one of the best, not that I thought it wasn't but I 'd not read anything about it beforehand. It's a bit odd in the sense of it coming at us so suddenly and so suddenly we 're taken out of the mundane world of zombies and the everyday world into an otherwordly, strange dimension . Our main characters in this film are the people in the small farming town that has been plagued by zombies for three weeks.

But a great cast ! Jonathan Pryce , Kathy Bates , Rupert Everett , Lynne Redgrave , Julie Andrews and many others . It is all so wonderful that I do not see how it can fail to become the classic of its genre. The script is just wonderful and I would say the movie deserves to be one of the classics of the 1970s. If you are an American who lives outside the United States you can see it in cinemas across the World. This movie is about an English professor ( Jonathan Pryce ) , who is a widower.

I don't see what the problem is with SOME people and their NEED for intellectual humor. You need to get your head out of your up-tight ass if you don't find this movie hilarious! If this isn't your "cup of tea", so to speak, then look at it for what it truly is- a damn funny movie. Maybe they DID set out to make yet another drugs/T&A movie, but in this case, they've truly hit the spot. It's especially funny for the Ali G fans, because he delivers everything we've come to love and expect from him.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to boot camp, where he has to learn how to handle his rifle and how to walk in line. That's a really funny scene as the tramp is not used to keeping his feet straight!Next thing you know he's in France in a trench. Hilarious scenes here include a starving Charlie eating the cheese of a mousetrap and reading a letter from home over someone's shoulder.When Charlie goes to sleep he finds his bunker all flooded and his roommate snoring.

This is a well directed Columbo episode , with also some good character but the story just does n't really seem to make much sense at all , the way Columbo is just asking and asking and n't really getting any answers. It all seems a bit too easy , Columbo is not going to let it all drop , but he has no answers , so he just goes through the motions , then it turns out to be the girl herself who did it ! The only interesting character in the story is the butler , but he is just used to give Columbo something to do and then he gets himself killed !

I watch the show every day and it is very entertaining . It provides updates of tech news , video reviews, and also a lot of other useful info. The only downside I see about it is that it is really short so I have to fast forward to catch things. I also enjoy watching videos on YouTube, but I don't see them for free because I don't want my cable bill to go up, which is a shame. But that's another topic. Anyway, it's a nice show and I watch it every day and highly recommend it to anyone."

A surprisingly great cartoon in the same league as Batman:TAS and its ilk, I enjoyed it in my youth and recently had been able to watch them all again, great voice acting from Tim Curry, Richard Moll, Tony Jay, and Maurice LaMarche in various roles. The only qualm I had was Rob Paulsons voice seemed a little too old for the title character, but that wasn't a big deal as the stories were great, and the fact that the whole thing has a great time loop twist ending.

This is Christmas time ! A nativity in terms of rebirth , or at least this is what can be understood from the story of the nativity of Jesus. The word that I want to emphasize here is rebirth which has an important meaning for this subject. Rebirth means the return of the light in the dark, it means the return of the human to the divine, the return to divinity or the re-enchantment of the world, this is a very important concept and this is the one that we will find in all the cultures of the world.

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family's journey from the Old World (Italy) to the New World (America). Salvatore, a middle-aged man who hopes for a more fruitful life, persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily, take the arduous journey across the raging seas, and inhabit a land whose rivers supposedly flow with milk. In short, they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dreams of prosperity will be fulfilled. The imagery of the New World is optimistic, clever and highly imaginative.

The animation quality here is decidedly below par IMO, regardless of the age of the OAV. The plot itself makes sense, but the characters don't.This might sound picky, but considering that the city of Olympus is almost exclusively populated by living machines, would YOU feel comfortable there as a human? Would any machine ever emulate human arrogance, short-sightedness and greed quite so effectively? I doubt it. There are some pointers towards this in the movie, but only when the team can be bothered to put them in, by and large the 'bioroids' (or whatever they are) are interchangeable with human characters.

If you 've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts , here is a Zasu zinger ! In 1933 she was considered one of the most famous actresses in Hollywood. Her first hit was the movie A Guy Named Joe in 1939 with James Cagney , a movie you probably have not seen if you are reading this as I have seen it. Later that year, when I was a young lad of 12 she starred in a movie I had to watch at the local movie palace. It was a thriller that I had not heard about, but I knew there was a girl in danger.

It took me a while to find this movie since they don't have it yet on DVD (and my VCR is not worth hooking up again). I guess all the referencing to drug use is too much for some folks. But I found a decent bootleg on Ebay and I must say that anyone who takes this movie too seriously is just retarded. It is a slap stick spoof in the vein of "Airplane." I must say that when I watched it on Showtime or Spotlight growing up in the 80s, I enjoyed the humor a whole lot more then, than I do now.

I have to admit I had never heard of this movie. I caught it last night on TMC. I thought it was hysterical. I laughed so hard and loved the ending. Image what a Marx brothers movie would like if they collaborated with Salvadore Dali and Malcolmn X and then all dropped LSD.Funny and edgy are two overused words these days, this movie sure has that plus about 200 IQ points of most comedies today and surrealistic to boot. I had to be up at 6:00 am and watched it until 2:30. I over slept and missed my obligations. Still worth it.

Despite of all the negative criticism I really enjoyed this movie . I am not saying this lightly . I have seen a lot of movies over the last years but this is the one I watched the most . It’s a great movie with a lot of tension and the characters and the settings were really realistic . It’s got a lot of things going for it . A great script , great director , great acting and great music . This is one of those few movies that really made you feel it .

where do we go from here? that is the overriding question of this film. And make no mistake, 'mainly ETC. ', the 2003 effort from director john jansen, asks far more questions than it answers, but none so poignantly or so powerfully as this one.much of the the film plays like a running conversation between you and your college drinking buddies, and I'm sure many of the questions raised by the main characters you'll recognize from your own evenings of drunken debauchery. however, one of the many beauties of this film is that we are rarely given an answer.

When I started watching 3 of the episodes of this series on the Action Channel,I have to say out of all the shows that I've seen that ADV released,this one is one of the best shows of all time. I had to see it again,and that's when I got my chance. I bought the entire box set of this series at Best Buy for my 20th Birthday. And I got to enjoy it,and see more of the episodes that I missed on Action Channel,and the same 3 episodes that I've seen.

The cinema of the 60s was as much as time of revolution as the politics and the music . Filmmakers like Stanley Kubrick , Steven Spielberg , Federico Fellini , Martin Scorsese , Akira Kurosawa , Jean Luc-Godard , Pedro Almodovar , Woody Allen and many others took us on new journeys of fantasy and dreams . One of the most fascinating and intriguing period in film industry is the 1960s . If you look at the filmography of that decade you will realize that many great films were produced in those ten years. Here are some of the best movies of the 60s .

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime, Lifetime Movie network and on Courttv. Jonathan Scarfe and John Corbett did a great job of playing Luke and Walker Morrison. I am glad that Walker got his brother Luke to confess of murdering his parents and their brother Bobby. I enjoy watching True stories on Lifetime, Lifetime Movie network and on Courttv. The Morrison Murders is a good movie to watch. Next time The Morrison Murders is on Lifetime, Lifetime Movienetwork or Courttv I am going to watch The Morrrison Murders again because My favorite actor John Corbbett is in The Morrison Murders.

where do we go from here ? that is the overriding question of this film . And make no mistake about it that the story is compelling enough and the characters are well drawn enough that this can only be a good thing . there are moments of great tension and even suspense in a movie that has been made so well that i could not look away . the film is beautifully shot . the direction is quite good even though it sometimes is not quite what you think it was going to be like . it keeps you interested right from the beginning .

Truly unique and stunning film of Jules Verne 's `` For The Flag '' by the Czech master director Karel Kachy. Jules Verne is the most talented writer from the 19th century. The author of the famous book `` From the Earth to the Moon ``, he was born on the French island of Jersey in 1828. He is considered the father of the science and technology and the science-fiction literature. He is also the father of the cinema. The novel was published in the first half of the 19th century. It was a great hit.

The movie has taken a little flack for playing fast and loose with the facts . But it will put on a good show in theatres across the country. Mumbai: The buzz about the Hindi remake of Hollywood's Black Hawk Down is already being created. It's being talked about as the first of the kind, as Bollywood has never before made a film from an original screenplay. It has been shot in India, with Indian actors. It has already been dubbed in Hindi for the masses and is expected to become a major hit.

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the elements we like in the Columbo episodes. We get the laugh when Columbo makes something clumsy, and it happens more than once in Double Shock. I can almost guarantee that you will laugh several times if you decide to watch this episode.We also get the riddle as usual with an almost perfect murder, but something about the murder troubles Columbo. The end is the usual, we get the story about how Columbo solved the mystery.This is another good Columbo-episode, and I will rate it 7/10.

Nominated for best documentary feature at 2004's Academy Awards, My Architect follows filmmaker Nathaniel Kahn in his quest to find out about his father, the legendary architect Louis I Kahn. Lou Kahn died in 1974, when Nate was 11 years old, leaving behind an incredible but limited body of work, unpaid debts and three separate families all living within a few kilometres of each other. My Architect follows Kahn's life through chronologically examining his buildings, and interspersing their beauty with the story of a charismatic, but selfish and emotionally immature genius.

I can not say this movie was a hilarious , but I must have had a grin on my face for most of the movie, even though it had no jokes. It was a beautiful story about the power of friendship and trust. This movie has everything that I expected from a Disney film and more! The animation is incredible. Every character has a distinct personality and the scenery is absolutely gorgeous! The storyline is well written. "The story is based off the true events of a friendship between two boys from New York who become stranded in the wilderness of Alaska after their plane crash.

The 1973 musical version of LOST HORIZON is the most wonderful endearing and campy musical films of ALL TIME . I just loved this movie. When I saw it in the cinema I was like "Oh my god ! This is a musical ! " It was one of the best things of the 70's . The music of this movie is fabulous . It was the kind of thing I dreamed of when I heard that John Barry was composing the music for the movie . And when I read the script it was the same thing . This was one of the best musicals of the 1970's .

Who could have thought a non-disabled actor could act so realistically and immensely powerfully as a disabled person in a film? There is only one James Bond. As a disabled child, I was treated like a freak. No one took any interest in what I could not do. I was ignored, bullied, laughed at and teased. I was bullied on a daily basis and had no friends because everyone in the school could not understand that I could not read or write. I had no idea how to interact socially and was labelled an idiot.

`` Caribe '' is not a masterpiece in any of its storytelling aspects . However , it delivers a perfectly balanced combination of romance , comedy and drama . starring julie meade , luke wilson and taylor swift as herself , this is the story of caribe , a small town in the south of usa , where a beautiful girl falls in love with a man , but has no chance to meet his family . while caribe's residents think they know her , they are actually only interested in her beauty . and since caribe has no real-life love stories , it is decided to set one in this film .

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce, direct, finance and/or star in their own films who might otherwise not have been able to? Is that a good thing? This film does not answer the latter question either way, but it does appear that without Curb, Jeff Garlin would not have been able to make I Want Someone to Eat Cheese With. Like most new producers/directors, Jeff Garlin's independent piece heaves a heavily more sensitive sigh than the vehicle he is primarily known for (Curb).

Even after nearly 20 years apart , the original members of Black Sabbath have not lost a thing . In fact, they've never been better . With Black Sabbath 's 10th studio album release , "Heaven and Hell," the quintet of Ozzy , Tony Iommi , Geezer Butler , Bill Ward , and Oliver " Geezer " Goldstein still sound as potent as ever . Ozzy Osborne , the original lead singer of Black Sabbath , was asked by Rolling Stone how he feels about being inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame .

Chaplin is a doughboy in his final film of 1918 , a doughboy who can not seem to get the dough he needs. He can not afford to pay his wife and he can not seem to support the children of his mistress. While this film does not have the comedic flourishes of “The Gold Rush,” “The Kid,” or the “The Tramp” we get a deeper look into Charlie’s character in a darker setting. We find Chaplin playing a character unlike any of his previous tramps.

My favorite show of all time! Yeah, I thought this was so cool, and Larisa Oleynik was the first crush I ever had (AAAAWWWWWW). It was well written, funny-except when it it wanted to be serious, and just a great show overall. But since we couldn't afford to keep Nick, I couldn't see any episodes after Feb. 1996, and maybe that makes me think more of the show than I should. To me it's more the epidemy (now that doesn't look spelled right!)

This is one of the best of the early `` Star Trek '' episodes , with Kirk and his crew stranded on a hostile world where the crew and the world are on the edge of a major war. It's one of those Trek episodes where the story is strong , but the acting is pretty good . This is one of the first episodes of Star Trek , in which the crew is in peril . They find a world on which a major war has begun , and it seems they are caught in it . The episode is written by D.C. Fontana , based on a story by Lawrence Block .

Years ago when I first read John Irving 's The World According to Garp , I was astounded that most people knew the name John Irving for one book. I didn't know about Garp 's life story, but I had a general idea that he was this great author who had won all of the awards and everything. John Irving was not a great writer by any stretch, and I think that if I had to name someone who is more deserving of the title 'best American writer ever,' I would have to say that Kurt Vonnegut was the best writer ever.

probably the best horror movie in 5 years.. there's been lame remakes, attempts to make you scared (when all they make you do is walk out of the theater) and movies that just shouldn't have been made. but this one is worth it. the only reason i didn't give it a 10 is because Paris Hilton is in it (but her death scene makes up for it, believe me)....so here they are.. the SPOILERS of all the death scenes in the movie..1. my favorite death scene ever - Paris Hilton's!

I love this movie a lot . I must get this on DVD . I have 2 VHS copies , but this is the best! This is a very good action/ adventure story that will keep you hooked . It's really very good! . You can tell that the special effects were amazing in the 70's . I don't think there will be anything better in my lifetime . There is some good humor in here . The cast is good , but they are not known stars . But they get the job done . There is very little nudity , and that's what makes it fun .

Documentaries in which sons and daughters seek to understand a parent and, by the process, their own lives are not that uncommon. Also not uncommon are results that reflect lack of talent, a failure of introspection, an abundance of narcissism and, perhaps, an unsubtle quest for publicly-splashed revenge for countless past hurts, real and fantasized. What is unusual is a brilliant, fair and engrossing portrait of a fascinating parent and "My Architect: A Son's Journey" is that rare achievement.Louis Kahn emigrated to this country as a child, his face irreparably and brutally scarred by an accident.

Separate LIES changed my life. Actually, the Q&A did.SPOILERS BELOW. Read only if you watch trailers or if you've already seen it:The Emily Watson character cheats on the Tom Wilkonson character. My first reaction to the puppy-dog-eyed Emily was "It's Over. Dump her. Bad riddance." For some reason, he stuck around. Not in a pathetic way. He just listened. And tried to accept her needs. At times he needed to leave. But he stuck by her and let her live her life.

In Tweety's S.O.S, Sylvester goes from picking garbage cans to being a stowaway on a cruise ship that happens to carry a certain canary bird-and Granny, his owner. Uh-Oh! Once again, Tweety and Granny provide many obstacles to the cat's attempts to get the bird. Sylvester also gets seasick quite a few times, too. And the second time the red-nosed feline goes to the place on the ship that has something that cures his ailments, Tweety replaces it with nitroglycerin. So now Sylvester can blow fire! I'll stop here and say this is another excellent cartoon directed by Friz Freling starring the popular cat-and-bird duo.

Contrary to what many may believe as this movie being an `` against the system '' type of movie and it actually isn't that way. It is about the system itself, and how it's been corrupted for the sake of money and greed. It's about how the system doesn't protect the innocent, and how those at the top can take advantage of anything and everything. The movie has an interesting structure with a plot that starts off as a typical police procedural, but soon evolves into something more dramatic as the movie moves along.

What's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season... Here is my forecast: 1. The hatch was indeed blown, but somehow everybody inside survived.
