Buts lets see about that. 2. The episode at the end with the tent is an observation team monitoring the tracking device installed on Desmonds boat by Penny. Now that the magnetic shield around the island was lifted, the signal was picked up by the observation station and they are going to send a rescue mission. 3.

The cover of the VHS says it all: "Without doubt, the most powerful movie of its kind since the Texas Chainsaw Massacre". I'm a huge fan of 70's and 80's slashers and I have to say, I agree 100 %. The characters are believable, the actors have an excellent charm (especially George Kennedy as the forest-ranger). There's the twisted atmosphere, that only TCM has, an astounding soundtrack to reflect the emotions and the filming locations that are the most beautiful in the history of horror.

Has the proliferation of relatively high quality shows on the proliferating TV networks made it possible for people to produce more shows than can find a way onto a network? If so, what has that done to the traditional broadcast networks and to the development of new programming for them? In other words, should we worry about how much money is being spent on TV shows that can't find a home on broadcast TV? "I can't speak for anyone else, but there have always been a small number of good TV shows.

A labor of love . Each frame is picture perfect and grabs you . Then the sheer emotion and story-telling that is delivered through each and every scene is a breath-taking experience to witness and enjoy. There is a great variety of shots from wide to extreme close-up to medium to medium long shot. The cinematography is simple but effective. You get to enjoy the story without any clutter. There is a very good story line to the movie but I wouldn't say that the film is perfect in any way. The pace is good and the plot is predictable but still worth watching.

When the Romulans come, they will not be bearing gifts; no, they bring with them war - war and conquest. As any familiar with this episode know, it is a redux of the war film "The Enemy Below" from the fifties. The obvious difference is that instead of a battleship and a submarine (or an American Destroyer & German U-boat) engaged in lethal war games, it is two starships in outer space. In Trek history, about 100 years before the events here, according to this episode, Earth fought the Romulan Wars.

I loved this film!! I have been waiting for this film to come out so I could see it. I saw it opening night and loved it, Some people told me that this film wasn't any good and to stay away but I thought it was great. The actors did great and it was scary and made me jump. Paris Hilton did a great job for her first film, everybody is giving her a hard time when she did great and she didn't even have that big of a role. The set was great has it was made of all wax and how it was made.

Containing Billy 's famous humor , this more modest comedy with heavy bittersweet overtones is a big departure , pleasantly surprising in places . but before it can be fully appreciated and understood , you will have to dig through a lot of subplots to get to the point . there is no clear beginning , middle , or end , which is not always a bad thing ( but it certainly is here ) , although you can't help but wonder what the story is , since the ending seems to have been written by someone who has forgotten it .

it 's a great movie for the whole family . i do n't think many people have seen it cause it came out in the mid-70 's . I think I saw this back when it was first made. It's a very powerful movie that makes you think about your own life. I always think of it whenever I think of my mother's suicide. In some ways, this movie is what she wanted for me. I think you should see it, especially if you've ever considered suicide. It will help you decide if you should continue on.

Oh my word ! ! I have never seen a film so lacking in any kind of moral judgement or even any kind of social comment. It is as if no one was there and it was just made for the pleasure of being made. It seems to be something just for a couple to do, nothing else, just what they want to do (or in the case of the actors, what they think they want to do) nothing else. The whole thing is like going to a party where you don't know anyone, it is empty, void.

Pity the Monkees. People always accused them of being manufactured (which they were) or being nothing more than a American knock-off of the Beatles (Again, which they were) but to the kids of the time they were real, they were important, they were legitimate. Discussions about who were better The Monkees or The Beatles were common on school yards but the critics, well they never quite bought into it. Despite recording some very catchy, classic pop tunes, the Monkess did not receive much respect for their albums.

I saw this film at the Seattle International Film Festival in a full house of avid movie buffs and Indian ex-pats. The film is amazingly beautiful and smooth flowing for a first film. The direction is self assured, especially with locals who were recruited on the fly for extras and bit parts. While the plot and story line is elementary to nonexistent, the pleasures of watching the performances and scenery offset the lack. The soundtrack to this film is a big attraction to world music lovers. If you want to see what can be done in 45 days, with a different location every day, check out Hari Om for inspiration.

I had heard of John Garfield, but, didn't know him. I loved this movie. I had never heard of it. I just picked it up randomly. John Garfield is a boxer in the movie. He had been in real life also so he knew his part. He was a fugitive throughout the movie. Someone else killed a man. He character was blamed. He is befriended by a family who has questions and is not quite sure what to make of him. All sorts of minor plots ensue.

Right this may be the wine talking but this could be the best movie I 've seen in a very long time. I laughed more in this movie than in any other film in a while. A movie that has everything, great acting, and a good script. This movie made me happy. This movie was very well done. A lot of people didn't like it, saying it wasn't dark enough and that it was predictable but I loved it. This is definitely the best movie that I have seen. This is one of the most underrated movies of all time.

I think that this short TV series , was absolutely wonderful , and gave both a in-depth and clear explanation of what it means to live and breathe Jesus Christ , His words and His ways . What I loved most about it , apart from being an easy watch , is that it has some really great messages within , and it makes you ask the right questions , and seek answers within the Bible . This series will definitely make you think , even though you might not agree with some of its views . It also makes you re-evaluate , what it is you think about in life .

I've been a fan of Rachael's since the beginning of 30MM on the Food Network, so I have seen her grow over the years. The minute I saw her interact with Oprah, I predicted that this show would happen, because I saw how taken Oprah is with her, and with good reason: she comes across as very natural, and willing to laugh at herself, which is very engaging. The set is appealing, and there are some fresh ideas (I love the lazy Susan that the audience sits on).

This series has a lot going for it with beautiful footage of the some of the most impressive underwater environments on the planet. There are some amazing scenes to see. I was a bit surprised, however, to find out there wasn’t much of a narrative to follow. The only reason I kept watching this series was to see what kind of footage they could capture underwater, and I was thoroughly disappointed with that aspect. I’d recommend it to anyone that’s intrigued by what it would take to be an explorer.

This movie , based on a true story of Gerrit Wolfaardt , is one of the best films I 've seen so far , and probably one of my favorites as well . as you might have guessed already , it is , without any doubt , a very moving movie , even though the true story has its own tragic ending , it is an inspiring tale about a man with a big dream and an incredible determination . the movie is based on a real event , and it depicts some parts of it , the main character , Gerrit Wolfaardt ( robert schmidt ) , who is one of my favorite characters in movies .

These critics need to find a new job ! ! ! This movie is based on a TRUE STORY , not a movie ! The movie was made to make people think about their future , how they will be taken advantage of , how they are going to lose everything they have , but the people who make these movies always think about themselves , not other people . This is one of my favorite movies , and one of the only movies where i was able to understand what was happening . And the acting is amazing , but the most amazing thing about the movie is its message .

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful reputation as the "Godfather Of Gore". Fulci's absolute greatest film, however, dates back to 1972 and, while it is definitely gritty and violent, it is not nearly as gory as many of his other films. "Non Si Sevizia Un Paperino" aka. "Don't Torture A Duckling" of 1972 is not only by far Fulci's greatest film, this tantalizing and utterly brilliant Giallo is one of the absolute highlights of the genre.

Due to its predictable , second-rate title , ( the one it was distributed under in Italy , at least ) , the movie version of the cult sci-fi TV series Star Wars may not be remembered as the best of the franchise . It is true , however , that despite its faults , this is still the most accessible film in the Star Wars series . And , as far as I'm concerned , it doesn't really need the name " Star Wars " ; the movie alone is an enjoyable action / adventure / comedy / fantasy / action -adventure film .

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to the New World ( United States ) in the early 20th Century. My father's great grandparents came to the USA in 1907 from Sicily . This is their story and I hope to be able to tell it well. Sunday, April 26, 2010

I have been busy working on the next chapter in the saga of "The Golden Door" so here it is in all it's unedited glory. It has been a good day.

This was one of the worst Columbo episodes that I have seen, However, I am only in the second season.The typical Columbo activities are both amusing and irritating. His cigar ashes causing him trouble have been seen before, And the bit where he always identifies in some way with the murderer--in this case cooking ,Tho the scene on the TV cooking show distracted from the main theme.Also not explained was why the brother at the beginning of the show was cutting part of the wires of the mixer. The reason was never explained ,nor did it serve any purpose.

The story starts out with a soldier being transported to a desert town then goes back in time to tell the tale of how he came to this place. He started out as an officer in Napoleon's army fighting in Egypt but became separated from his unit. After nearly starving and/or dying of thirst he came upon a leopard which somehow became his bosom buddy. It brought him food and before long the soldier became almost totally wild so acute was his bonding with the animal. All things do end however and the man decided it was necessary for him to leave the critter.

I saw this movie on it 's opening night , and enjoyed it . I probably would have enjoyed it more if it ' d been on late night television , but the first time I saw it I was with my mother , my sister , her boyfriend and his friend , who were all in college . I liked the cast , the setting , the atmosphere . I felt like I was in a real movie . The main character of the movie is a high school teacher named Jack Torrance . He ' s had a problem with his stepdaughter , Wendy Torrance (played by Wendy Robie ).

This movie got better with time . I ca n't believe that it has been forty years since I saw this movie. I don't know why this movie didn't get more attention when this movie came out , because the acting was really good . I can't wait to watch this on Blu ray. I am glad I didn't get this movie on DVD, because this one is better in my opinion. I have always had an affection for this film. It was made on a very small scale, it was filmed on location with a very small budget.

We saw La Spettatrice last night @ the Chicago International Film Festival & we were both immensely moved by it. I've just finished watching all the documentaries we saw and have written a brief summary of each. I'll add some links at the bottom if anyone's interested, but I wanted to try and sum up what we felt were the essential takeaways from each film. If you have seen these movies, you will understand why I feel like I did after last night's, but I wanted to share this with everyone as an opportunity to raise awareness for these films and the issues they portray.

First of all i want to say Ang Lee Did a very good job on this one ! I watched it in Chinese and i thought to myself "This is the best Chinese movie I've ever seen ! I have no problem with it being dubbed in English!" The characters are all very likeable and i'm sure that this will have a very big audience ! The plot is basically a family story where all the main characters have a great sense of humour and they're able to see a lot of humour in the things they go through, even the things that they don't realise they do go through.

I remember seeing this film when I was fairly young & being quite disturbed by it. I found the storyline very distressing and can still remember the various bullying techniques used. One in particular was when the other school children spat in his soup before he could even taste a spoonful. They also bound him and shaved his private parts. This was all because he was unpopular. Why was he unpopular? Because he was bad at games. I have a feeling though that even if he was good at games he would have been bullied because it's hard to decide what makes someone popular.

As many of today 's movies are guilty of , the plot is n't exactly stellar , the movie does not seem to know where it 's going or how to tell its story . even in the worst films , it's possible to tell the audience what 's going on . here , what we are supposed to be observing is a romance between two men , with a bit of plot thrown in . so the title is not really the best choice . we are given , as the first clue to what this movie is about , the tagline " love can come in all sizes . "

`` Blind Spot '' one of my festival favorites . I was totally intrigued by the idea of three strangers meeting and having a blind-date-type experience on the first day of the festival. '' I was pretty nervous as to what I had to say, or who I had to answer to. When I heard about the show, it felt like the most natural thing in the world.

'' I'm the host of an unscripted talk show about blind dating called Blind Spot. '' '' It's really the most fun I've ever had on stage.

Years ago I read the book 'A Máquina' (The machine). As I re-read this little book again and again, I could never stop getting more and more fascinated by the imagination of the writer and the richness of the Brazilian culture.When I knew about the movie, I was really scared that someone would spoil one of my favorites books! Well, happily, my fears were unjustified and the movie is such a wonderful and delicate piece of art.I can't recall of any other movie that could bring tears to my eyes due to the very beauty of the text.

I can't say how many times that one line has made me laugh or how often I've described that scene to folks not familiar with this film. I saw it the year it was released, I was 19. I don't think there were a dozen people in that East Village theater that night. For years I thought we were the only ones who saw it. Nice to see here that others found it as hysterical as I had, and see it's lasting value despite the time gone by. Rent it, buy it or steal it.... a must see.

This is without a doubt the most stunning and amazing documentary I have ever seen ! The images that are shown here in this film are so surreal they will blow you out of your chair! This film will leave you stunned, amazed and in awe of the amazing beauty of Earth and the wonders of our Solar System. This is the must see documentary of the year in my opinion. As someone who has been to space I know that the images we see in some of the documentaries that I have seen on television and the internet just don't do the real thing any justice at all.

Who ARE the people that star in this thing ? Never heard of them ! ! But this is one of my all time fav series ! I love how the whole cast is from all corners of the globe . There are no cliches . I am very proud of the fact that this show is a bit different , in a good way and I'm not ashamed of it . The story lines and the characters are just great . I just finished watching this show for the fifth time already and I haven't been able to stop watching this series .

Oh I remember watching this show at 4:00 p.m. during my junior high days. It was not a pleasant experience because I remember watching it when I made my homework.Still, the show caught my attention when Alex displayed her special powers and dealt with the typical junior high problems.But the show wasn't all about adventures and special powers; it was more of an educational effort for a younger audience in order to get more interested in school and biology overall.The lead actress (can't remember her name and I'm too lazy to copy and paste from the main details) delivered a fantastic performance.

I am a long time fan of Luc Besson's work, and for about as long as I've known his name, I've also looked for this movie. I tried looking for this movie all over California for over four years. this past summer i took a trip to Europe, one of my missions on this trip was to at least see this movie. long story short, I bought it and watched it in France! I was blown away, it completely made my trip and i finally feel content that i have seen Luc Besson's first work.

This is probably the second best of the Death Wish movies. Death Wish 5 is the best one.Death Wish 3 reminds me of "West Side Story" with a new twist. Not even the recent flick "Gangs of New York" can measure up with one New York neighborhood in Death Wish 3 which is plagued not by two rival gangs---but one big gang. A gang that is willing to do things like cutting a person to death with an ax if he trespasses on its set.Deborah Raffin, who plays a public defender, plays gently in this action-packed movie that is filled with a lot of shoot-em-up violence.

I wonder why I haven't heard of this movie before. It's truly a magnificent comedy (I'd say farce, but it's too well acted and I'd hate to denigrate it's quality). A comedic character study about the travails of mid-life crises, the inequity for gays who can't have their long-time unions recognized, and the general differences of people who can't fit nicely into society, that pairs Kathy Bates and Rupert Everett to a wonderful effect. Forget Julia Roberts and Rupert; Kathy Bates and Rupert should do another movie together.

I know this movie is n't for everyone , and I wo n't push my opinions on you , but the movie was good , I liked it . For starters , I like Sam Elliot , and this movie gave him the chance to show off how talented he is , and he played it perfectly . There is a lot of humor in this film , but not too much . I would say the best part about it , and the reason I am mentioning this , is because when the movie is done , you get to watch an awesome ending that will have you happy that you watched this .

Duchess and her three kittens are enjoying the high life with their devoted human mistress until the wicked butler Edgar threatens to turn them over to the authorities

They’re no ordinary cats. They’re Duchess, Duchess, Duchess of Windsor, and that makes them something in the realm of royal cats. Duchess is a tiny tabby-striped beauty, but the trio of black-and-white kittens are the real stars. They’re adorable, they’re fluffy, they’re funny-looking and, like their mum, Duchess of Windsor, they look like royalty. What more could you ask for?

Due to its predictable, second-rate title, (the one it was distributed under in Italy, at least) I didn't expect much from this movie. Thought it'd be another cheap flick about a haunted house ("LA CASA MALEDETTA" means "The cursed house"). Well, I had to change my mind just after the very first brilliant scene! The constant presence of priests and the creepy atmospheres, reminded me a bit of The Exorcist and some of its decent Italian rip-offs, but this was going to be something completely different...

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the supporting roles to the foursome of lies and intrigue. Yet at the heart of it all, each character maintains a streak of decency - moral conscience held up in spite of obvious contradictions. "Contradictions are the source of all movement and of all life." How true these words are. Watson's Anne Manning is at the core of this intrigue - she's the central conscience that the other three latched on. She is the decency undeterred.

Being American, I have not been exposed to this character before, which is good because some of you have been disappointed. I have nothing to compare it to. I have found no enjoyment in the mindless idiot humor in the American teen movies, and although this is a slightly similar type of humor, I couldn't stop laughing. I hardly ever laugh out loud at a movie. And usually a movie has a few funny parts for me, but this movie was funny from start to finish. My only disappointment was when it was over.

"D.O.A" is an involving and entertaining little picture from start to finish. Dennis Quaid is at his caustic best; and Quaid is sadly one of the most underused talents in Hollywood. His then beau Meg Ryan also appears with him, but as is usually the case, doesn't really make much of an impact. The film is stylishly directed throughout, drawing on a number of influences to capture its 'seamy' feel. Would you credit that it's actually directed by two people? The answer is no. The whole thing is superbly slick, from its innovative camerawork to its unabashed use of black and white photography.

If we could have "Separate Tables," why not "Separate Lies. "This becomes somewhat involved. A housekeeper's husband is killed when he is hit by a car while on a bicycle. The culprit turns out to be the woman she cleans for. The latter was having an affair with a friend and was driving the car with the lover in it when the accident occurred. To complicate matters further, the housekeeper once worked for the guy's parents and he had her jailed for stealing. Therefore, people will hesitate to believe that it was his car that caused the accident.

Another popular screening for a British picture at Coalville's Century Theatre. A well crafted, solid drama with an ever developing plot and ongoing 'twists in the tale'...as the lies piled up! A masterclass of acting by a flawless cast, well marshaled by first time director Julian Fellowes. Outstanding performance, as usual, by Tom Wilkinson but good turns by all concerned including supporting actors Linda Bassett and John Neville. Our audience was engrossed by this film, which includes a couple of shock incidents which really make you 'jump'.

Before I talk about the ending of this film I will talk about the plot. Some dude named Gerald breaks his engagement to Kitty and runs off to Craven Castle in Scotland. After several months Kitty and her aunt venture off to Scottland. Arriving at Craven Castle Kitty finds that Gerald has aged and he has grown meaner. Gerald has certain rules for the castle(the rules have been the same for 200 years). Gerald does not want them to stay but, Kitty insist on staying by making excuses. One night her aunt catches a glimpse of the monster running across the hall.

I saw a sneak preview of this Tuesday night with a group of friends and we had a blast! After seeing sneak peaks for BOOGEYMAN (Horrible! 3/10) and Amityville Remake (so-so 6/10) I enjoyed this a lot more! As seen in the trailer, one knock I had was believing that a whole town could be "forgotten" but this is a cheesy popcorn horror movie so I accept it for what it is.My only major complaint is I assumed Paris Hilton would touch wax or get dipped etc. and moan "that's hot" but they didn't do that (how could they resist???

I thought Besson 's film managed to do without words what few films have been able to do with them in years. Yeah, and I liked that he took the time to let us see how these people live, and how he showed us how they're not just a bunch of zombies, but there's still some humanity in them. In a way, that makes it feel less like The Last Stand than any of his other films, but in another, it really doesn't feel that way, because in The Last Stand, at least, he had zombies.

I 've commented once on this Chucky great , but I had to do it again to say some things I had not had chance to say before. And so, here we go.Chucky is just that. He is just what he looks. He is an animated doll with a mask that is painted on him. And this is what makes the real difference. In the new series, he now has a clear and defined body. He is no longer an abstract doll with a mask. He has a defined and recognizable form. And that, to me, is a step forward.Chucky is the ultimate killer doll.

i love this film ! ! maybe it is my generation but i can really connect with what he is saying ! his message is universal , and i truly believe that he knew he was dying because he knew he had finally found a place to share this message ! he had spent his whole life trying to say this stuff and now that he had an opportunity , it was so important for him to make sure we heard it ! this is a movie i can watch over and over ! thank you josh for your amazing talents ! i love you ! xo !

This new installment to the Child's Play series has not one scary scene but tons of hilarious jokes such as a stoner witnessing Chucky giveing him the finger and saying "rude f--king doll" and lots of references to the series: "you can kill me but I'll come back. I always come back". The movie's title was probably thought of before the script and was written around it. This is totally different from all other films in the series. It doesn't even have Andy, the central character for all the previous ones.

Cult-director Lucio Fulci is probably most famous for his gory Zombie flicks from the 1980s that earned him his rightful title as a cult director. His name is not as synonymous with cult in the 1990s, however. But that does not mean he is not a cult director. Here are some of my favorite films of the 1990s, in no particular order

1) Demons 2) The House by the Cemetery 3) Bloodfeast

2) Demons

I think of the 1980s as a decade where horror movies were largely about slashers, and the 1990s as a decade where horror movies took on a more cerebral approach.

LOL.The mere fact that I start off my review with 'lol' says it all. I used to watch this movie all the time as a kid; and even then I sensed the silliness of it all. The low budget, horrible acting and lame script was ever apparent back then. I watched it again yesterday and just couldn't stop laughing. It's so bad it's actually good lol. Like another reviewer said, it doesn't take itself seriously. There's no way one could look at this movie and say that the makers did so.

This is one of Chaplin's First National films from the period between his glorious Mutual shorts and the more mature United Artists features. More opulent than the Mutual films, it continues Chaplin's quest for perfecting his comic expression. Most people forget that the film is actually a dream that Charlie has while awaiting being sent off to the front.There is plenty of slapstick via the Limburger cheese being used to gas the enemy, and Chaplin's foray into enemy territory dressed as a tree.By this stage in this career, the great man had become so immersed in filmic expression that his films give the impression of making themselves.

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan , where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion . It was my first movie in a movie theater, but not my last! Here are my thoughts on the film. First, the premise. A young and very talented blind man plays the titular role in Blind Spot. As his blindness progresses, he moves from his native city to a seedy neighborhood, where he becomes the “eyes” of a young woman who had her purse snatched at a bus stop.

Although this film never attained commercial notoriety, my experience has led me to conclude that many well-done pieces of artistic expression often do not gain mass appeal. The story line depicts a young boy stealing a car and embarking on a surreal, dream-like adventure with very little basis in our conceptualization of time and space. Therefore, anyone who attempts to view this film from the perspective of its conformity to reality will likely be disappointed; it is not intended to be "realistic." It is, however, intended to be metaphoric with extensive symbolism apparent to those with superb attention to detail.

I first saw The Buddy Holly Story when I was about seven years old . I had no idea who he was, but I could sense that this was a special film, that it was more than just another movie. My mom had already seen it, and it seemed like it was something we all had already seen. I remember asking my dad, “Why did we all see it?”

That’s when he introduced me to the band that Buddy Holly had been a member of, the Crickets. I thought it was so cool that someone could play music, just like me.

My friends and went through a period of time when we would rent movies that none of us had ever heard of. The only good that came from it was this movie, "Take it to Limit" Right as the movie started, we could tell we were in for a true classic. The music is probably done by rural white boys from Colorado, but it sounds just like early 90's rap. The star of the show, actor Leo Fitzpatrick, plays the bad-boy so well, especially sporting a big zit the entire movie.

I wonder why I have n't heard of this movie before . It 's truly a magnificent comedy ( I think it 's actually a musical) but I found it a tad overrated when I watched it years ago . The plot is that a bunch of teenagers are trying to find themselves and when they can't, they move to an old mansion and get themselves jobs . They have a lot of great songs and of course the comedy . I don't care what anyone says, the comedy is really good and the music and acting is great too .

1930's comedy mystery about "The Crooked Circle" a band of hooded crooks who set about plotting the murder of some one who swore to oppose them. Enjoyable but really unremarkable little film, the movie works simply because the cast headed by Zazu Pitts and James Gleason (both of whom would later appear together in a couple of Hildegarde Withers films after Edna Mae Oliver dropped out of that series) and supported by a great cast of actors and actresses you know but may not know the name of (I don't hence the lack naming).

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode, THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series. And, while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun, I really do have to cast my vote as this Romulan episode as being the very best.The movie, interestingly enough, is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounces back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise as it seeks to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outposts.

The film is n't perfect by any means but despite this it is very fun and amusing to watch . the movie is mainly a light-hearted comedy/adventure with the plot centered around a group of young women who are involved in an exciting adventure of sorts . the women are all from different walks of life with different views on life . the movie is set in new york in july , and focuses on a group of women in their 20's who are going to a party . the party starts and ends up going wild with the women throwing out a few of the party's guests including the host .

This is a 100 % improvement over the dross of a third movie and it 's one hell of a way to open a new decade. You know, at first I found this movie to be kinda funny, but after thinking about it for awhile, I just don't really see how it could be considered a comedy. But whatever. Anyway, I liked it a lot because it was not nearly as silly and boring as I was expecting it to be. And I was pleasantly surprised to find that the characterizations and plot were actually quite good.

I did not know what to expect when I decided to watch this documentary . I knew it was about something that was near and dear to me . It was about something I thought about a lot but didn't know how to discuss. It wasn't about politics or the economy. It was about a family. My family. We all watched together. I made us coffee and we sat on the couch together and watched this documentary. I had never talked about my family with anyone and I had never even seen a movie like this.

Chucky ( the murderous doll from `` Child 's Play '' and 2 crappy sequels ) is dead . But not to worry: Michael Berryman , who portrayed Chucky in the original film, will appear in an all-new sequel . ( For more on this story , check out the April issue of Sci Fi Magazine , out April 25 .) And you can read the interview here on the magazine's Web site . Berryman talked about the Chucky sequel , his other film projects, what he thought about the original film and his reaction to the recent news of Chucky's return .

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it . It 's one of the funniest comedies I have ever seen . I really enjoyed it a lot . The plot is good and there is nothing that you will not see in the movie , you can not miss it . Also it 's a comedy with a good story . The actors are really good and they do not miss a single thing . They make you laugh a lot , and this is a good thing to see . The plot is not complicated but it 's good and easy to understand .

The retelling of a classic story is set to the music of Burt Bacharach and lyrics of Hal David. The actors seem like real people in this fairytale of the outside world meeting with mystical Shangra-la. It is a joy to watch Bobby Van, whose acting puts me in mind of Red Buttons, and, as always, George Kennedy (Cool-Hand Luke) who always manages to carry gravitas in his roles. The surprise here is Charles Boyer as the elder High Lama. Who would have known? All-star cast including Michael York and Olivia Hussey makes this work a keeper for those of us who cherish people.

After learning that her sister Susan is contemplating divorce, Kate decides to travel to the distraught woman's remote country home and spend some time with her. When Kate arrives, however, Susan is nowhere in sight. That's because someone has murdered her and stuffed the body in a trunk in the basement. As a storm rages outside, Kate tries to figure out where her sister could have gone and places her own life in great danger...the killer is still on the premises! In her first post-BEWITCHED vehicle, Elizabeth Montgomery gives a solid dramatic performance.

These days , you rarely come by a kid 's show that does not involve 1 ) a preteen/teen popstar , or 2) a series based on the life of another famous person , like The Real Housewives or Gossip Girl . While it's not all bad , I'll bet the majority of shows you see are just for preadolescent boys and girls. If that's the case , and since there aren 's a whole lot more of the former, here are 5 of the most interesting TV shows that are for young girls. 5.

Obviously the previous reviewers here are not fans of this genre, but I think this one is done quite well.It's twistedly cute clever & dark. This story brought back memories of the types of girls I was in love with as a child.Also, it makes me want to check out some of Nadia's other movies, many youtube comments about how hot she is in this video. Sure there is some Burton influence here, but I wouldn't say this Brad is trying to rip him off.He is just jumping in & adding his talents to a genre that I can appreciate.

What can I say about the series dubbed the NEW OUTER LIMITS ... Hmm .... Only that this was one of the best TV shows of all time, along with The Twilight Zone which is in my Top Ten Series and I watched this show with the Twilight Zone for years on end. With the first episode, "The Invaders", I knew that this was an exceptional show ... And from the very first moment I saw this series, there was no question that I was hooked .... And so I watched this show with a tremendous amount of anticipation for the rest of its run!

SPOILERS BELOW ` A Dog 's Life ' was most noteworthy for its excellent comic timing . In Charlie Chaplin's best role , he is one of the most endearing, lovable creatures imaginable . Chaplin's ability to portray any kind of animal is incredible , and he made his dog into an unforgettable character . The only thing better about this picture than the performances is the production , which was one of Chaplin's most beautiful . It's one of the best films ever made about people and animals . . . and, yes , this film has a great ending !

I recently saw Blind Spot in Coyoacan, where it drew a huge crowd and some pretty intense discussion. I really admired the story and visual approach. The action is frightening and the mood of loneliness that the film projects is amazing. There is much beauty in the melancholy that surrounds these three misfit heroes. Not just in the desert but in the city too. My best scene was after the boy discovers his friends in the apartment and then rides his skateboard through all the remarkable lights of the city. You really feel for this guy.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji , a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the Meiji period (1868–1912) of the Meiji era. The film premiered on 29 January 2014 at the Japanese cinemas and later released as a DVD on 12 April 2014. It was produced and directed by Masakazu Oguro and written by Makoto Shinkai . Kenji was born in Tokyo, where his father, an art teacher, had taken up work in a printing house in the year of the Meiji Restoration. He was thus raised in an artistic and cultural environment where the arts and education were given equal importance.

First off , I absolutely loved this movie . As a Billy Crystal fan , I must say that I was really thrilled with this flick . Billy’s been in so , so many films over the years , but this might be his best work yet . This was a really touching and funny , heartfelt film . Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan were just perfect for the roles . And what was with that scene , where he goes around town telling people that he’s really , really , really into her , only to tell people that he isn’t interested when she walks up to him .

I love this movie a lot. I must get this on DVD. I have 2 VHS copies, but the quality is so poor that you can't read one written joke over the door of the ward. I'm forever amazed that Blankfield did almost nothing afterward. He made both Dr. Jeckle and Mr. Hyde totally believable.The movie is plagued by it's low budget. (One atrocious edit jumps into mid-word and was described on, "Siskel & Ebert".) But, there are a thousand jokes, sight gags to subtle references, that more than compensate.

When the trailer for Accepted first came up, many people began to get excited about seeing it... really excited. Who could blame them, it looked like fun. But that's exactly the thing. People went into Accepted looking for a good movie, but if you think about it, Accepted isn't the type of film destined to be a good movie. It's meant to be a film that pleases its crowd without too much effort being given. That being said, for those of you who expected a great film, you need to think about what could be made of a comedy like this one.

Fantastic Chaplin movie with many memorable moments as Charlie joins the army to fight in WW 1.At first he goes to France to become a boxer.He fights in many fights and is eventually kicked out for being a bully.He becomes a soldier and fights against the French in the war and is eventually awarded the Military Cross. The film is a must see. A Charlie Chaplin classic, with lots of amusing gags as he plays the various characters he is to impersonate. The most famous one is his famous tramp character. However, this is not the case here and the film does not really have that much comedy to it.

Certainly one of the most hilarious films of all time. Excellent original music, clever, heady...it's hard to be articulate about something this good. There isn't one character that you don't instantly love to watch- Myronex "Putney, there's trouble in the black room!" "My name is Rufus." The lines, thrown away left and right, are classics themselves, recalling Slapshot, Caddyshack, Anchorman, Repoman, Dolemite, any comedy whose dialog is not of the formulaic set-up punchline variety. "Putney, Myronex called you tasteless!"

I saw Borderline several years ago on AMC. I've been looking for it ever since. It was haunting: visual, textural, sensual. This movie took me somewhere like a dream and I didn't care where. I will never forget the curtain blowing in the breeze. I still remember the way it made me tilt my head. I remember my facial expression when I saw it. I didn't know what had happened when the movie was over, but I find life is that way. It didn't bother me.

What 's the point of this messages if not to discuss and share thoughts about the next season ... Here we go (and by the way, have a happy new year)

The first day of a new year is marked by hope. Hope that one day, we may be able to change the past. Hope that this year we may make the change to a better and more positive one. Hope to have good news for all those who have supported and cared for me. Hope for a happy ending for all of you.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances: Sanders, Patrick, and Blackmer. The scenes between Sanders and Patrick are particularly outstanding. Demming, as the detective, is unfortunately not nearly as good. He lacks the intelligence, strength, and cynical world view of a Bogart. Had Humphrey played this part, we could have had a classic.Pace, location (a library), and atmosphere are all good. But there are a few plot holes. Sanders strongly fears Blackmer and the ruthless organization (Nazis) he represents. Yet after mistakenly killing Blackmer, Sanders seems to experience no anxiety or remorse.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The film captures and interprets his artistic method ('sketching' poems), his inspiration (the spirit of nature and its fantastic beauty) and his struggles to accept a harsh reality in the face of his idealist imagination.The film integrated excerpts of Miyazawa's poems into the plot beautifully. His relationships with his students was powerful, especially in one scene where he offers everything he has to a student who has just been caught stealing materials from the classroom.

Then again, I like Rachael Ray. She is fun, sweet, fresh, and such a joy to watch. I have to alter just about everything she makes as I am a vegetarian...but it's great to see her with a program that shows more of her personality. After all, she is a television personality. I think it's cool that she is so inviting with her fans and still appears to be down-to-earth. The studio audience appears to be rather small, but that just makes for a cozier environment. Some people have posted that the show sucks.

I never realized what a fabulous dancer Lana Turner was until I saw this movie. She was only 19 years old and gorgeous. What a pleasure to watch her dance with George Murphy. The story line was typical for its day but the dancing was really special. I never tire of watching Fred and Ginger but Lana Turner in this movie was just as terrific. I always thought of Lana as a so-so actress who tended to over act. She should have done more dancing and less of the Maddam X and Peyton Place roles. I had a new appreciation for her after seeing this movie and her wonderful dancing.

When I saw this film at a festival years ago I was very impressed and I started to looking for more information. Then one day, my sister said she watched the film on Netflix, so I did the same. I was hooked from the start and I was fascinated by the different types of people that appeared in the movie and how they were able to get to where they were. It is an excellent documentary that is very easy to watch. I highly recommend this film for people who are looking for a great documentary to watch.

My impression, having seen this documentary, is that Nathaniel Kahn ended up with more questions than he had before he made the film. He took five years to make it, a labour of love and longing. I can only imagine the turmoil of the editing process, what to leave in, what to take out. His father, the renowned architect Louis Kahn,comes across as a man too selfish and self-absorbed to be emotionally available to even one wife not alone three. But like many men of his character, he attracted women who were spellbound by the remoteness and entranced by the creativity.

I love the TV contest. Hate to see it end. There are so many talented contestants. It's a shame that only 2 will be picked. I love watching the judges also. At times they are as entertaining as the contestants. I have been watching the show faithfully every Sunday night. Wouldn't miss it for the world. It's the best reality show that's ever been on television. Good luck to all the contestants, though I have already chosen the two who I would like to see play Danny and Sandy on Broadway.

Charles Chaplin 's 'Shoulder Arms ' of 1918 was his longest film to date , though , at just over 30 minutes , it was not nearly as long as some of his earlier short subjects , such as 'A Bushel of Straw' or 'The Kid ' which were nearly forty minutes long ! It was also a very fine film , directed by Chaplin's brother Charles Spencer who was responsible for the direction of some of Chaplin's very earliest shorts . The film is , of course , the story of Chaplin's experiences while he was an ambulance driver during the 1 st World War .

I saw this movie on it's opening night, and enjoyed it. I probably would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't been sitting by my father. My father saw the original (unfortunately, I have not seen it yet) and kept talking through the whole thing. He kept saying that the movie sucked, and that it was stupid. The thing is, he didn't understand that the creators were slightly making fun of the horror genre with the film. In every horror movie, there is always a certain character depicted.

This is a remake of the anime classic from the 80's, and this one is even better. Sylia, Nene, Linna, and Priss are all back as the Knight Sabers in their hard-suits battling the robotic boomers. The animation is crisp, the characters are well-developed, and the action rocks. Priss is a singer in her regular job, so the series features some wonderful songs as well. There is a fair amount of violence, but most of it is against robots, and there is some fan service, but nothing too racy.

I hope , from his seat on Heaven 's comedic throne , Spike Milligan can see and can enjoy this. In the meantime, please enjoy this, the last ever episode . It is with a mixture of regret and sadness that this episode is being put to rest . The BBC have decided that their budget is not big enough to show it again and I was unable to find a buyer for the tape and I don ' t know where to get enough money out of the bank to buy it back so that it can be made available to those who have never seen this masterpiece.

I loved this film , which I have just seen at the Philadelphia film festival . In March 2005 I attended the film's world premiere in Toronto. In the next month I was offered a chance to read the book before it was published , so I could write its review, which was published in April 2005 in the journal "Cinema Journal". That's when I learned that my review was too long , and that I was to rewrite it, and I accepted , so here is what I originally wrote. The book is well worth reading before seeing this film.

'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' is a fantastic film in itself. It is nothing like the book, which may disapoint its ardent followers. Yet, viewed on it's own, the film is a masterpiece. The views are spectacular and the acting isn't too bad either!! Nicolas Cage was brilliant-so different from his usual action hero type characters. Penelope cruz is superb and really holds the film together. I think that this film has to be judged as an indivdual project-not related to the book. Louis de Bernieres gave up rights to the film script, so the film is an interpretation of the director, john maddon.

Death Wish 3 is exactly what a bad movie should be. Terrible acting! Implausible scenerios! Ridiculous death scenes! Creepy, evil-for-no-reason villains! The last 30 minutes of this movie just might be the best 30 minutes ever put on film, especially in the scene where the decent, hardworking citizens string chains across the street, knocking down the evil bikers and then shoot them, only to be joined by the neighborhood children (!!!) in celebration. And how can I forget the elderly woman with the broom? She's sweeping out the scum!

James Franco is totally cool in this movie . Not just handsome and charismatic but genuinely open and vulnerable in a rare way. There is an honesty in his performance. I didn’t realize he was as good a filmmaker as he is. He is very creative and has a sense of humor. He seems to have a very good understanding of the material. There’s a great story line, too, and a lot of interesting material. He’s a very attractive guy, but there is something very appealing about him. The story is set in the 1980s.

The "all I have is 5 dollars and my wedding ring..." scene was a riot. I also guffawed at the scene in the bar where Hyde snorted the horse radish and flipped the bird to the Japanese guy and said "Pearl Harbor buddy". I think my IQ is higher than 115, but I'm not sure because I can't count that high.Funny thing, this 10 line requirement. Seems as though they would bash you for making your comments too long, not too short. I hope I don't make it to 1,000 words before I get to line 10.I'm still two lines short.

What I enjoyed most in this film was the scenery of Corfu , being Greek I adore my country and what it offers. I liked the fact that the film showed a different side of Greece , one of its more traditional sides, the one you would not expect to see. I also enjoyed the cast and the fact that this film did not focus on any particular person, but gave you the story of a whole country. It was not too long or too boring. I think it is a good introduction to Greece , a country I want to know better.

This Oscar-winning short film (40 minutes), based on a short story by William Faulkner, takes us back to small-town Tennessee in December 1941. Two brothers, one about 18 and one about 8 are looking for birds eggs (obviously a huge collectors item for boys in the South around this time). Well, the Japanese bomb Pearl Harbor and the older brother, Pete, decides to enlist. He gives his prize egg to his little brother, Willie and heads off wishing to show more emotion and tenderness to his little acolyte.

This version of `` The Lost Horizon '' is actually not a bad film at all . I think the main thing that makes this film so good is it's pure imagination . And the fact that it was one of the first films to use Technicolor . That being said , this is a little bit too long for my taste . I would have liked it to be a little shorter . I mean this is a very good film but there is nothing special in it . The only reason I would recommend you see it is purely for the fantasy and imagination .

I taped The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network and I watched The Morrison Murders on Lifetime , Lifetime Movie network , Lifetime Movie Network , The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network , TV Shows on Lifetime, Lifetime , The Morrison Murders on Lifetime Movie network on April 2, 2015 . It is about a college professor who is accused of killing his wife and her lover. It stars Jason George as the lead role . The first 2 minutes are not bad. Then the rest is a bunch of crap. It is a very poorly written TV show.

I will admit , I had the opportunity in the past to watch this film , and after about 5 or so times I could not bring myself to watch it again. I kept thinking “you will not like this”, and it would turn out to be the case as I would find myself disappointed in it’s story. With that said , I will say I now have the chance to review this film again and see what all the hype has to say . Story-wise I will say the plot is something that is hard to describe .

Well , what 's wrong with the title `` Separate Lies '' ( accused elsewhere of not being `` exciting ''), I don 't know, I just found it catchy. I read the whole thing...I don't want to repeat it because I enjoyed it so much. But anyway, I know you're probably too busy to respond to this...but you were right, the way I wrote it didn't come across the way I hoped, so I changed the title, and it seemed to come out better.

Sit back and let Director Bharatbala lead us into a visual and sensual voyage of the mind and spirit of India. When was the last time you could say you really enjoyed a movie? This movie has pace and keeps us moving in directions that may only exist in India. If you didn't want to visit India before this movie will surely make you want to visit it now. This movie has dancing girls, a chase scene, and the mafioso involved. But it has a lot more. Thanks, Bharatbala, for taking us on such a spirited and wonderful tale.

"Back in the Day" is an interesting, but flawed effort. Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper, a honest but sad man trying to cope with the death of his father. He meets his old friend J-Bone (Ving Rhames) who tries to force Reggie into a life of crime. Reggie also falls in love with Alica (Tatyana Ali) who is the preacher's daughter. Now he has to choose: Love Or Crime.Ja Rule does a competent job as Reggie. At least he's trying to act. Ving Rhames is perfect as J-Bone.

As an English teacher, I appreciate films that do more than tell a story. Good films, like good literature, cause one to think, reflect and predict. This film made me do all three. Mr. Jansen takes risks and uses foreshadowing, symbolism and interesting turning points for many of his characters. I also likes the fact that despite the choices the characters make in the film, their choices do not seem as adolescent or felonious as other films I have seen. The acting is pretty good and the actors seem to share a good chemistry with each other.

Jack, Sawyer and Sayid swim to the boat and find a completely wasted Desmond. His traumatic past experience before sailing to the island is disclosed through flashbacks. Sayid plots a plan with Jack to surprise "The Others" in case Michael is double-crossing the group. John Locke convinces Desmond to invade the hatch, which is protected by Mr. Eko, and not press the button of the computer to see what will happen.This episode is one of the best of the Second Season. Unfortunately, we lovers of "Lost" can see the lack of respect the producers of this stunning series have with the fans.

I think I was recommended this film by the lady in the shop I was hiring it from! For once she was bang on! What a superb film! First of all I was convinced James McAvoy & Romola Garai were Irish so convincing were their accents; and by half way through the film I was utterly convinced Steven Robertson was a disabled actor and pretty sure James McAvoy was also! When I watched the special features on the DVD and saw both actors in their 'normal' guise, to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!!

(Some spoilers included:)Although, many commentators have called this film surreal, the term fits poorly here. To quote from Encyclopedia Britannica's, surreal means:"Fantastic or incongruous imagery": One needn't explain to the unimaginative how many ways a plucky ten-year-old boy at large and seeking his fortune in the driver's seat of a red Mustang could be fantastic: those curious might read James Kincaid; but if you asked said lad how he were incongruous behind the wheel of a sports car, he'd surely protest, "NO way!"

If you get a chance to get a hold of this lost ( for many years ) gem , I recommend that you take the time to view it and enjoy it. It's a long one, at least 40 min, I believe. It was written by the late, great, Stan Lee . ( Lee wrote many, many, movies and tv episodes as well as comic books, but this is where he really shined!) I will try to keep this as brief as possible - but will give as much detail as time allows me.

Motorama viewers should already by keen on other offbeat b-grade desert-based films such as Bagdad Cafe or Repo Man (or if you’ve never heard of them, then you definitely need to give them a go), but Motorama is even better, as it features some of the funniest sequences in a desert film that’s been made in decades. This is the story of a group of outcast motorcyclists on a last journey before being buried in an unmarked mass grave. And as you can imagine, they aren’t exactly a happy bunch.

Considering it 's basically low-budget cast , this is a surprisingly good flick about the life and death of rock 'n' roll. Although it was shot in 1979 (and it 's one of the few films that 's actually set in 1976! ), the cast consists of young people in their late '20s or '30s. This is not a feel-good fable. Instead, the story of rock 'n' roll is the main point of interest. Of course there 's the usual clich?s about drugs and rock 'n' roll lifestyle (which I 've already mentioned).

Just as in `` Columbo '' we see the fatality occur right at the beginning . What follows is an amazing mystery about the life of a famous person, who has a wife and a young child, but the wife has suddenly disappeared. When we meet the famous woman in the first episode we see how she is dressed , we are introduced to the other people in the scene and the situation in the life of the famous actress. In this particular case she appears to be living with her husband, and has a young daughter , but it seems that there are other people in her life .

I got some free tickets via the Times to see this little know Irish movie called 'Inside I'm Dancing'... i didn't know a thing about it, so had no preconceptions before i went in.The film is about two guys who are confined to their wheel chairs, and live in a home. Michael (Steven Robertson) suffers from Cerabal Palsy and Rory (James McAvoy) suffers from Muscular Dystrophy (please excuse any spelling mistakes!). They form a bond, as Rory seems to be the only person who can understand what Michael is saying.

No, I have not seen the original series and I won't compare the two if I had. This series is filmed in Canada in Vancouver and Victoria, British Columbia. The series is well-written in a different story each week. Some are little out there but most of the time it is the quality of the story telling. I loved the Afterlife episode with Clancy Brown and Barbara Gerrick and the Deprogrammers episode with the irresistible Brent Spiner as a Deprogrammer in a world where humans have become slaves to a lizard reptilian species.

I saw this movie on PBS the first time . Then I bought the video and watched it countless times over the years. Finally, I got bored and bought the DVD. Now I'm glad I bought it! I'm an old fan and I haven't seen it for a long while. The movie has aged well and it's still very entertaining. I recommend this to anyone who loves action and comedy!... more

This is an incredible film. I think it deserves more credit than it has, which is saying alot.

Forget Easy Rider - Head is THE film about the 1960s.Almost laugh: as the Monkees reduce their entire career to a one-minute TV commercial about dandruff! See: the 50 foot Victor Mature try to figure out what the heck he's doing in this film! Hear: Frank Zappa (with his pet cow on leash) tell Davey Jones "Your music is awfully white"! Experience: the Monkees' only live performance as a real rock band play the honest-to-gosh first-ever real punk-rock song (Circle Sky)! Listen: as Davey Jones sings a Harry Nielsen song about having a transsexual father!

A very weird, psychedelic, esoteric, (and did I say weird? :) experience.But on at least on one level - it did exactly what it was supposed to do. It bridged the gap between the silly, manufactured, Hollywood look at teen pop idols that was the Monkees TV program and the adult, musically growing and evolving, and yet still a little silly Monkees of the '70s and beyond.The most important line in the film is Mike Nesmith's, "If they think we are plastic now, wait till they see how we do it."

I went to the pre-screening of `` Rory O'Shea Was Here . '' I like this movie better than I thought I would. It's fun to watch, and it isn't boring like a lot of these pre-screenings are. I really liked Rory. I think the movie works really well for him. I was disappointed he didn't have more time to develop, but that's a real movie problem. Also, I was kind of disappointed he couldn't stay a little on screen longer - I think the story really needed him to get involved in more of it.

Double Shock is one of the many good Columbo episodes which reaches the level of a good movie.It has all the necessary ingredients that make a good movie. Good acting, a good script, and some really good scenes which keep the viewers captivated. The problem is that I can't remember many of them. Maybe it's because of the fact that it was an old episode that was a little out of my taste. It was more of an American movie, which is a big turnoff when I watch them. There are only two scenes that I remember in this episode.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange . I was confused , sad, angry, confused and happy. It was a very emotional film. I have not felt that much while watching a film.I could not understand the ending and the story but it was really touching. It made me very emotional and sad. I really liked the movie, the way it was directed. The acting and music were very good. My favorite part was when Rishi Kapoor's character was talking to his friend. The part where he talked about his father.

This is a brilliant film. The story starts off in Romania,where Billy Crystal stars as an agent who can talk anybody into doing anything. There is a really funny scene here, where Crystal is a child, and talks his father, who is a rabbi into eating pork (you filmophiles may know that this is a parody of Crystal's religion). He is mainly a talent scout, and he's trying to find a suitable villain for his latest movie. After finding out that the whole film has a terrible crew, he accidently falls into a small river.

There are a select few cartoon films where animals or something "not human" is portraying human beings and I think that this film is one of them. Apart from a few points of the plot and the characters - this film could be changed with all people rather than mainly animals. Although - it's good someone did not - I feel the cats are jolly good in this film portraying humans! :-)This film also focuses on quite a lot of adult issues - which is rather odd for a Disney film.

If you've never experienced the thing that is Zasu Pitts, here is a Zasu zinger! In 1933 Mae Questel caricatured Pitt's voice for the character Olive Oyl for the Fleischer Studios animated cartoon version of the comic strip Popeye. Zasu (pronounced Zay-Sue) does her best "Olive Oyl" impersonation walking around whining and ringing her hands or attaching herself to the policeman's laynard. I kept waiting for her to say "ohhh myyyy", but instead it's "something always happens to somebody." The first time I saw this film I loved Zasu and found her character really funny.

Another great Tom Wilkinson performance punctuates "Separate Lies," a 2005 film also starring Emily Watson, Linda Bassett and Rupert Everett. Directed by Julian Fellowes, it's the story of a married couple, James and Ann Manning where the husband (Wilkinson) believes he and his wife (Watson) are happy together. An accident near their house on the night they have a party brings the police around. It is a hit and run that killed their maid Maggie's Bassett) husband. James becomes suspicious of a neighbor, Bill Bule (Everett) when he sees some damage on his car.

NIGHTS IN RODANTHE brings back to the screen two talented actors in Diane Lane and Richard Gere in a simply beautiful story of a man and a woman hungry for something more in their lives than they have at present. The chemistry between Lane and Gere is magical from the first scene in the film to their last embrace. The locations, beauty of their attraction for one another when it unfolds when they first meet, and the story that follows, and as they begin to know each other with the attraction they feel towards each other is real, is romance that is projected to an audience with tender care.

Thanks to the helpfulness of a fellow IMDb member I've just managed to watch this film for the second time in nearly twenty years, and I can honestly say it hasn't lost any of its kick. I can't believe that Channel 4 have let this one vanish without a trace as it is an extremely powerful, moving and moralistic take on the consequences of misplaced loyalty. It focuses on a clique of friends over the course of ten years and their relationship with two 'outsiders' from school; specifically how they use one and mercilessly torment the other.

Enchanting . The best time to see this movie is sometime when unhappy or sad . It 's all just a story . But you can feel the characters ' sorrow and sadness . It really shows you how good they are . It 's not just some boring movie but you get to know people 's emotions . The story line is great . I like how they make you feel about the characters and how it changes throughout . This is the best I have seen so far . This movie should be in every single person 's collection . This is the best ever . Amazing .

`` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is one of the coolest Italian horror films I 've ever seen , but I'm pretty sure that you need to be fluent in Italian to dig it. If you '' speak '' it , you 'll see why. It 's really good , and I'm sure that if you get past the fact that the story takes place '' '' during World War II '' '' in Italy , you 'll dig it . It has a lot of really great scenes, and I can 't stress enough how much I adore the fact that the film is set in Italy during that period.

Do you liked `` Dead Man do n't wear Plaid '' ? What about `` Top Secret '' and `` Trenchcoat ''? If you do, then I highly suggest you go play The Dark Eye 2! The Dark Eye 2 has all new classes, weapons, enemies and more! And it's an action RPG too! It's pretty much exactly like the original Dark Eye, except it's even more awesome! There are three new classes, each of which has their own very unique fighting style and abilities that make them feel completely different from other classes and unique from one another too.

Gary Busey did a splendid job playing the rock-n-roll legend Buddy Holly(1936-59). He does have a spitting image to the man. Being a garage band in the 50's is sure different from today's. Having a group of three is usually simple back in those days. I bet that Buddy Holly(Busey) was a much better musician than most of what I heard. Since he lived in Lubbock, Texas, it was only a quiet country town back then. His parents were Christians, though his mother was a strong supporter of her son's work.

Easily Lucio Fulci 's most respected film , `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' is highly renowned for it s outstanding performance by Dario Conti . This film was first released in 1969 and was inspired by actual events. The film follows the story of an American soldier named Jack (Conti), who is caught in a fire fight and takes refuge in an African church. However, the church is later bombed by the American military, which leaves Jack alone and injured. He is then carried off by some African hunters and taken back home to America to recuperate.

I was surprised and touched by this emotional movie which moved me very strange. I was confused, sad and happy in the same moment. I guess that too less people will pay attention to this movie. But I hope that at least a few will see it and get something out of it. The story of two friends, linked by their suffers of bodily disability, whom (as a team) beat the medical well-fare system and fight for their rights. This movie shows a side which some of us would never understand, not too exaggerated but emotional presented.

OK , so I loved Rachael Ray before , but now , I ADORE her ! How innovative . I think a lot of us could stand to take a Rachael Ray type of cooking style and apply it in our kitchens , right here in the Midwest . Here's to her and to us . . . You're doing great. You'll do much better in the next round, I'm sure of that. You're not going to win the whole contest but the judges will be looking at what you're doing and seeing the improvement over last time.

This is a good film , no doubt , but with some odd aspects . Without spoiling anything it takes place on the other side of the world , a world which , for the most part , seems to consist of one family who are all in some way connected , but not one of the family is aware of the others , and it is not until someone from the family gets into a serious accident , that the whole of the family realise that they are related and that they have been living in an attic , under a pile of old paper , in a city , for the last 40 years or so .

Considering all of the comedies with a military situation that have been done in history, someone had to be the first. One could make a case that in Shoulder Arms, Charlie Chaplin invented the genre.Hard to believe that back then this was a daring move. When you consider that some of the best films involving such people as Bob Hope, Abbott&Costello, Laurel&Hardy involved military service and made during war time, it's just something you accept and laugh at.In the First World War Chaplin along with fellow stars Douglas Fairbanks and Mary Pickford went out on bond tours.

This film biography of early rock and roll star Buddy Holly (1936-1959) is a tour de force for Gary Busey. The movie's highlights are Busey's stage performances where he plays guitar and sings Holly songs. He brings such energy to the performances that Holly's own filmed performances almost pale in comparison. Busey's infectious toothy grin lights up the screen, he creates a totally believable and winning personality and his Oscar nomination for best actor was well deserved.The film follows Holly's career from growing up in Lubbock, Texas, to stardom and New York and his untimely death in a plane crash.

I saw this movie on late night TV out of Buffalo about 30 years ago and I'm dying to see it again one more time before I... well.. you know. The interaction between the main characters after the Tiger (Eli Wallach) "captures" his prey (Anne Jackson) in a botched kidnapping attempt is absolutely hilarious. Charles Nelson Reilly's portrayal of a neurotic university dean(?) or department head is priceless. How many films can you name which are able to illuminate humanity's struggle for meaning and fulfillment by making you laugh from beginning to end?

by TyNesha Mells . In this drama , Ja Rule , who stars as Reggie , struggles with the loss of his mother , who died when he was just a kid. Ja Rule wrote the script. The drama has not been picked up by any networks. "We've seen some of it. We've seen some footage, but there's nothing really to get excited about," he tells MTV News. "It wasn't something that really came together, it was something that we were thinking about, and Ja Rule was writing it.

To say the truth , I went to see this movie only because Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor . I was impressed by the script . It's not easy to develop a movie based on a book and it's even harder to make a movie out of a comic book and I really liked that . This movie really has a great cast and it looks really good . There's not much of a message in the movie because it doesn't talk about the origin of this superhero but it focuses more on his everyday life and the problems this character has in his personal and professional lives .

When the new Outer Limits first started , the episodes were quite optimistic and challenging . As the series began to mature, the focus shifted towards darker subjects, including war . However, the writers were quick to realize that the audience was more accepting of a story if they saw the end results , so the episodes became less grim and more optimistic. This shift was evident when the title sequence started with a shot of the audience in the studio, rather than one of the actors on the set. This approach was taken in “ The Man in the Canvas ” .

I tend to get furious when hearing about Lucio Fulci's reputation as a director. Too often he's categorized as a no-talented filmmaker, only out to shock and disgust entire audiences with images of pure gore. True, his films contain more explicit filth and sickness as your average mainstream American production, but his films always are of wide range and the plots are gruesomely morbid. Don't Torture a Duckling is yet another story! This film is a pure gem of the Italian shock cinema! I easily dare to call this film a masterpieceit's an old-fashioned giallo that includes all brilliant aspects of genuine horror.

I've commented once on this Chucky great, but I had to do it again to say some things about the film, when I first saw it in a great balcony in a great theater. The film was a lot of fun in the theater and my first Chucky film ever in a theater, and that was a special moment for me, because I cherish Chucky. The other horror villains are referenced with GREAT COOLNESS!!! And the gore was shockingly great! The scene where the gay kid gets nailed by the truck was amazingly cheerful!

What a surprise . A basic copycat of the comedy classic 'The Nutty Professor ' only naughtier . Funny guy Eddie Murphy gives a comical take on the classic Professor Humbert Humbert as he takes over the role of his son from age of 7 to 10 . With his son away in boarding school he takes over his old role and begins to be a real nutty professor . Will he be caught ? Will he get away with it ? Will he make it out of the college ? Will he have any friends ? What a fun and funny film .

Charles Chaplin's 'Shoulder Arms' of 1918 was his longest film to date, though, at just over 45 minutes in length, it was not quite a feature film. With World War One just drawing to a close, many popular entertainers of the time were doing their part to inspire their native troops, and Chaplin was no exception. And so the lovable Tramp went to war! The film begins with the Tramp in training, and the character is hilariously inept at even the simplest military drills, including marching and gun-slinging, much to the disgust of his drill sergeant.

That 's right . Ohwon ( the painter and the main character ) is an exceptional person . What strikes me the first is he is a good man . He always takes care of people . Even though he lives in a strange country he helps his friend . I 'm sure that he is a good friend to his friend . However , I can ' t understand what 's the reason of his action . He wants to help his friend but he couldn 't . Then what 's the reason ? He is a good , kind person . I think so .

The success of SCREAM gave birth to a whole new horror flicks wave. I'm happy with that, as a big fan of horror, and I liked most of those new horror films. BOC is a one big pack of horror. Colorful, fast paced and original. I see this movie more like the opening of a new trilogy (much like Episode 1 and Aliens: Resurrection) since it comes up with a new twist. Instead of focusing on the little boy-killer doll relationship we have here a twisted movie about couples. We have the sweet young lovers in contrast with the killer crazy doll-sized lovers.

This interesting film noir features three very good performances : Sanders , Patrick , and Blackmer . The scenes between Sanders and Blackmer , in particular , are simply fantastic. The film has a unique feel , and some of its scenes and performances stand out for me more than others , but overall this was a fun and enjoyable film noir thriller . The film starts with a car accident. We learn that Sanders, a lawyer who has just arrived at a New York court , was driving the car . He survives the crash, and wakes up in the hospital.

`` Back in the Day '' is an interesting , but flawed effort . Ja Rule stars as Reggie Cooper , a talented young rapper . Reggie has big plans for his music , but he's having trouble meeting his goals . Because of this , Reggie is constantly in danger . He's been kidnapped by a group of drug dealers who believe he has information on a rival gang . Reggie escapes and tries to hide from his drug dealers . Eventually , he has to go on the run to save his life . The film starts off with Reggie Cooper in jail .

I saw this film at a small screening . Even though it had a low budget , the creative direction was amazing and the performances were good. The film takes place on a small island in the middle of the ocean, which has become home to the survivors of a terrible disaster. There is one ship left that was trying to escape the disaster. In the film, a couple of the people on board who survived the disaster, find the remaining ship and try to take over control of it. They kill the captain, and take the passengers to the island.

I have to admit that I approached this movie with a sense of expectation and dread . Louis de Berniere’s story of 15th century piracy in the Bahamas is set in a time and place where we know a lot, and I found myself thinking that I had seen all of this before. There were scenes from this story that were just like the ones I had already seen, and some of those scenes were just horrible in the book. It would be fair to say that the main problem in this movie was that this was an adaptation of a book that I thought I had read before.

I do not think that this movie deserves the low rating that most will give it. It's one of the best "teenager" horror films I've ever seen; and that's saying a lot. Nothing is left without an explanation to back it up, the characters and plot break countless horror movie stereotypes, and it has got nothing to do with some other horrible pieces we've been submitted to lately. (A clear example is the mindless "Saint Ange".) The first 30-40 minutes might be downright boring with the exception of the beginning, although some minor light mistakes can be easily spotted.

I was so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007 .
